do not restrict ya'll. i got some news from my doctor that made me feel anxious enough to think it would be a good idea to restrict because "of course that will make me feel better " was driving home going 75 on the fucking highway and started to get blurry vision and disassociate from the lack of food in me other than an energy drink. no joke, could've passed out and likely died. don't play with this shit. it's not quirky or fun. it's fucking dangerous. imagine spending your last minutes alive starving and staring off into space because of malnutrition, that shit stinks. take of yourselves everyone, and go get a snack.

psychadelics. hello everyone i am going to do half a tab of acid on saturday and i wanted to ask if anyone has had a positive reception with it, i'm not expecting it to fix me permanently especially at such a low dose but i just want to have some direction. if anyone can help i'd appreciate it if you want some more context or something to my situation feel free to look at my post history, thank you

my cousin has an eating disorder. how do i deal with it?. my cousin 17, f used to have a healthy body a few years ago. she would eat happily eat with us, without any worry. i don't exactly remember when, but around the beginning of the pandemic she started to lose weight. she would tell us about her new exercise regime and diet. we thought nothing of it at first, but we slowly noticed how she would exercise for 2 hrs every time, she would eat way less, and eventually start to vomit the little food she had. this went on for more than a year, until she admitted to us a couple of months ago that she knew what she was doing was wrong, and misses the times where she would eat without much restriction. she's been trying to recover ever since but she says that her body can't help but vomit out what it intakes. aside from that, our extended family has been reproaching her and making her feel guilty for her condition. now she's ashamed of her condition and doesn't want professional help because of how costly it would be for her family. she blames herself for the condition she has. i don't know how to help her, i don't know anything. the best i can do is to push her to professional help, but what can i do when she herself tries to reject that help, saying that she doesn't care if she dies early; if her body can't take the damage from her eating disorder, then it can't.

recovering with a partner who also has disordered eating?. has anyone recovered from an ed while being in a relationship where the other person also has an ed, or has disordered eating habits? how do you keep yourself from being triggered on bad days where they don't eat? any advice greatly appreciated

honoring hunger. i find that i m eating meals and snacks but still restricting within those meals and snacks if that makes sense. for example, if i m still hungry after eating breakfast it s really hard for me to go and get more food, cause i know the guilt will put me in such a bad mood and i feel like this is preventing me from fully honoring my hunger. anyone have any advice for this?
a meal plan as a minimum. so you know how people say a meal plan is a minimum, should i still have my night snack even if i ate loads above my meal plan after dinner because i was hungry?

fear. i've finally got a nutritionist appointment for this month, and i'm fucking terrified. funny thing is i was the one who asked for it in the first place, as i knew that seeing a professional would help me a lot in my recovery journey. but now that i've got it, i want to cry out of fear. i'm scared of how much i might weight, of what the doctor may say, of getting a strict diet to gain weight again, and lots of other things that just make me nervous to think about. i don't know if this is me who is scared, or my ed, or both. but, whoever's scared, is scared shitless. and is becoming desperate. all this today's extreme hunger is not working out pretty well; ate lots of carbs mainly bread , more than usual in general, and i'm considering to have a really simple soup for dinner to ease my mind even though i know i shouldn't do it, that i should still eat. but, sadly, i don't think i can handle anymore for today, as i'm feeling totally miserable and just want to go to sleep.

tell me not to do it. almost seven months of full recovery, after trying to get to this point for the last three years, and i m telling myself just one month. we ll see what makes you happier . i just need someone to tell me not to. remind me why i have to recover.

social anxiety and eating. i need help so my dumb ass is letting a friend stay with me for two weeks in my tiny studio apartment bc she had nowhere else to go. unfortunately, it s basically impossible for me to eat with other people around. meals can be okay, but i feel so embarrassed to eat snacks, which is a problem bc i m used to eating basically 6 small meals a day. idk how to cope with this. it makes me so angry and anxious that she s around all the time, screwing up my normal food routine. and i feel weird eating my safe meals because they don t look normal enough, and i m scared of being judged. how do i keep eating when it s so viscerally uncomfortable to do so with another person in my space?

vacation leeway with food choices. despite it being conventionally "unhealthy", i have now managed to enjoy delicious "unhealthy" things almost every day for a week my mental hunger in combination with it being vacation which i know is a bad excuse to honor my hunger has allowed me to eat; monday ice cream tuesday didn't fancy anything wednesday hot cocoa thursday waffles friday ice cream saturday milkshake, hot cocoa, and like, 4 grams of chocolate sunday a restaurant dessert, plus like 1 grams of "fancy" chocolate my brother gave me for my birthday monday birthday cake and more chocolate amp; x2 b; i know it doesn't seem like much, but for me this is absolutely insane and my ed is telling me i've become a sugar addict and i'm on my way towards "unhealthiness", obesity and diabetes. but i will push forward oh, and by the way, none of these "unhealthy" snacks came instead of my normal meals, but in addition

visiting my restrictive parents is so hard. i am 31, and try and get back to spend a week with my parents ever summer. man oh man, is it eye opening these days as to where my issues arose from. they both barely eat, and judge each other and me constantly for their food choices. some comments from my dad over the days i ve been there have you got enough there? you aren t going to eat all that are you? what you ve eaten all that already? etc etc. my mum cooks up the food at home and deliberately serves it so she has 1 2 every one else s portion, so she can be smug about eating less. my dad barely eats in front of anyone. he then eats at night when everyone else is in bed. it feels like a constant competition for who can eat the least. honestly it s so eye opening.

first few days of recovery. when you went for recovery, what did your first 4 days week look like? just eating all day whatever you want, adding in a few things each day, eating loads one day and then less the next, etc? moreso specific to those who went all in

i feel alone. hi i m 17f who admitted herself into the children s hospital may 3 th of this year. i ve been in the hospital for about 2 months and i feel hopeless and depressed. everyday feels the same and i m sick and tired of it. i was in the emergency room for a month and now i m only at the hospital lunch now, i have earned passes and they get longer as i get better. i want to be assessed by my psychologist but apparently my brain isn t nourished. i m sick and tired of the doctors and my parents telling me that my brain is still unwell from the malnutrition. i m sick and tired of seeing my body in the mirror and noticing the weight gain. i hate myself and my body i hate how i did this to myself i hate how this illness ruined my summer and my life. i just want to be a normal teenager and to have a normal summer. i m sick and tired of people showing me pity. what i ve learned from this whole experience is that people only care about you when your stuck in a hospital bed. i hate my life and i see no hope in the future. i wish i was out and i wish i can exercise and move again like i used to. i wish i could hangout with people and not be stuck at home all day. i spend the whole day just moping around and eating. please help, how do i get through this awful feeling

so over this shit literally. pissed that i haven t been able to shake my purging lax abuse cycle. just makes it so hard to function and be productive in my daily life, so embarrassing and beyond frustrating. pls send good vibes lt;3

not a good day. today i ate more than usual, specifically carbs lots of bread and some cookies which even in recovery never did until now, and i'm feeling miserable. i think i'll let my anorexia win this time as i'm planning on having just a little bowl of soup with maybe and egg as dinner to feel a little better with myself. i really want to justify this way of eating today, maybe is because due to school i couldn't eat when my body asked me to and that ended up in my eating what i did not eat in the morning? i dont know, but i feel awful and lost, i hate it. i really wanted to try and make myself a tuna omellet with, maybe, a tiny bit of cream cheese but i guess i'll have it another day. i dont think i can handle any more food for today. anyone else has this fixation with carbs? with me is bread buns, tiny wholewheat bread buns that taste delicious but still hate eating bc it makes me feel like i've lost all control. i knew that days like today would come, but never thought how bad one could actually feel like. recovery is hard, hope is falling apart, and i'm falling apart too. this sucks.

weird point in recovery. so i m at a weird place in recovery rn and could use some support. i m weight restored and i don t have any fear foods left. i rarely use behaviors and am eating pretty normally now. the only thing is, i m still struggling to accept where my body is right now. i feel constantly bloated but i also don t have the urge or ability really to restrict. for one, it makes me feel like i m not fully recovered and that i have to keep going. but on the other hand, it makes me feel like i failed my ed. i think it s really just the constant and unrelenting stomach discomfort that makes me feel like i ll never be ok in my own skin. i literally wake up and go to bed feeling stuffed and idk how to keep going

food to recover. i want to preface this by stating that i m trying to restore my relationship with all foods and movement to escape the hell that i ve lived in for years. i just have a kinda scientific query. restoring nutritional health fat:fat free mass etc seems to be one aspect of recovery, along with neural rewiring. from an evolutionary point of view, if we were in famine as cavemen, as many of our ancestors with our genetics were, processed foods would not have been available for obvious reasons. did human physiology adapt and evolve to replenish body stores, etc by eating minimally processed foods? has modern industrialised society hacked this process, and can this somewhat disregulate our metabolism as a result if we choose more palatable processed food to recover? i know the psychological aspect of this disease is arguably a much bigger problem. i m sure many of you would contend that putting morals on food choices precludes recovery in the first place. i honestly don t mean to guilt anyone for however they choose to eat, i m just interested in getting your opinions and learning from your experience of recovery.

do you have any advice on how to stop comparison in recovery?. hey guys i'm in early recovery from a restrictive eating disorder and something i really struggle with is comparison. for exemple if i want an ice cream but no one else does then i'll probably won't eat the ice cream because i don't want to eat more than others... however if everyone is eating ice cream i will also get one : but yeah do you have any advice on how to stop comparison and finally be able to fully concentrate on what i want to eat regardless of what other around me are eating or not eating ? thanks xx

no eh at all.... i still need to gain a bit of weight and recover my period. i'm trying to eat more but i'm struggling. not even mentally, just i don't want to eat. i feel full quickly and i haven't got any eh at all, not even mentally. i don't know what to do.

differentiating extreme hunger vs binge. hi all, my history with food, body image, and exercise is complicated to say the least. without going into too much detail, over the past year year and a half i have been struggling with restricting binging, periods of over exercise, and i think i ve been experiencing extreme hunger all along and not feeding it. my struggles with this really started a year and a half ago when i was experiencing severe gi issues some of which i still have and was put on a super restricted diet. i later found out that i have a bunch of allergies intolerances as well allergic to 6 8 main allergens . so, my diet was inherently restricted due to my gi symptoms and allergies. along side of this i fasted and or had time restricted feeding windows in an attempt to help with my gi distress. on top of all of this i am extremely active. over 2 , steps a day at work, plus running cycling 5 6 days a week, and 2 3 days of strength training per week. everything compounded and led my body to be in a imbalanced state for a very long time. my restriction and then inevitable binges have gotten so out of control recently i realized that i really need help. one thing that was really messing me up was restricted feeding windows. i would only allow myself to eat at meal times. absolutely no snacking in between. even if i had finished a long hard workout i would still wait until meal time to eat most of the time. i have a therapist and we ve discussed the basics of my eating disorder, but i have still been struggling a lot in silence. i took it upon myself to meet with an ed centric dietician last week and she prescribed that i eat 3 meals and 3 snacks a day. the snacking was new to me as i only allowed myself to eat at meal times. snacking has been difficult because my body is so used to only getting food at certain times, it keeps telling me to eat more. now with the context set, i m struggling to differentiate a binge vs extreme hunger. i guess with binges they are either a result of restriction or some kind of emotional problem im trying to cope with food. my mental hunger is through the roof at all times. i was quite literally always thinking about food. is giving in to the mental hunger and eating a lot of food all at once a binge or extreme hunger? i struggle to stop eating whenever i start and that s why i started restricting so much. another thing i need to address is my activity levels. i m currently training for a triathlon so my daily needs are higher than most. i need some form of exercise in my life but i am considering pulling back on this for now until i get healthy. my question is should i listen to this mental hunger and eat 1 unrestricted in the hopes that my hunger fullness cues return? i really need to get a grip on this. if you made it this far, i appreciate you taking the time out of your day to read it. thank you

i hate this. i hate what this disease does to me i hate that i lie to my boyfriend i hate that i waste so much money on binge food i hate how bed amp; depression cycle and spiral together i hate that i feel so out of control i hate that now i m in therapy amp; seeing a dietician i m more aware of what i m doing but aren t at the stage where i can stop myself i hate the physical affects it has on my body i hate the time i waste that could be on literally anything else i hate that it s so misunderstood i hate that all i want to do is lose weight, but at the same time hate myself for wanting that

i feel like recovery isn t supposed to be this hard. like it s supposed to be hard i know, but not this hard. i m literally falling apart at the seams and every day i wake up is just misery until i manage to fall asleep and then wake up and repeat the next day. i swear i ve been having a week long panic attack, like my anxiety and nerves do not let up ever and it s literally hell to experience. half my day is spent crying and the other half eating. i m unable to function or get anything done because i m unmedicated for my adhd so i legit just stare at the wall or at my phone all day while the chatter in my head just goes on and on and on. i feel like all in wasn t a good idea for me because i don t have any coping mechanisms set up for my other mental health problems and i have no idea what to do. i literally feel like i m living in hell. i also feel like my 24 7 heightened cortisol nervous system is gonna make my extreme hunger last forever. i m sad and stressed and panicking and afraid of getting pushed into a relapse. i hate this i just want to be at peace and have my life back

fear of losing value. i know it s stupid but after i lost a lot of weight, despite it being evidently unhealthy, i stopped being mocked for my body, most relatives and people i met made compliments, and i felt for the first time good in my skin even if then i related losing weight to good, and it spiralled into wanting to lose always more , and i also felt valued for the first time. i just started eating a bit more as i m now completely in the hands of a nutritionist but i feel like after i ll get some weight, being it in the normal range or overshoot, i ll get back to feel embarrassed and mocked. i don t know how to avoid attaching all this value to my body, because despite what we can say, we live in a society especially in my country italy where beauty and thinness is sort of a standard, you are expected to respect it and if not you are open to mockery and strange looks. already now that i eat a lot, my parents changed behaviour and started pointing it out, also relatives saying i m finally getting back some chubby belly even in an ironic way make me feel like shit. do you have any suggestions? also as i read a lot, any book on this topic would be helpful.

got my period due to hormone pills, how will i know when my body is healthy?. so i ve been prescribed estrogen birth control pills because my endometrial lining was so thin due to restriction the doctors were scared i would develop cancer. they said when i finished the pills i would get my period cause of medicine withdrawal i just got my period for the first time in 2 3ish years and goddamn it is so painful. usually getting your period back naturally is a sign that you re recovered. but the thing is i am still kind of underweight, so how would i know i when my body is healthy?

tips for finding community in recovery?. obviously this can feel like a really isolating thing to go through i am only at the very beginning of my recovery and while i have told my boyfriend and my best friend, and am grateful for their love and support, i feel really alone in this process. i d really like to connect with other people struggling and find a group or community somehow which could provide emotional support and motivation to recover, but i don t know where to begin : has anyone had any good experiences in finding community in recovery or any tips for where i could begin to look?

i love my family in mexico. i m on vacation in mexico for a month so i m unable to weight myself and track my calories which is killing me and i think making me eat less. anyway i m here to visit my part of my family and they have no idea i have a ed but do notice how i eat very little. they always encourage me to eat more which i love but don t ever accept. during dinner they started cheering for me to eat more i wanted to but my ed voice was telling me not to i ended up doing so and i loved it ofc, the guilt is gonna eat me up later in the night and probably gonna have me restrict tomorrow but im currently savoring it by eating a box of donuts which my grandma gave me to eat all to myself

how do you handle intuitive eating going back to eating like you did pre ed?. i know the answer may seem a bit obvious, "just eat when you're hungry, stop when you're full," but as i'm sure we all know that is much easier said than done. i struggled with an eating disorder for about two years; pretty under weight, dangerously low heart rate, near hospitalization. i went on a meal plan about seven months back and i've been back to healthy weight for about a month. the thing is: i'm still terrified of weight gain and struggle to not count calories. i'm at the point where my hunger cues are back and stable, but every day is still a mental war. intuitive eating is tough because i have reliable hunger cues but am still obsessing over foods, eating the same meals because i know their calories, and having minor freak outs when i "go off track" according to what i set up in my head. i guess my question is: how do you all handle intuitive eating while still experiencing difficult thoughts? i haven't had a true non calorie counting day in weeks because i'm so terrified of what my mind has villainized for years. do you all have any tips for intuitive eating and getting back to eating like you did pre eating disorder? thanks

i might be triggering for my friend and i feel awful about it. my friend and i know each other since last year and she is just an year older than me, in the past week we joined together a volunteering camp where i really tried to challenge myself to eat more and in a non disordered way. i didn t succeeded everyday, it was rough and at the end i didn t manage to eat pasta as i would have liked or having a snack in front of others instead closed in the bathroom because i was too embarrassed. although no one really pointed out my behaviours and no one noticed. but my friend referred in a subtle way to how light i am, how much will power i manifest it was related to the fact that i got injured and i di don t complain at all . then we all went to the sea side, where i worn a bikini and played games despite being ungodly uncomfortable. but still no one could tell and i was praised for looking so confident than we were building a human pyramid and everyone was insisting for placing me at the top being the lightest and i was embarrassed and i rather suggest to place one of the younger girls my friends snapped come on you must weight at least 2 kg less than me and is true my friend have really bad self esteem problems and we agreed that seeing a phycologist would be really beneficial. in our way home i noticed she was comparing all her photos and she opened up about how much she despise her body and about her mother it was so hurtful and i recognised a lot of disordered thoughts and in general a really bad situation, but this isn t effecting for now her relationship with food. i tried to explain that she look good, she genuinely do, bad that she do is attractive for someone around but still she told me you must weight at least 2 kg less than me it s so painful, she is her, my friend, even if she weights more than me and is build like a door. i fear i am triggering i know that it s not actively my fault but god is awful
why in recovery some people have extreme hunger and some don't ?. i'm just curious ?

not sure where to get help. i have food related ocd and contamination ocd. i know those aren t exactly eating disorders, but the emily program website was saying that it could be related to arfid or something like that. i think i need to get help or at least consult a professional about this but i m not sure where to go. the two options that i know of in my state are the emily program and melrose. everyone i ve talked to says both places treat you terribly. i have oral allergy syndrome i am allergic to many foods basically and because of those things i m very scared to get help because i don t want to be dismissed or see a doctor that isn t educated on my medical condition and on ocd. i have no idea where to start looking for help with this specific issue and was wondering if anybody had any guidance?

how do you deal with bad body image days?. i ve been having them recently and it s very triggering aha. for a few days i haven t been able to go on my regular walks, which both is and isn t a disordered habit i genuinely enjoy my walks and it s a time for me to clear my head and jam out to music, but it s also been my primary form of exercise and i ate a bit more high cal foods than maybe i normally would which i thought should be fine, i m challenging myself and my ed and i should be allowed to eat yummy food but now i m feeling intensely guilty and bad about myself and the way i look. i have ibs and my stomach has been upset that last day or two, so that might be part of it, but i can t shake this fear that i ve failed myself somehow even though logically i know there s nothing wrong with gaining weight or looking any type of way . i don t want to hide out in my usual comfy clothes because it s hot af outside and i don t want to reinforce the idea that i have to hide my body, but i m also terrified of wearing clothes that show off everything i m insecure about right now. i m terrified of what people will think of me, especially my family for some reason because i ve always been the small one. i haven t yet worked up the courage to talk to anyone in my real life about this disorder, so i ve been attempting recovery on my own for 2 3 months now. but i have no idea how to get through these types of days without slipping into disordered thoughts and habits, or at least letting it ruin my whole day

therapy. i have a meeting with my therapist tmr and this is only gonna be our second time speaking together, so i m just wondering what are some helpful questions if any y all have asked your therapist in the beginning stages of taking to them

struggle. today i went with my family to the park near home and, suddenly, they wanted to go for icecream. of fucking course we went for fucking icecream. and i panicked, i was not, i am not, yet ready for facing that food. at first i didn't want anything, but i got angry because i knew that was my anorexia speaking and i was letting it gain control so i then asked for a smoothie i could only go for that option bc it was the only one without milk, which also kinda scares me yet . so i got the fucking smoothie and drank it all, the sweetness kind of disgusted me and almost threw it away when no one was looking. but i didn't, i finished it and felt somewhat happy because it felt like a victory. until i found myself inside a near coffee shop ordering a double espresso. so there i was, waiting for a strong coffee to drink like i always do after eating something that made me feel guilty to "burn it off". end of story; thought i won, when i actually didn't. but it's ok, i might have lost this battle, but not the war. i'll have another chance. ps: now i'm struggling with needing to restric, fuck me

ambivalence of recovery. one year ago, i accepted the fact that i had a problem. i was miserable, cold and tired. one year ago i decided that i could no longer live like this, that i needed help. it took another few month until i got a therapist and really started this journey, but i never expected it to last that long. i thought that the things, about malnourishment and brain capacity, did not apply to me, because i was aware that i had a problem, because i could kinda do my uni work and talk to people. that it would be over in what 2 3 weeks and everything would be back to normal, after this 1 1 2 year. fast forward a few month into quasi recovery and the game of gaining a bit maintaining, and than gaining a bit more, took me just barely into a healthy weight again. being stuck in a binge restrict cycle. the last 2 weeks however my body was tired of fighting for so long and decided that it no longer wanted to play the game of the ed voice. so i ate and no matter how much the voice mentally begged to restrict, i was just incapable of doing it. now i am no longer malnourished and yeah it turns out again science is right. the malnourished brain is indeed not capable of realising a lot of things. it indeed is necessary to gain the weight. it feels like a curtain has been lifted from my brain, ever since i reached the medical not longer malnourished phase of fuelling my body adequately every day. i feel so much more like myself it s crazy. i can laugh and mean it. i get more emotional and i swear the world seems even a bit more colourful. i am no longer in this weird floaty state which is hard to describe and i did not even knew i was in. but also i had another realisation. another thing that i thought i already knew, but suddenly really sunk in to me. eds just fill out a space in your brain that was previously preoccupied, by another problem and as soon as the ed starts to get smaller the space is open for the problems to re enter again . but it is also the moment that we could start to rewire. instead of letting the dark material fill the void, it could be filled with so much more bright thoughts and love. it does not have to end up the same. it could be the start of something new. but ultimately it s you that has to make that decision. to take on the driver seat. no one else can do it. it s hard. it s against everything that you know. but nothing changes if nothing changes. today i ate breakfast after having one of the worst mental hunger eating binges in the middle of the night, after a week of eating way way past calorie minimums and i am terrified and proud and every emotion that you can think of, but i try to clench my fists and look forward. at least for today. one step, one breath at a time.

relapsing after a year of progress, seeking advice. hi all, i've never posted here but have often read threads for support and have always appreciated this recovery oriented space. i feel like i've really messed up. about a month ago, my dietitian and i decided that i no longer needed to be on a meal plan or log my meals after a tough year of gaining weight and pursuing recovery. a little background i am now twenty years old and have been in and out of ed treatment since i was twelve, never could really shake the damn thing for more than a few months at a time. when i came off my meal plan this time, i did ok for maybe a week, but then something snapped and i ended up downloading my fitness pal and starting to obsessively count my calories. i'm eating very low calories and am also very active as a college athlete which i know is a recipe for disaster but i'm afraid to be honest with my dietitian about it because i hate the thought of going back to a meal plan. i also have to admit i lost significant weight this month and part of me is afraid of having to gain it back as well... i thought about slowly increasing my calories but still tracking it but i know that's also a pretty shit idea. altogether, i feel very stuck and any words of wisdom would be welcome.

eh and anxiety on vacation. a couple weeks into extreme hunger, it doesn't seem like it will lower any time soon and that's fine. next week i'm going on vacation with my family. i live alone so there wasn't anyone to judge me so far for eating. i don't think my family will judge or comment. but so far i was always able to go any buy in a store right next to my flat whatever i'm craving. on vacation we don't have a supermarket nearby and i'm kind of worried what will happen when the mental hunger on something specific happens and i can't have it bc i would have to drive to the next store or bc they don't have it in the country . also kind of afraid that my siblings eat the stuff i want and bought for me. or that we go out for dinner and i don't feel satisfied after the meal. i know that i can and will take lots and lots snacks with me everywhere we go but i still feel so anxious about not getting enough food. really unnecessary because even when i eat everything i take with me there will probably be a possibility to buy more food. still i feel so much anxiety and panic thinking about this vacation. ed me would have worried about how they look in a bikini on the beach or panic about eating out because of uncontrollably calories. kind of funny that that isn't on my mind anymore at all.

help helping myself. i have a varied ary of issues and am waiting on therapy however i m getting worse i m binging more, trying to buy specific appetite suppressants and cutting more and more out of my diet, ext. i m down to like ten main things. my appointments keep getting pushed back. after a reality check i realised i need to change now. does anyone have any tips on what worked for them? i can t keep doing this.

how long for health issues to go away in recovery? and are these even related to anorexia?. i ve been in recovery for about 6 weeks. as i ve mentioned in other posts, my weight was never super low. i think i dipped under bmi 17 at times but generally hovered in the low 17s. prior to that i naturally maintained a i of about 2 . however, i maintained this low weight for about 7 years and as the years progressed i started to suffer from: heart rate all over the place. sometimes below 3 , sometimes above 18 . arthritis in my hands is this even a symptom of anorexia? genuine question rynauds having to pee constantly. super stinky pee sometimes gross but true . mini accidents constantly and one time fully peed on the street. i ve never been so afraid and mortified. this was my main reason to attempt recovery. sudden weird hearing problems. like being underwater at times dizziness and being freezing a lot so, i ve currently gained about 12 pounds or so over these 6 weeks with a bmi of 18.2 but no doubt will continue to creep up. already i m not cold, my raynauds has disappeared and the arthritis symptoms are gone. my hr is still wonky, but improving. i m still dizzy a lot. my hearing has been fine but it was a sporadic thing anyway. no longer have that peeing urgency at all. hormones are going crazy all the pms stuff like sore breasts, bloating etc. it seems like this is an awfully quick turnaround. could it be real? i will also add that i have lots of weird tingling in my arms and legs now and am getting muscle cramps constantly. i don t normally pay that much attention to how i feel, just kind of power on through the day, but i m trying to focus on things more to see the improvements and take true inventory on the damage i did. sorry for the long post. i m just looking for feedback as to whether these symptoms are normal, etc.

constipation problem tw calories mentioned . hi there. i developed a restrictive ed at the age of 19 i m a guy . i went to a very low weight got outpatient treatment, regained, but yo yo d up and down through exercise compulsion, dietary restriction and orthorexia ever since. i m 32 now. i only recently came across this forum and have decided to go for an all in approach the last month or so. it really seems like the only viable option for me at this stage, as any half measures usually tend to backfire on me and i inevitably go back to restriction, etc. i ve had extreme hunger fairly constantly and have put up some weight from my low baseline. i m trying to come to terms with this and the probable overshoot that will occur. i do respond to the eh but still hold back from going up to the next gear completely. i would probably eat all day long constantly if i truly gave in to it. my intake is probably in the region of 4 6 per day. what i m suffering with mostly, however, is my digestion. all my adult life, which is pretty much ever since i developed anorexia ed, i ve had very slow digestion, bloating, etc. i ve had to purposely fill my bladder to increase my intra abdominal pressure to create the urge to pass a bowel movement. the natural rhythm has all but gone. i ve had colonoscopies, etc and my gastro has concluded that my problem is purely functional. he just advised using a prokinetic motegrity and osmotic laxatives as necessary. this hasn t worked unfortunately. i ve used every kind of supplement you can think of. i still tinker with movicol miralax, magnesium oxide or citrate in varying high doses with a variable schedule but i feel they only add to my bloating with little help to actually pass any movement. stimulant laxatives like dulcolax work, but i ve never really abused them for any prolonged period, as i know that will make my situation worse. any dietary alterations don t really make much of a difference i ve tried high fiber, no fiber, carnivore, etc. the only common denominator is that my intake has always been restricted. i worry that this could be a chronic issue that may never resolve. what i ve noticed recently though, with a little bit of insight that has come since going all in, is that i ve been chronically stressed and anxious all day every day forever. it s like i ve been in fight or flight mode on a constant basis for years. it s such a complex situation but maybe my digestive issues could be related to this high level of anxiety also? i was on an ssri for years but stopped that some time back. it never made much of a difference to my stress, and now i ve come across some account of ssris actually causing longterm bowel dysfunction. i don t know what to believe at this stage, and don t know what my next step should be. i m hoping that with proper weight restoration, exposure to different foods in different situations, neural rewiring of all my compulsive exercise and movements, etc that things may improve. but in the meantime, any tips on how to manage the discomfort and ensure a daily bm would be very much appreciated. the extreme hunger and eating over 5 calories a day is a liberating experience but when you have very sluggish bowels it can make a bad situation worse .apologies for the rant

i wish i could separate my body image issues from food. i ve never had great body image, and i ve always been especially insecure about my legs. but, i ve always still been relatively thin and never experienced fatphobia, so i ve never experienced any kind of oppression based on my body type. i never felt extremely confident about my body, but looking back on it, especially as i got a bit older but before my ed developed , my insecurities didn t interfere with my life very much. i never had body image days so bad i couldn t leave the house or socialize. but the thing i miss the most is that a bad body image day before my ed would never interfere with my eating. it never even crossed my mind to skip a meal if i felt especially bad about my body. now it crosses my mind nearly every time i look in the mirror on a bad day. i just wish i could go back to never thinking about the way food would affect my body just eating what i wanted, when i wanted, and never thinking twice about it, even if i didn t feel great about my body. man i wish i could go back to when my ed first developed and just slap myself. none of this is worth it. it s so hard to deal with these thoughts constantly, every single day.

complications long anorexia sufferers battlers gt;15 years of ed here??. hi all, i am 33 years now and suffering from anorexia for more than 17 years now... so long that i really can't imagine a life without but im so sick and tired of this way of living. i have a good social life, a part time job and i actually love food and drinks. the thing is anorexia gives me control and a kind of '''safe'' feeling. but i know my life could be so much more than this; friends are getting serious relationships buying houses together and having children i'm surrounded by people who truly loves me. i want to date again, to find a man as well etc etc.. i already suffered from an ileus testine obstruction failure when i was 25 and did die almost. i spent 5 weeks in the er because of medical complications such as kidney failure because of my bad body condition. luckily, i recovered from this complication. but now, 8 years later i still am having my ed and doing the same thing all over again. i never reached a healthy weight since my 16th and currently having a bmi of 14, which for me is very low but when i compare to others, my ed tells me its ok. family friends and medical support are very worries for me since they are telling me im very very thin and are suffering for so long, i really have to keep gaining and trying to recover. question: for those who also suffering for so long from anorexia: how is your physical condition and are you also feeling like your body is done with it. like, after all these years, its enough and your body feels like getting weaker . have you have complications from the ed ? just want to read a bit more about the downsides and getting inspired to fucking b eat this

not hungry until i start eating .and then i can t stop . and by not stopping, i mean i could easily go through two family sized bags of chips, 6 huge bakery cookies, and an entire bag of carrots with like half a jar of peanut butter. it s kind of horrifying. i m not sure if this is extreme hunger? it s baffling. i ve been in recovery for about 6 weeks and from what i ve read about other people s experience with eh this doesn t feel as extreme? and it only happens like once a week, maybe? i m just going with it, but it s like this gaping hole opens up inside me and i m just in a frenzy. tw for weight . i should add i wasn t that underweight to begin with. 1 4ish at 5 6, and maintained that for 7 years. but i started to have health issues:freezing all the time, arthritis in my hands not sure if it was related to anorexia but feels like it , thin hair, skin really dry, and most embarrassingly and the reason i kind of snapped to and realized that i did actually have an ed was serious problems with my bladder, including an incident when i completely and fully wet my pants in public no one saw me, but i was out walking and just couldn t stop. i was mortified i m still not convinced i was light enough to truly be considered anorexic, but regardless, my low weight was causing these problems. anyway, i m not up to about 112 115 and still gaining . i realize this post is all over the place, but not sure how to manage these bouts of eating?

it s five in the morning and i have relapsed. i spent the entire night today and yesterday agonising over food. i ve just realised i ve relapsed. i don t know what to do. i don t go into grocery stores, i don t look in the fridge. i eat at work, breakfast and lunch. and 4pm to 12pm i m starving. that s insane. i m gonna go to mcdonalds now because fuck it, at least the carbs will be able to put me to sleep.

your body may not be the same and you have to accept that.. i m not recovered in the slightest but lately i have been doing a lot better and coming to terms with a lot of things. throughout my ed i never truly knew what to strive for. i am quite young but would find myself looking at my body from when i was 11 12 years old and desiring it so badly. i d also find myself idolising my body from a couple of years ago and wishing desperately to have it back. here s the thing, i m 16. i will never achieve that body because simply put i hadn t hit puberty. i will never look as skinny and frail as i did in a shirt ever again because simply put i have double d tits now. you re never going to look extremely skinny in a shirt because they re there. i m never going to look as frail as i did because i have hips now. with my hips i have fat around my midsection and i don t think i can have one without the other. i know it s hard to say but i can t keep wanting a body i had before puberty because i can t reverse puberty to get it back. i think this applies to many scenarios and with any set of age differences. if you are an adult you cannot get your teenage body back because you are not a teenager anymore. i find myself coming to terms with this more as i distance myself from my ed and it almost makes me feel better. it s not a fault of mine it s a biological change that i have no control over and shouldn t beat myself up over. the same applies for all of you.

when is it time?. i have been recovering off and on the last 6 months. i am a 33 male suffering for nearly 16 years. i have been to so many inpatients, residentials, out patients, etc... and i am currently fighting limbo recovering on my own with no team to help me. who do i turn to and what are your stories of weight gain versus being weight restored and scared you will never stop gaining? thanks so much everyone you are all so inspiring.

feeling sick after extreme hunger. i just honored my hunger and had so much to the point where i feel like i m literally about to pop. it started with the shavings of a cake i was leveling out for my brothers bday , then a massive amount of leftover frosting, and then like 1 3 a loaf of banana bread. i ran some errands to try and distract myself and then i downed a shit ton of peanuts, peanut butter and dates, lots of spoonfuls of ice cream, a biscotti, and even some leftover chicken? i feel literally ill right now and i just hate myself so much. why cant i just eat like a regular fucking person? and tomorrows my brother s birthday of course this is the night i choose to make myself feel this way. i m not prepared for how i m gonna deal with this in the morning. someone please send help or tell me it will pass over time

weight gain mental block. i can not do it. even though everything is being taken away from me because i am not gaining weight i still can t get my head around it. i am stuck in quasi recovery. i have had my medication taken away from me, i won t be able to go on my vacation, i will loose my job, i wont be able to go to school etc. but my brain is still persistent to loose more. i get mad when i see the scale go up, i m happy when i see it go back down. i have no idea how i m supposed to get past this.

parent's continued remarks about food eating are starting to hurt. hi all, tw: talk about restriction i just want to get some advice here. some backstory; my two older sisters have histories with eds that my parents are well aware of. i have silently struggled with a weird relationship with food body image since my teens but haven't been very vocal about it. we grew up in a very diet centric house, with my mom on ww constantly and not cooking us regular meals. we were often left to fend for ourselves or my parent's favorite word, "graze." in the past few years, i've noticed my parents both in their late 6 s making more and more concerning comments about food. they'll make remarks about how much someone is eating, or tease one of us for eating breakfast "when we're having dinner tonight" i'm not joking . its something me and my sisters all joke about but i think it is actually starting to get to all of us. so i recently came down with covid, as did my dad. i called him today to check in and see how he was doing. after filling me in, he said something really disheartening. he said "well one good thing about it is i'm not eating." i didn't say anything, just kind of went "heh.." and he said "i think we all sometimes just eat when we don't really need to." i was so annoyed. what is the purpose of this comment? and this is coming from him who eats like one meal a day. i'm just feeling really annoyed and upset, and also trying not to internalize it. any advice?

post about periods. hey y all i m recovering from orthorexia and later anorexia. i suffered from anorexia for about 3 months. i noticed my periods becoming a bit lighter. but they have been pretty stable and pretty normal even when in my ed however, since i ve gained weight and repaired my digestive system and everything. my period this month was late and extremely light.. like super light i m very concerned . i asked to get a test for my thyroid bc this doesn t make sense. i asked to test my testosterone but she told me that that can t be it.. she told me that a sudden weight gain can be affecting my periods not the previous ed. she said that my estrogen is probably trying to catch up and stablize again.. it s hard bc i don t have any ed support and doctors are so uneducated about them has this happened to anyone and what should i be doing? i m typically a very heavy bleeder. so this is all new to me. last time i checked my hormones in december i was great but that was before the ed kicked in i m really scared

blood work came back normal y all eating worked . who would ve thought eye roll for the first time since 2 22 my liver enzymes wbc blah blah blah are all in normal ranges again big improvements too since last month. during this month i started all in and ate a ton. it was rough mentally but now i m soooo happy i did

eating... life... struggles... tw calories, also a swear word . so... today is saturday, and i've eaten a good portion of breakfast granola, half a pizza for lunch, food at an indian restaurant for dinner with a lassi milkshake smoothie looking drink, which is scary because liquid calories , a large cup hot cocoa, and way too much chocolate candy i filled up a large mug cup thing, probably got 4 grams of chocolates in there; and i estimate i've eaten gt; 5 calories lt; today. i looked forward to everything i ate, and enjoyed it all. but that's all; my thoughts never went towards anything else. and despite feeling really stuffed, the classic mental hunger is still there: "i could eat more, i kind of want more. tomorrow i want to eat three x, and i want two servings of y". it's so frustrating, and sad, and scary. not to mention i've eaten so much this week, much more than everyone around me, or at least it feels like it. and tomorrow happens to be my birthday, and i'm going to a restaurant to eat a high calorie dinner for the third day in a row. i'm scared, and i know i want to eat so much and so many different things, and i expect i'll want a lot of cake for my birthday too. i think to myself "i want to restrict again starting monday, new week new me" but i know i already want to eat more than i "should", even though it's two days away. my fourth year in uni starts in a few weeks, and all i think about is food, meals, calories... what i want to eat, how much i want, exercise to "justify" the monstrous intake... and most devastating of all, looking at my stomach, which has indeed got actual fat on it these past couple of months which scares me because fatphobia and fear of things like diabetes and "future restriction for health reasons" of course . it's so damn exhausting, and i don't know what to do. now i want to go to bed and wake up for breakfast? endless, vicious cycle that i'm not brave enough to get out of; i am not tough enough to go "all in", not committed enough to stop compulsive exercise, not confident or motivated enough to find myself outside my ed. it's so easy to tell others to just "eat more and get better", but doing it for myself? i've never found anything as difficult as this in my entire life. and almost the worst thing of all, which is genuinly not good for me, is that i have eaten so much ice cream, hot cocoa, chocolate, cheese, cream etc. which contains so much saturated fat. this isn't bad for normal people, but with familial hypercholesterolemia i need to really limit my intake for my cholesterol's sake, but i just fucking can't...

recovery depression?. i'm doing really well in recovery, meaning i gained a lot of my health back. but mentally i'm not doing well at all. i was miserable while participating in my disorder, but now i'm just extremely depressed. i don't look forward to anything, i feel no real excitement, i don't want to see my friends, i don't look forward to life. i'm in a constant state of dissatisfaction and am starting to go back to sh and suicidal ideation. i'm just not happy. i don't know why either. i thought feeding myself was supposed to make me happy again and ready to experience life again, but i just am at a constant unhappiness. i really don't know what i'm doing wrong.
my eyelashes and brows are growing back thicker??. fucking insane. i barely had any lower lashes a few months ago now it s like full on tim burton style.

is there any way to count calories without triggering myself?. i wanna bulk up muscles and fat but i keep hovering about a quite low weight for my height. not underweight but low enough to not be able to put on muscle. my partner suggested counting calories but i am terrified that it will make me obsessed about what i eat again. does anyone have an idea how i would get into fitness and bulking without having to count calories or how i make counting calories less triggering? thank youuu
does anyone know how to maintain weight?. i only know how to lose and gain weight...

what heart problems does an ed actually cause?. i m just curious. this is for educational purposes, to know that this can fucking kill you. so, has anybody actually gotten a heart problem, and if you feel comfortable sharing it, directly from their ed?

calorie counting. does anyone have good advice on how to stop counting calories? i feel like this is my main struggle in recovery meeting my meal plan because the calories of everything are basically ingrained in my brain after restricting for years

has anyone partaken in the national alliance for eds virtual support group?. i signed up for this upcoming monday and i am so nervous. this is one positive step in the right direction i have made in months. can anyone tell me what their experience has been like? i don t know what to expect. i don t know if it will help, but i am desperate. i can t live like this anymore. i m barely living. i ve barely been living for the last ten years i ve had this fucking disorder. it controls every single aspect of my life and i m so tired of it. i m just so tired. period.

don t know what to eat. ok so, i m abt a week into anorexia recovery but i still have no idea of what i should eat. i ve thought about just eating whatever sounds good. but the thing is, all i want is to eat is unhealthy stuff. for example this morning the only thing i wanted for breakfast was sugary cereal. anything else sounded disgusting. should i just eat whatever even though it s really unhealthy? or should i still focus on "healthier" more nutrient dense food? i feel kind of lost.

in need of positive vibes and encouragement please. i have been in an active period of a restrictive eating disorder for 2 1 2 years now. i have been in semi recovery in that time but never full and have relapsed each time. after waiting over a year on the nhs for therapy i finally started my sessions properly about a month ago. in the run up i had already put on weight as i had a major surgery and was bed bound pretty much for 3 weeks and have been building up my strength since and couldn t exercise like i did prior. plus i just couldn t contain my hunger like i did pre surgery and was eating more, but then struggling with guilty thoughts after. i know i can t mention height or weight but 11 weeks post surgery and a month into therapy and i am really into a healthy weight zone for me, and basically the same weight i was before this all started. but i hate it. and i m so disappointed in myself for feeling that way. a week ago i was in a much better headspace and even though i knew i was putting on weight i was trying to go with it and stay calm. but this week i don t feel like that at all, i feel like i m being suffocated in my body. i ve tried getting dressed this week and clothes i expected to fit really don t fit anymore. i absolutely love getting dressed up and doing my make up, chiding the whole look but i don t enjoy it at all right now as i don t know what will fit me anymore. today i was meant to be going out with my partner and step son but after putting on 3 different outfits and 2 being too small and 1 that highlighted my tummy too much i gave up and went back to bed crying. i feel awful about it. i was committed to my eating plan for a few weeks but now for the last 5 days i think i ve gone off course and i really want to get back on course. i ve also finally started exercising properly again since my surgery and the anxiety is already starting there about how often i should be doing it, and thinking i should try and get a session is as often as i can and feeling guilty for missing a session and i don t want to give into those thoughts again. any advise or words of encouragement please?

pubes falling out? also i went to a hotel spa. hey so uh did anyone else's pubic hairs fall out when you were not eating enough? also unrelated, i went to a hotel with my sister and her friend and i managed to be not disordered : there was a spa and man, it's good to see a real naked woman once in a while. overall good trip and i feel okay for the first time in forever

as i thought, the thoughts.. well, as i said in my previous post: eating larger meals is not really the problem in my case, instead, answering to my hunger for snacks during the day is. it started to become kind of tiring? to eat whenever my body feels like it wants food, and the thoughts that it might not come to an end started to kick in even though i know it's just my anorexia trying to get a hold of me again. and i cant afford to let that happen again. but i dont know, when i do honour my extreme hunger i do feel better and even that need for snacking goes away for a while. still, the thoughts keep coming and i cant help it but feel a little bad about how much i'm eating again, even knowing that it'll be worth it in the long run. anyone else has had this same problem? i know i'm most likely not the only one but i kinda need to read it see it to feel a little better.

peanut butter crackers. honestly, during recovery, i've been going crazy over peanut butter crackers and bananas. just a few days ago i started feeling guilty because i seem to eat this everyday as my breakfast. i've never been a big fan of breakfast. even as a elementary school kid, i hated it and evey morning my mother forced me to eat. so i never know what to have except the crackers and banana. it's been easy. but now , i started thinking about how it's unhealthy. how it will make me overweight. or if its the main reason i'll gain weight. i even made the mistake of looking up it eating too much pb crackers is bad. and you guys can guess the rest. i hate this.

pee talk, maybe tmi. sooo this may be tmi but i ve noticed when i wake up in the morning and pee it s normally like a bit cloudy if that makes any sense. not any other time i go, only happens on the first one of the morning. anyone have any idea why or experience the same thing ?

honoring hunger with a busy schedule?. i am going back to school very soon, and am worried that i will not be able to eat enough during the day when i am constantly going somewhere doing something. i am about 13 months into recovery, so extreme hunger has mostly died down but i still find myself unable to go more than an hour and a half at most without eating. when i do go back to school, i have to eat breakfast very early, lunch five hours later, and dinner six hours after that. no breaks during the school day, and only a small one before sports practice. last year i was not doing a sport, so while i experienced the intense extreme hunger that came in early recovery i ate pretty much non stop after school. it worked for me then, but it will not this year. i think i'm just looking for advice, from anyone who may have been able to work recovery around school work. should i force myself to eat past hunger at breakfast, so that i am full longer? that still sounds a little disordered. also: i never had the courage to ask my professors if i could eat during classes, purely because i was embarrassed by the notion. additionally, three of my six classes this term are lab based, so i could not eat during them even if i wanted to since it would be, well, unsafe.

worried about calories yet again. i posted abt being worried abt cals yesterday yet here we are yet again i m not gonna know how much is in my food and i m freaking out. i m spending the weekend with my friends who i haven t seen in almost two years and yet i m worried about this. i feel so terrible it s consuming all my thoughts. i m just so scared. my friends don t exercise much and they eat out somewhat often. well u guess they re more like normal people but in my mind it s too much ??? i guess. i m just so

why 1 months in do i constantly still feel hungry. how do people go hours without eating? i literally can t stay away from food im still eating plain tortillas and everything. raw ramen, not able to sit down for meals and instead just binge on random shit, i don t remember the last time i sat down to eat lmao. shouldn t i be more picky what the heck. i thought i was losing some weight a month or two ago but i was wrong i m gaining it back, i really don t think my body wants to lose any weight right now because i m still eating a lot. idk i m confused. oh well. it doesn t help that i m 5 so i literally just feel like a freakin baby ball

update: i m home. i was in the hospital for 1 hours, im chronically low on iron and might have internal bleeding due to ulcers. to anyone stalking this subreddit wondering if it s worth it to get skinny it s not. i m not underweight and i m 2 lbs away from my goal weight it isn t worth it. i thought it wouldn t happen to me and it did

how to deal with narcissistic mother purposely triggering my ed?. a light bit of backstory. my mother has been staying with me in my apartment because she has intense addiction issues and being alone makes her use even more. she sleeps in my living room and explains she is only here because she can t be alone, and i tried to tell her to go home because she is highly abusive i won t go into too many details but she guilt tripped me and said if she goes back on heroine and overdoses and dies it would be my fault because i abandoned her. today after a few days of restriction, i went into the kitchen and ate the thin end piece of a bread loaf. while i was eating it, my mother screamed at me wow you re eating again? seriously? , even though it was the first time i ate in days and she knows this . she basically said i was fat and shouldn t be eating, and then she gave me the most disgusted look at my body. she knows i have an ed. she knows i literally had an intake assessment with an ed psychiatrist for inpatient treatment this morning which went awful . she knows i have nearly died from my ed, and about all of my ed related emergency room visits. i asked her to stop commenting on what i eat when i eat how much i eat, and she screamed at me here you go with your attitude again . she literally had just called me fat, gave me a disgusted look, and said i ate too much. a thin piece of bread after days of restriction and i deserve to be punished. she knows i don t eat and that i am anorexic. i just don t know what to do. i took a lot of benzos and mixed them with a lot of opiates to calm the fuck down, but i did this twice today so i m not sure how much i ve taken at this point. she wants me to die. its not the first time shes blatantly told me or implied that she wanted me to die. one of my suicide attempts landed me in the hospital, and because i was a minor at the time she had to come. when she was there, she was high on heroine and looked at me with evil in her eyes and said you should have tried harder so you died . now, she s playing with my ed in the worst ways. i m trying so hard to recover with so many barriers in the way , though i had a plan to fast for over a week. now i m going to do it. i was going to purge the bread but she knows i purge and belittles me and calls me a disgusting idiot when i do. i just feel so much more disgusting than i already did. my body dysmorphia is horrendous, and she just solidified my perception of my body. how am i supposed to deal with this? i ve dealt with it my whole life, she has always put me down, but my heart is too big and i wouldn t be able to live with the consequences. i tried to kick her out and she said i was the reason shes going to die, so i took it back and don t know how to make her leave. i don t know how to heal, how to recover, or if i can. sorry for the wall of text, i just have nobody to talk to about this and i m pretty high off of the pills because i lost track of how many i took.

school and ed s. hey guys, i have add and was on medication for it but because of my ed i am no longer allowed a prescription. this has led to me being unable to focus enough to complete assignments and falling into quite a bad depressive episode over the last month. i m on school holidays at the moment and have been for the last 3 weeks but i go back to school on the 1st of august and am supposed to have finished an assignment. i haven t even started it because i feel like i can t even do it and can t concentrate long enough to get my shit together. and during the holidays i ve been in ed treatment outpatient and have just started anorexia recovery which is obvi taking a massive toll on my mental health anyways, i m just wondering how i should tell my teacher that i haven t done the assignment and that i also want to drop the assignment but in a way so that she knows that it s not jsut because i have been slacking but because i m really struggling. sorry if this doesn t make sense but does anyone have any ideas? :

permission to eat once weight restored?. i recovered weight restored back at the beginning of the year and overshot a little, probably gt; 1 15 pounds lt;. my extreme hunger faded, and i was eating relatively normally for a few months after that 3 meals, 2 3 snacks . since then i ve relapsed, and while i m not nearly as sick as i was at the height of my ed, i know i m going to need to gain more weight. something that i struggled with after weight restoration that i think played a large part in my relapse was giving myself permission to eat once weight restored. in some ways i actually found it easier while i was going through extreme hunger i was so hungry all the time, and i knew i was underweight and needed to gain so eating was honestly pretty easy. but once the extreme hunger dissipated and my weight stabilized, i found it hard to justify eating certain things, especially higher calorie foods. i think ultimately this contributed to me relapsing because in a way i almost wanted to go through extreme hunger again so that i could like, savour recovery this time yes, typing this out im aware of how disordered and ridiculous this sounds haha . i know the simple answer is that i have permission to eat whatever i want even once im weight restored. but i really dont want to go through this again, so does anyone have any tips on how to deal with these thoughts once weight restored?

do you people see yourself having a baby in future? also has anyone had a baby while suffering from an ed?. i always had this clear in my head that i will not have a baby. i was more sure about this decision since ed because of the weight gain during pregnancy and the side effects n everything, you know what i mean. that got me wondering if people suffering from ed generally feel this way. also if you have had a baby during your ed, how were you felling atm? edit: i really appreciate everyone for speaking out as i haven t seen people w in ed community talk on the subject. also living in a conservative society who automatically assumes that a woman will bear a child sooner or later makes me mad that factors like these aren t taken into consideration. and is this really our sole purpose? i have huge respect for the mothers in this subreddit or mothers in general tho, you people don t realise how strong you are. looking forward to more answers.

if you remember my last post . so yesterday i just decided i was gonna go all in with recovery. and my gosh did i freaking do it. lol i m sorry to talk numbers but i ate almost six thousand calories. my body was just like yayyy give me all the food the biggest thing though was that i actually just sat around all day until work. exercise compulsion is my absolute biggest problem and i just sat down. i even had a nap because apparently eating six thousand calories is hard work for the body lol i also ate all throughout the day instead of just in the late afternoon evening. i also allowed myself to spend money on food and i bought a tub of ice cream and ate the whole thing as well as a bar of chocolate that i used in this really yummy chickpea cookie dough that i proceeded to eat the entire batch of as well. to be completely honest i feel very sick today but i feel like that is to be expected with such a huge influx of calories and energy. i m trying my best to rest more today and still try to eat more than i usually do. it s hard, but it feels way more possible now that i did it one day

hi i m stupid. um hi again i just made a post about how i couldn t fucking breathe after not eating for a couple of hours. i m disordered and the best thing i can do for myself is face the music and eat those goddamn 25 minimum calories. it s just so scary and i feel so alone right now. can someone please help me??? i seriously don t think i ve ever felt so low in my life. i never thought i d have anorexia and im genuinely struggling. literally any advice or even if it s some generic motivational line i m just so, so alone right now.

anorexia recovery turning into bulimia what can i do : . i made this account so none of my friends family recognize me im sorry for the long vent : so i decided to recover from severe anorexia by going all in almost a year ago 8 months i think due to being super underweight and had no choice. i was doing very well eating my meals and following my extreme mental hunger, and eating way above 5k cals everyday. recently my appetite has gone down a bit and i have noticed myself eating less some days, and binging so bad some other days to the point i feel so so sick. this usually happens when i eat and i feel like i screwed up so i keep on stuffing myself despite the fact i am full and repulsed by food. tw: ed behaviors gt; last week at the mall i ate so much pizza lasagna i couldn t move so i went to the bathroom and made myself throw up. it was the first time i have purged by vomiting and that s when i felt like i screwed up my recovery. lt; gt; since that time i have been purging after binging everyday for the past week and hate myself if i couldn t. i had a huge binge today family bucket of kfc, 3 biscuits, 2 burgers and 6 g of chocolate icecream and managed to keep it down but i feel like im gonna literally burst lt; i am literally so disappointed and disgusted with myself right now i literally have no idea how to recover properly. i hate myself i dont wanna get another ed

care team appreciation post. honestly after seeing sooo many people s traumatizing experiences with their doctors dietitians, i feel like my care team deserves a huge shoutout for being absolutely stellar. my pcp, psychiatrist, and dietitian all work with a lot of ed patients. my psychiatrist is specialized in ed. in all of my sessions with them i ve been encouraged to honor all my hungers, not count calories at all, and restrict exercise in any form. when i told my pcp that my extreme hunger had me eating 4 calories everyday, i thought she d tell me to restrict a bit. instead, she encouraged me to keep doing it and to stop thinking about the numbers all together. she even said to eat more if you still feel like it and don t feel guilty. everyone has confirmed that my minimum daily intake should be 3 26f and there is absolutely no upper bound. anyway having medical professionals confirming that i m doing the right thing has definitely helped me a ton mentally when doing all in. just want to share this with everyone i guess this is your sign to honor your hunger today

seeing some people from school for first time after relapse. tw for talk about relapsing i m scared for tomorrow. i m scared for all the people i haven t seen in months to see me again and clock exactly what i ve done to myself. the one person, one of my professors, who knows i have an eating disorder will be there. i wrote in one of my papers for her that i was spiraling at the end of last semester. i am scared for her to see me and know that i was not strong enough to stop doing this to myself. it s embarrassing in the most visceral, fucking humiliating way to know that the product of your own weakness will be completely on display for everyone to see. it s not like the first time i had anorexia when the idea of everyone seeing my body would make me feel a twisted sense of superiority. the only thing i feel this time is deep, immeasurable shame that i could let this happen again. but at the same time there is an opposing yet somewhat more irrational fear that i will appear exactly the same to them as before. logically, i know this is impossible. i know that i have relapsed. but as we are all too aware, the disordered mind is really not known for its rationally, so the fear is still there. if my pain is invisible, then what did i even suffer for in the first place?

how bad is this symptom?. hello, i m kind of new to this sub, am currently trying to recover on my own bc i m too scared of asking for help. anyway, i ve been working on eating more consistently and although i have a long ways to go, i m increasing my intake as i get more comfortable. however, i recently realized that if i don t have food in my system for longer than what i think is 2 3 hours, i can become very faint and confused. it didn t worry me too much until today, i had eaten my calories for the day and i usually go to bed quite early but today i had to help out with some family things outside and expended a bit more energy. we went to the gas station and i started to feel like my chest was hurting and it was heavy, almost hard to breathe. when i came back i ate to help combat this and i think it got better. was just wondering if anyone can help me sort of figure out what is happening and if i should do something in particular to make it better. sorry if this is dumb i m just a little scared that my heart a might be dying.

wieiad are getting f ing boring to me. idk, once i honor my extreme hunger, watching wieid and cheat days videos bores me, and i find myself fast forwading the videos to find a reason to watch it, and there just isnt lol

this second round of extreme hunger fucking sucks, could use some support. it doesn t seem to be letting up at all it s been around a week and i m having a hard time dealing with it. my mom is getting sick of me because i just keep crying all the time bc my body is just endlessly hungry. i m also weight restored and in overshoot which is definitely a super fun great time to be experiencing extreme hunger . i don t really have any reliable coping mechanisms for my anxiety so that s another mayhem on the side and i feel like it s driving me closer and closer to relapse. also i m having very strong food aversion to literally everything which is making it so much harder to eat. it took me like 45 minutes to choke down my oatmeal this morning and i felt like i wanted to puke the entire time. does anyone have any suggestions to get this over with sooner? pls don t suggest peanut butter i ll probably projectile vomit if i m within 5 ft of a jar currently. preferring more savoury things, at least i can get them down thinking of ordering some taco bell or smth tonight idk : this just sucks, my mom tells me i m spiralling downward mentally at the moment and she s right. my add makes my thinking so black and white. since i m having a hard time and struggling right now it legitimately feels like the end of the world and that it s going to be like this forever, and that everything is as horrible as it could possibly get thank nd brain i feel no hope or optimism. i had a really good week a couple weeks ago. my hunger levelled off, i was so happy and looked so good bc my energy was good, i got my period, i finally felt like i was reaching that light at the end of the tunnel. and now im just back at square one.

ed vs ocd. does anyone else have any confusion about whether they have eating issues or just straight up ocd? i restrict and have a lot of compulsive habits around food that seem to line up pretty squarely with ed things safe vs fear foods that constantly change, hoarding, using specific dishes silverware, cutting things into tiny pieces, not wasting food . i also think about food and everything related to it constantly. but i m not that concerned with my body? it feels better when i look and feel skinnier, but i m not terrified of gaining a few lbs, i kind of expect it. there are a few things about my body i would change if i could, but i also know that my ideal body isn t possible bc you ll never be able to change something like height. i actually think i look better with bigger boobs and at least a semblance of a butt. essentially i am doing all of those food related ocd behaviors but i could kind of give a shit how i look. it s more of a numbers thing, and similar to how i felt as a kid when i had ocd around cleanliness. certain things just feel right and other things very much do not, and accuracy in terms of numbers and tracking feels v. important.
