healthyfied dietitian. i am always consternated, how uniformed and straight up harmful some dietitian s advices are. i mean seriously, what is wrong with some practitioners. if you re only able to give weightloss advice than it s fine, but please stop treating people with eating disorders. or if you do, do your research. i already gave up on mine, when she told me in our first session, to make sure to gain slowly and that it is not important to reach your set point weight. also she told me to think about a social media star which body i like to have as a goal. mind you i am 25 . but i had to continue for 5 more lessons with her, otherwise my health care wouldn t pay it. so i stuck through this gruesome process and pick my little bits out from our sessions. in our latest session thank god there s only one left . she straight up told me that i should be careful what i eat and that i should mostly eat unprocessed food. she even gave me the advice to only buy unpackaged food, because i would not know the calories and it s heeaalthy , because there are so many additives in prepackaged food . i am student, sorry that i want to eat more than 3 nuts and one rice corn for the rest of the month. after i told her that i avoid certain foods over others, she said that i should continue doing that, as i am right and it is indeed more nutritious and healthy she even let me calorie count a meal from a photo, to see if my measurements are correct. after i told her i want to stop it. sorry for the rant i am just angry for letting her harm my fight against my ed voice.

does it ever go away. im just so tired of everything. ever since i started having disordered thoughts, i stopped living. and ive had them ever since i was 12, and starting from then on ive been surely but slowly developing an ed. with time, it only got worse. all my life had started revolving around my appearance, food, and my disordered behaviors and it never changed. and im afraid it never will. im 15 rn, in recovery for about a few months and all in honoring my extreme hunger fully i d say for two something ish, but mentally im in the same place. honestly, i d even say im feeling worse mentally. i even attempted to relapse and restrict for a few days but not even that soothed me atp. im stuck with this hellish disorder forever, and oh god, if i knew that this would be the outcome i would never ever start. im watching my friends having fun, enjoying their childhood and teenage years, being themselves while im just there. no personality, inability to properly experience emotions, my interests dont bring me the same excitement than they did before, and im sobbing my days away bc even when i attempt to distract myself from all this, i cannot. yes, im in a healthier body technically, but i dont feel much better physically, and am definitely not better mentally either. im stuck, restriction right now wouldnt help in the slightest it would only set me back and honestly it doesnt bring me the same amount of comfort like it did before and continuing to commit to recovery and honor my extreme hunger would do nothing too, except ensure the safety of my physical body. the thoughts are always there, lurking, and im unwillingly wasting my life away. if only i could meet my 12 year old self and tell them that it s not worth it. im so done.

learnt my weight since recovering at the doctors today feeling hopeless. tw: bmi, weight measurements, weight gain, obesity this is going to be horribly triggering so i m really sorry i m advance. i had to measure my weight to take the 4th covid shot. i haven t measured my weight in 7 months. i know i gained weight but now that i see the real number it s about 2 pounds more than i expected. with this i ve probably gained 6 pounds in recovery. i was already overweight when i started. i know bmi is bullshit and i know i shouldn t really care but by those standards, i need to lose 12 pounds to be a normal weight. the number, just the sheer number is fucking me up. i don t think i m even angry or sad. i m just feeling kind of hopeless right now. i know this is probably my inner fat phobia speaking but i just can t see myself staying this weight forever. i m already quite short at is. i realise how ridiculous i sound typing this out but man do i feel bad.

how to deal with triggering colleagues ?. title, my coworker who also happens to be my friend keeps saying the most triggering shit at work. he s always trying to lose weight and doing stupid fad diets like if, etc. i think he knows about my ed, we aren t super close and i never straight up told him i had an ed, but he knows i didn t have a period, that i weighed all my food, and it was obvious i was at a dangerously low weight last year. anyways he s recently hired a weight loss coach apparently it cost like 4 thousand dollars what the fuck?? he was going on and on the other week about how this coach is getting him to download mfp, track his calories macros etc. he even said that he was told to eat lots and lots of protein and then referenced a time when all i ate was protein bc i was disordered lol he doesn t have any bad intentions he s probably just excited to lose weight i guess but he tried showing me his macros today and i just said haha cool and didn t look at it and walked away. idk how to deal with this really ?? we aren t close enough for me to be straight forward about it plus technically he s kinda my boss one of my managers also i m kinda worried about him i saw him eating a quest bar on his break and i just don t want him to fall down a dark hole:

duration, length of recovery.... hi about a month and 3 days into recovery. all in and giving in to my hunger, etc. my first breakthrough cycle in ha has come and gone, my extreme hunger is still a little here but nowhere as bad as the first two weeks. i am seeing positive signs of the second cycle. i know in ha recovery you're supposed to wait for three consistent cycles after the initial 'out of sync' one before making any changes in diet, and i am only a month in total w ana recovery. i feel ok, i am eating when i get hungry and foods that i actually want. i don't weigh measure count calories anymore because i a can't be bothered w the maladaptive nature of it and b not doing this has given me so much more mental space to do other things. if i were to estimate, at this point i am hitting around 2 25 cals per day but i don't track at all so it can def vary. also do light exercise, no compulsive ones. i'm willing to continue eating because i am seeing the beauty in normalcy of life and rly feel disgusted and recognise that my past behaviours were extremely maladpative and unhealthy. however, i am aware of how long the body actually takes to recover i'm sure that even with my cycles 'looking good', my body isn't fully recovered. so my question is, at what point do you know when you are 'back to normal'? idrc abt weight either, i'm just going off of health. is it when all restriction symptoms finally wear off? like muscle tingling, hair starts to get thicker . should i continue what i'm doing for the next two months and just observe? thx

i made the mistake of looking up my bmi. so long story short, i was overweight my entire life, in the last two years lost nearly 2 lbs and what started as i was on a decent weight loss journey ended with me restricting and going to the er last year on my birthday. i ve now been like actually recovering the last few months and i made the mistake of googling my bmi after not being happy about my weight gain and when i started recover i was on the high end of underweight now i m 1 lbs away from being considered overweight again. i m losing my mind about gaining weight again to begin with after spending so long losing it and noticing how differently i ve been treated from when i was overweight and i feel like i lost all that effort and i m going back to being ginormous as my friend referred to me pre weight loss

making progress. over the past week i ve posted on reddit when the ed was really loud and have gotten incredible support. having this has been very helpful in taking little steps towards getting back to normalcy a little more every day. this week i managed to replace my diet bread with a normal one that i really used to like it has twice the carbs and way more sugar, but damn i enjoy it. i also decided to stop buying almond milk and bought some creamy rye milk don t drink cow milk which was amazing. yesterday i went and bought a pair of paints that i tried on a few months ago and decided not to buy because they were way too big. yesterday the were still a little big, but looked way better on me and there s room for growth so i got them.

evening snack. so i've eaten good food today, and i wasn't really physically hungry for an evening snack. however, i really wanted a large bowl of granola with milk, and i also wanted hot cocoa made with milk. so, i ended up having both and they were delicious on the other hand, i my ed really regrets doing so, as one would expect. gotta keep moving forward.

why is it so hard. why is it so hard to "just eat"? like why is it, every time i think of a food, i question it? why do i question what i want? how much i want? if i want more? if i'm actually hungry? just why why is it so hard to just do what needs to be done? why is it so hard to stay consistent? why is it so hard to accept extreme hunger is real? why is it so hard to accept mental hunger is valid? just why why is this all just so hard? why, as a woman nearing her 3 s can i not just do this? why is knowing what i do not enough to make me stick with recovery for long enough so that something changes. why. why. why. of course, deep down i know why but still why

feeling real squicky. i m currently restricting but getting closer to considering recovery, and as part of that am trying to be a little bit more honest about it. i talked about it with my trauma therapist and also a friend last week. both were supportive and accepting of the fact that i don t feel ready to change anything at the moment, and it felt really good to talk about it. in a flush of feeling good and like i m an adult taking charge of my own health, i reached out to my psych s office and asked to make an appt this week to discuss some things that have come up . i also had an annual today with a new pcp, and told myself that if i was feeling comfortable, i could share then too. and then a week passed and i ve just been sitting in a shame spiral, feeling so emotionally hungover and embarrassed by everything i said. i just had the appt with the pcp and it left me feeling really out of sorts. i declined to be weighed which seems to be way out of left field for everyone there, and the pcp asked several questions about history of ed, whether i m happy with my weight, and appetite. i am at a normal bmi, so she didn t seem overly concerned, but i lied through my teeth and i feel so ashamed and embarrassed about it. doctor appts make me feel so anxious, and i hate the idea of something being written in my records, so then you have to talk about it even if you re not comfortable. i m worried i shouldn t say anything to my psychiatrist tomorrow. i really hate having something that i feel like i need to lie about, it makes me feel about 15. i just hate this whole thing really it s exhausting and embarrassing and objectively pointless and i m really ashamed that i m an adult woman lying to her own medical professional. i would really prefer to just figure out how to recover on my own and never have to share it with anyone, unless i want to later when it s no longer an issue. but i m not sure i can do it without help, and it did feel good to be able to say some of the crazy shit that s been in my brain all day every day to people that i trust and who care about me. i m just not feeling great about myself right now and kind of want to hide under a rock and pretend i never told anyone about this. any advice or pep talk is appreciated.

have you experienced food insecurity? how did it impact you?. cw: disordered eating discussion. i tried to spoiler the most explicit parts but themes are throughout the post. amp; x2 b; before the period of time i spent hungry, i had what i like to call the "stink" of diet culture on me, but i was pretty good at intuitive eating and such. i was mostly okay with myself and my body and working to be more positive and less constrained by media images of womanhood. amp; x2 b; but then, well, i'll put the food insecurity bits in spoilers. cw for explicit discussion of food insecurity leading to maybe triggering things: gt; due to a combination of bad depression impacting my motivation and financial issues that meant i couldn't afford food, i became much less healthy. the breaking point for me was falling asleep outside in public after trying to walk to the bus stop for work, because i was too tired to make it all the way there. after that i forced myself to eat daily but still had to ration some food and eat a restrictive diet of mostly peanut butter oatmeal for financial reasons. lt; amp; x2 b; that was a couple years back. now, i have a stable job, i can buy enough groceries each week. i still need to encourage myself to get out of bed and make meals woo lasting depression but i can have food now. i'm starting to notice some concerning trends though. i get anxious if i miss a meal, and that anxiety normally leads me to feel hungrier, and then i want to get takeout but because it's expensive i tell myself i can't. the "i can't eat x right now" thought triggers bigger anxiety and then i buy takeout. anyway i'm going to be seeing my therapist in a couple of weeks and i'll discuss it with him, but hearing other people's stories or thoughts about food insecurity and disordered eating would help in the meantime

dislike feeling of fullness. is it normal to dislike being physically full? probably not normal for "healthy" people, but if you have an ed? whenever i'm full i always hope it won't affect my next meal, as i actively want to eat all my meals. whenever i am forced to skip a meal, for instance an evening meal if dinner is too late, i get sad and feel "cheated" out of a meal. it's as if i live from meal to meal, only looking forward to the things i get to eat. i guess being physically full for many hours isn't very good when you still think about food meals calories weight body exercise etc. edit: i felt physically full and told myself i don't really "need" my evening snack today. so what did i do? i ate my evening snack. and afterwards i wanted some melon and an apple, so i took that too. wtf o.o

how to eat breakfast? help pls. so even as a small child i've never eaten breakfast since my parents have never been big on it, and over time i've always slept late and had 15 minutes to get out the door on a morning since i'm a serious night owl. however, now that i'm recovering my dietician has set me a meal plan which includes 3 meals and 3 snacks, and what time frames to eat within to help me relearn how to eat. i'm doing really well with the rest of my meals and often snack while i'm up late into the night on a bag of m amp;ms on top of it, but i've been skipping the breakfast because i feel nauseous at the thought of food before 12pm... i try to eat a bigger lunch to make up for it but my dietician says i really need to be following the meal plan and that anything extra i add to doesn't "make up" for not meeting the minimums laid out i suggested that i just have a hot chocolate and tackle my fear of liquid calories without having to feel sick in the morning but she said the bargaining is just my ed speaking how can i do this?

struggling to get back on track after covid. i think i was either weight restored or really close to it about a month ago, and then i got covid and everything went to hell. i couldn't eat very much while i was sick, and i know from doctor's appointments that my weight's gone down. i don't know how important that is at this stage of recovery for me my rd says i'll gain it back if that's what my body needs and i'm getting enough to eat but the way my hunger cues have been since covid have left me feeling disoriented. it's been a month since i had covid and i still haven't been able to re orient myself to eating properly. i'm going anywhere from 4 8 hours without eating during the day even though i have automatic snack reminders set up. i just don't feel physically hungry anymore until it's been so long and i'm starving. when i finally do eat, i'm driven to eat somewhat bigger meals and or go for more calorie dense foods than i think i would otherwise have wanted. but because i know it's been so long since i last ate i try to hold myself back so it's not completely overboard. i've only very rarely felt the out of control feeling associated with binging, but when i get to this point of going nearly half a day without eating, if i get the amount of food that sounds like enough or satisfying, i sometimes end up feeling uncomfortably full and i want to avoid that. my rd wants me to go back to mechanical eating for a while but i just can't make myself eat when i don't feel hunger in my stomach. and the longer this goes on, the more i get the thought patterns that i gained too much in recovery and this is my body telling me i've been eating too much. i know gaining too much in recovery is not a real thing, but when you're in an objectively fat body, 99 of the people in spaces like this are much smaller than you, and your ed diagnosis starts with "atypical," it's really easy to feel like the exception to the rule. i know what i'm doing now is not working for me, but i don't know to how to get back on track.

staaaaaaahp spreading misinformation about extreme hunger.. no, it s not binging or bed. no, it s not happening because you eat sugar. no, it s not caused by your hormones. no, it s not a result of not eating balanced meals. the biological purpose of extreme hunger scientifically referred to as post starvation hyperphagia is to restore the body s optimal fat to fat free muscle mass ratio. you will continue to experience eh until your body has restored 1 fat free mass, which requires your body to achieve more than 1 fat mass fun fact: this is also why we overshoot . it has absolutely nothing to do will power, hormones, or swinging from one extreme to another , and everything to do with how your body functions and how it responds to a percieved famine both during and after. i m going to get real with y all: the reason the shit i mentioned above is circulating around in this sub, and most especially in other ed subs, is because y all are afraid of gaining too much weight and you need to address that internalized fatphobia. spoiler : there is no gaining too much in recovery; your body is smart as fuck and knows how to heal and regulate itself. whether you re all in or taking a slower approach, you can t recover without eating a lot of food, period. you can t starve your body for months years and then expect it to bounce back like nothing ever happened, like you won t gain weight, or only gain what you re comfortable with while eating what you think is enough. you have an eating disorder the entire problem is that you do not know how to feed yourself . and you certainly don t know how to cope with triggering situations if you did, you wouldn t immediately jump to restriction and fight tooth and nail to find any excuse to view eating according to hunger as immoral or wrong. so stop trying to find answers to excuse away your real hunger. the fact that you re trying to dismiss your hunger in itself is a disordered behavior. just food for thought pun entirely intended . thanks for coming to another episode of sareeee48 talks. edit: this is not an attack on anyone, especially those who are struggling to honor their hunger. that shit is hard. recovery is hard. but the level of misinformation that i ve seen being encouraged as of late is really not okay. remember that the advice you give may have real impacts on the people who read it. if you re determined to share your experiences or opinions, that is absolutely okay but at least make sure it s accurate and follows the sub s rules.

can t help feeling like this is so dumb. hi. i m sorry if this isn t allowed. i just turned 33 and i m starting to relapse a bit, and it feels like the dumbest fucking thing in the world. i know it is. i received 3 months of impatient care for anorexia back in 2 6 after nearly dying. i relapsed a bit when i got home but eventually stopped with the extreme habits. not sure i ve actually ever fully recovered though. i ve stayed preoccupied with food, at least more than the average person would. i still have weird food habits. i still avoid certain things. recently, and for reasons i m not entirely certain of, i started restricting a bit. i ve lost some weight as a result. not a concerning amount but enough that my family has noticed. i don t want to put them through hell again. i know better. maybe all of this is my subconscious trying to cope with my age. maybe it s my way of trying to hold onto a bit of what once was. either way, it s really fucking stupid. i need to actually actively pursue recovery like i should ve sixteen years ago. fuck eating disorders.

cultivating self compassion when recovery doesn t go according to schedule . hey y all, i have accepted a step up to a hloc after a month and a half in iop. i went into iop with a plan of how i d do everything perfectly, and it just didn t work. i m feeling a pretty wide range of emotions and trying very hard not to avoid them with ed behaviors . i ve done an okay job of holding steady and not backsliding, and i am somewhat proud of that, but i ve also been turning a lot of my grief at everything my ed has take from me inward as shame, embarrassment, and intense self judgment as well as externalizing it by feeling mad at my treatment team i have not expressed this by being rude snippy bc i recognize they don t deserve that . does anyone have tips for how to cultivate self compassion when you re struggling in recovery or admitting to needing a hloc? or how to avoid the pitfall of just being mad at staff? i would neeeeeever judge another person the way i judge myself and feel very compassionate towards everyone i ve met in treatment, but i m struggling to not see this as a massive personal failure.

unable to restrict; good thing?. so from thursday to sunday i ate like minimum gt; 3 kcal lt; each day; probably even upwards of gt; 4,5 kcal lt; on saturday, simply because i "wanted" to. it hit me a bit hard mentally, and lately these past few weeks i've gotten visibly bigger i don't know if this is true or body dysmorphia, but probably partly true . so in my grand smart head i decided to do one day of restriction still aiming for gt; 2 kcal lt; and nothing below ; but i kind of... can't? i feel unable to restrict, when it was once so easy... now i can't get ice cream or my evening meal out of my head, and i also want a banana with my evening meal... so that would put me at closer to gt; 3 kcal lt; again despite me telling myself to go lower. it feels impossible to go back to restricting, and it's so scary... i know i should gain weight and "listen" to my body, but i don't trust my body at all. all i want to do is eat, think about food, etc. i don't even want to do anything else, i just want to wait till my next meal, so restricting is somehow so much harder than before. a part of me says this is a good thing, but the ed simultaneously tells me the opposite. has this happened to anyone else; where restriction somehow feels impossible?

can we society, i mean get rid of the idea that losing weight is the only way to recover from trauma?. well, okay, first of all, has anyone else ever heard this, or do i just not understand how to integrate information into my brain correctly? bc both can be true. literally just saw a tiktok that was completely non ironically like if you heal your trauma, you ll automatically have an hourglass figure , which sounds wild at first glance but apparently not wild enough, bc i ve also heard people say that irl??? like, i ve even had a therapist say that to me irl???? first of all, body shape shouldnt fucking matter, amp; it s kinda dehumanizing to break down the entire vast and beautiful scope of what human bodies can look like into some people look like this inanimate object, amp; others look like a different one . second of all, as bad as all that shit already is, i d argue it s also really bad to assign moral value to body shapes. maybe i m biased bc i m an extreme pear, so i m not one of the good ones. but idk. all i m saying is, if it wasn t impossible for a man and shameful for a woman to look like me, i probably wouldn t have an ed. also, like if i ever heal from my trauma, i m still gonna look like this. i had repeated trauma of a specific type when i was 19; i was pear shaped before, amp; i continue to be pear shaped now. my life wasn t devoid of trauma before that, but that s kinda the big one amp; i still look like this. the goal of healing from trauma shouldn t be weight loss, the goal of healing from trauma should be literally healing from trauma. bc nobody deserves to be traumatized, amp; that feeling isn t good when it happens to you. i, as a human being, deserve to not have to put up with my trauma responses everyone deserves better than what happens to their mind amp; their body when they have ptsd or a similar disorder. why can t we focus on that, instead of how my body carries weight?

light at the end of the tunnel???. hi there. i m a recovering anorexic restrictive dieter i was for 3 years , and currently suffer from be due to the extreme dieting. to recover, i ve been working with the all in approach for the past 5 6 months and have gained about 18 2 lbs. i ve recently made a realization that my appetite has become more regular? i ve been able to eat and then not crave have an itch after dinner to eat more or think about food. i ve also noticed for the first time in the last 3 years i am not thinking about food constantly or what when my next meal will be. do you think i m getting closer to recovery? also does anyone know specifics about set point weights and when there weight normalized? thank you

realized a sensation. or maybe recognized it. i ve always said that feeling empty safe for me. just in case for what, i don t really know. tiny backstory here, but my husband and i are recovering our marriage. i m in recovery for alcohol, he is still drinking. we both fucked up some things and this past year, we ve been working together for once. but he is still going to raves, multiple music festivals, concerts and often with this woman he works with. i know nothing is going on, but it hurts. i m so uncomfortable with it. raves especially. half naked, 3 4 naked girls and this woman from work dresses that way too there. i always feel sick to my stomach, less than and old. well, a few days ago, he was out drinking with some guy from work who is also an alcoholic, and after driving up the hill, he went back to his place and drank more. those things, and him driving don t me me started, i hate it after drinking make me scared. i become hyper vigilant. so i wrote, i deserve to feel safe on my wall of positive affirmations my therapist had me create. tonight, when he left to go a local concert, with her and the guy, and after seeing what she was wearing, i started to feel awful again. and here is the big epiphany. i don t feel safe with this either duh, right? so, i worked off the desire to purge by sweeping the yard and i feel better. mainly because i now understand what i m feeling. it s honestly a breakthrough.

i'm not your girl to talk to about eating disorders and your food body image problems. everyone seems to think that because i have struggled with an ed for such a long time that means i'm the perfect person to come to discuss their food and body issues. i'm in recovery, why do you think that's a good idea? it's so triggering i hate using that word i've dealt with an ed for 1 years and i've probably spent the last 2 solidly in recovery. but my relationship with food and body image is still incredibly fucked. like people will talk to me about how they didn't eat or how they ate too much and i know it's part of the competitive, validation seeking ed mindset. but leave me out of it. it's so upsetting for me to listen to. sometimes they will even compare to what i eat which makes me feel really awful. at one point i had a roommate that did this constantly and luckily he moved out early. my friend just sent me a text "tw eating disorder" and then sent a long story about a camper at the summer camp he works at who is presumably struggling with an ed, but i only glanced at the texts because he started going into a level of detail that makes me very uncomfortable. i mean, if you have to say "tw eating disorder," then that is something i don't want to engage with entirely. a tw is not just a heads up, it's a sign that this is something i shouldn't participate in.

i need help. i don't know what to do and i feel trapped. i'm hungry all the time. i can't do anything about it except eat till i feel sick. it's ruining my life. i got around it by throwing up but i read some stories about fucking up the oesophagus and don't do it anymore. i just looked up laxatives to see if it would help. i keep punching my stomach because i hate it so much. i just want to never be hungry. i'm really starting to feel like loosing my throat and my teeth over it would be worth it. i know it's fucked up and here i am, asking for help. i don't know what to do.

how does a day of extreme hunger look for you?. not asking for calories or anything like that, i would just like to know how other people are dealing with extreme hunger and what feelings and thoughts arise throughout the day. i feel like i m constantly battling with two demons, one telling me i m a fat pig who should go on a week long fast, the other telling me to stuff my face every waking moment. i guess i haven t fully given in to extreme hunger yet, in order to do that i feel like i need to isolate for six months.

help i feel guilty. i ate several small cookie and biscuit things today bc they were so good and i feel a bit nauseous now and in my head know yeah, it s okay, now i know if i eat that many i don t feel great but it s okay. i just feel like it s the absolute end of the world and i m the worst most greedy person ever and i don t know how to move on from this feeling of guilt. does anyone have any encouragement or advice?

going to work on that exercise compulsion today . the other day, i posted a lengthy description of my situation, and although i didn t make as much progress as i would have liked, i was able to reduce my daily walking from 8 9 miles down to 6 miles yesterday and i was able to not body check at all, despite extreme urges to do so. today, my goal is to reduce that mileage even further, down to 4 5, and not body check at all. i hope it s okay to post this here for accountability; oftentimes i ll start the day with motivation but then my compulsions and urges to exercise get too strong. so i m hopeful that by posting this here, i can proactively get ahead of those urges. i received such kind responses on my last post, thank you for this community. i m rarely open about my eating disorder and situation but i feel somewhat safer here on reddit. updatt: thank you so much for the support i ve not been super successful, but was able to reduce it a bit, which i m proud of. if it s ok, i hope to use this platform to keep myself accountable, because i d really like to start tomorrow with no exercise at all. i ve been inching towards that, and i really think it s time. i think i can do it. i think i need to do it. i genuinely do not like exercising. i m not an athlete, i never enjoyed sports in my childhood, so i m aware it is merely a compulsion rather than ever having been true enjoyment of the activity. i m ready to quit. small steps are great but i m hoping i can make a really big step tomorrow

two packet of sweets?. sooooo i don't know if this is allowed, but hey ho, more of a success story so me and my partner went to the shop and bought some sweets, i've really had a craving for this for a while, so he bought me two packets, i'm currently eating them, it's stressing me out but i don't want to be ungrateful so i'll try my best to eat them

extreme hunger and high pulse. hey i'm in an all in recovery and extreme hunger hits pretty hard for about 1.5 weeks now. i don't fight against it at all, eating a huge amount each day. i noticed that my pulse which was at about 65 7 beats per minute before extreme hunger is now at 95 beats per minute when i'm relaxed and after eating even higher. i don't feel that at all, i feel pretty good to be honest and just noticed it because of wearing my smart watch. still going to the doctor because it's scary. did anyone else experience this? i never heard of it in any recovery post.

when ed reddits seem to be the only outlet. i ve been struggling for over a year now between restricting, recovering, binging i ve been told that it s not binging by others but it feels like it when i m going through bouts of eh and i can t talk to any of my friends about it, they don t care, and my family goes between being the reason i started restricting when i was extremely overweight and still make comments that make me want to go back to restricting and trying to encourage me to eat more because they thought i looked sick. so i have no actual support it feels like, but these reddit s are the only place i feel not so alone and i can t tell if that s helpful or just kinda sad ha

stomach grumbling. so i was just thinking about this, but hunger looks so different for me now. i m sitting here hungry yes yes i will cook dinner soon and i just feel weak and tired i know it means i m hungry . i got to thinking about how before my ed my stomach used to grumble like crazy when i got hungry. i would also have to like squeeze my abs during an exam so that my stomach wouldn t be crazy loud. but now my stomach just doesn t do that anymore?? idk not really a huge deal i was just wondering if anyone else has experienced this. lots of posts recently have been talking about how hunger shows up different for them and i feel like for me now i just get so weak and shaky and there s no warning from my stomach.

has anyone here had therapeutic ketamine for their ed?. i just finished 6 sessions of therapeutic ketamine 1 booster plenty of posts in my history about it . my psychiatrist and dietitian, both ed specialists, recommended it to me after i seemed to hit a hard wall in recovery, in addition to medication not being as helpful for me despite trying over 1 different ssris in 2 years and lithium. the psychiatrist at the ketamine facility also agreed that it would be extremely beneficial, and his wife is actually an ed specialist so i do trust him. i immediately found it very helpful. it gave me self confidence, and the moments that i was under the influence allowed me to have some time away from my body. when i was done, i felt less burdened by my bdd, ed, and other obsessive thoughts and comorobid mental illnesses . my husband noticed a profound and incredible change in myself. my therapist found i was more receptive to her suggestions for healing. i had my booster on friday you have to get repeated boosters and found it wasn't as helpful as the last ones. it's been a bummer, but i believe it's to be expected, especially early on. regardless, i don't feel as out of control and terrified as i used to. sure, i'm still thinking about weight loss and eating, but it's not backed by a frantic need to do something about it right now or i'm a failure. i have had a hard time finding people who have gone through this process. there's a subreddit here, and it's been helpful. has anyone else done it? how did you feel it helped your ed? if you have questions for me, please feel free to ask.

anyone else eating every 3 mins?. back in my ed i had a food rule that i was only allowed to eat every 4 hours minimum. now i literally eat something, a meal or a snack, every half an hour and at the very most an hour at which point i'm ravenous lol

will school help me or set me back from recovery?extreme hunger btw. once school starts,i m not gonna be able to eat consistently as the rules for me school are kinda strict when it comes to eating during learning times.i ll have to eat at 7 am for breakfast and lunch starts at 12: 12:3 .i feel like i m gonna be distracted from food all the time and this can help me regulate my meals but i m also thinking this will not help me fully recover.ultimately i ll have a breakfast,lunch,after school snack,dinner then dessert

taking tentative baby fawn steps towards the concept of recovery. i ve been doing some trauma work the last six months and hoooo boy has it reactivated old restrictive eating issues from when i was a teen 2 yrs ago at this point . it feels distinctly different this time around the first time was more akin to what i think of as the media portrayal hating my body, comparing myself to celebs looking at thinspo, skipping meals entirely, terrified of gaining weight, wanting to be skinni . this time around it s more .practical? but also bleak. i understand completely that this is a maladaptive coping mechanism, and that there s no ending other than recovering myself, recovering with assistance, or doing my body severe physical harm. i see self assessments where they ask about whether you re terrified of gaining small amount of lbs and i m really not. i don t feel great when i gain but i expect it to go up and down. i don t love my body, but i don t hate it either. i have no na vet or hope that this will end with me feeling happy with myself or having the ideal body type. mostly i m just controlled by the numbers and food centered ocd thoughts actions, but it is definitely impacting my quality of life and mental health. hoping to get some perspective on: 1. have you ever told a therapist psych about your issues while also explaining that you re not ready to change anything yet, and if so how did it go? 2. have you had periods of time where you feel possibly almost maybe ready to recover but don t want to start yet? what tipped the scales over into pursuing recovery? 3. do you see an ed therapist and if so what do you find helpful about it? do they act as a regular therapist too or is it a food specific add on? i already see a regular and trauma therapist and adding on a 3rd feels like a lifestyle 4. any books or media you d recommend that helped you understand the how s why s of it all, or helped you with harm reduction techniques? i really appreciate this community, and thank you to anyone who takes the time to read through this.

to cover my mirror or not?. i m really struggling with body checking constantly. i ve tried lots of things my therapist and dietician have both suggested but i continue to struggle. my dietician wants me to try turning my mirror around this week or at least cover it from my neck down to avoid body checking. i do not want to do this. mostly because i really don t want my room to look kinda messy with my mirror covered i am a very organized person lol and turning it around would also be an eye sore for me. i m also not sure avoiding myself is the best thing to do. my therapist agrees but says that turning it around for at least a week might help create a healthy pause in my body checking. idk. what has helped you? has avoiding the mirror for a while been beneficial?

how to deal with eating more than your family?. i m home for the next month and generally really happy my family is super supportive and amazing, so i m glad to spend time with them. however, i feel like i eat way more than then and it s hard not to compare. when i m at college, it s easier to focus on getting what i need but now i feel weird about eating so much. for the record: this is all my weirdness. my family makes sure i have a lot to eat and never says anything mean. in fact, they re glad i m eating well. does anyone have tips to stop comparison?

a bagel company donated about 2 bagels for the entire staff friday .i am questioning how i was able to consume so much. i ate about 8 1 bagels within 2 hours with no pain and i m still wondering how i was able to do it.i then made a ice cream sandwich with a couple of them

i feel like i don t even deserve to eat anymore and that i don t need as many calories as i do. tw numbers . i ve been in quasi recovery for a week or so now, but because depression and dysphoria has been hitting hard i ve no longer been exercising. because there s literally no physical exertion, i can t even justify the minimum of gt; 12 calories lt; and i feel like i only need deserve gt; 8 lt; calories. i was so close to recovering but i m just falling back in because i never really got out. i guess it s worth noting that this also an attempt to self harm because i haven t been able to give up one method or the other. i can t stop harming myself so i either hurt myself or i restrict and i just can t find it in myself to stop punishing myself. i honestly just need someone to tell me that it s okay to eat. i genuinely feel like my metabolism is so slow and i m gonna end up gaining weight if i even eat lunch.

discombobulated recovery rant tw. i have been on and off recovery for about a year now, i frequently get guilted into recovering by family but i feel like they give me mixed signals. some days they might say they jokingly?? want me to eat until i'm 2 lbs overweight. other times they say how when i was younger a child i could have been a model. and like i know they dont have poor intentions but my disorder stems from my self worth solely being what others think of me, how i look and my weight. at my lw, people told me i was pretty in public, and people actually looked at me. i cant voice this to anyone irl tho bc it's most definitely pathetic. i try to put value on other parts of my life, but still people comment on how young i look, and i am afraid that if i gain then i wont be special anymore. also, the only reason i can bring myself to recover is for my s.o family, but not myself. and when my doctor asked how i lost weight, i was truthful, but all she said was "you need carbs, protein, and fat for energy ". tl;dr: i wish i could stay small so people could perceive me that way and be nice to me, and i could have the childhood i never had; recently got a bunch of free clothes and i started obsessing over the sizes and how they fit me. i now feel the need to lose weight again despite getting over a virus.
gaining 1kg a day. i have been gaining 1kg a day for the past 2 days. is this normal to be gaining so fast?

sick of people on tiktok using every single trend to show off their eating disorder. even people who preach recovery show off their sick body or talk about numbers or disordered behaviors and it just doesn t sit right with me

weight restores and eh. how do you deal with realizing you are at a healthy weight level as per eating disorder team, but cannot stop eating and cannot stop gaining weight? how do you overcome the fear of ever becoming obese from the lack of control? any thoughts, stories? and how much is too much really? i feel like it will not end and i panic as i sit here with an empty jar of peanut butte i inhaled and think of the caloric reprucussions. anyone eat cereal or junk non stop? thanks

relapse tw: numbers . i m at a really weird place right now. i feel terrified over the fact that i m relapsing, but i also feel glad proud : i started recovery in january of this year because extreme hunger hit me and my health was failing. i had extreme extreme hunger and was eating minimum of 1 k calories a day for months straight and i ended up gaining 6 pounds. although it isn t fun to admit, the thing that caused my anorexia was the weight loss, so the extreme weight gain caused me to become nearly suicidal. it makes me so so so sad and so ashamed to admit it, but when my extreme hunger began to slowly lessen, my deep insecurities instantly made me begin to try to restrict again, and i just feel so scared now this time around because i now know what the repercussions of my actions are. i know that this ends in extreme hunger, confusion, edema, etc. and it scares me so much because recovery was the hardest and the worst thing i ve ever had to experience so i really don t want to start from the beginning again, but at the same time i feel completely unable to continue with recovery because i just simply cannot accept my weight gain. i m embarrassed over the fact i m this disgustingly vain, but i just don t know how to help myself. my happiness is dependent on how i feel about my body, and it is so painful to live like this. i don t know how to be okay with my life unless i m okay with my body. i m struggling so much and i m so conflicted because my rational mind is frightened over how this could possible end, but my emotional mind is proud of me for restricting because it cures me suicidal thoughts and makes me feel better.

anybody else with extreme hunger do this as their first meal?. every single time,first thing in the morning as my first meal, i would make this really nutritious meal for me to eat,then the rest of the day it s just ice cream peanut butter granola chips crackers poptarts.maybe i m just hoping for the day where i would be satisfied with that oatmeal banana and toast,someday

i have a extreme hunger travel bag with me now.it s my man bag. this thing has helped me honor my cravings without feeling extensive pain.it contains: lactaid sweeteners toothbrush and other dental things tums gas x green tea this baggy shirt i like
