more candy in recovery. ever since recovery i've needed more candy to feel "satiated". that's all well and good, but when i eat 4 grams of chocolates and a cup of cocoa before feeling satiated, the feeling of illness usually strikes first uncomfortable, but damn that was some good candy so i feel way too full, and somewhat nauseated in a way only too much chocolate and sugar could make you... but i don't want any more candy now at least but boy a glass of milk sounds delicious... have a good weekend, friends :

well i did it lads and lasses. i didn't go on the scale and check my weight today. i always do it saturday mornings, but i think it's holding me back. who cares about a number on a scale, when i can eat what and how much i want, feel better, and worry less? this is a win win situation; let's just hope i can stop weighing myself entirely. on a side note, the last time i went on the scale it showed the highest number i can remember seeing, so the temptation to check my weight is really strong today

anybody got a extreme hunger survival guide. just as of late i've chosen recovery absolutely life changing when your fueling your body enough i've been enjoying the gym aiming to get bigger when just a few months ago i was deep into anorexia, but after upping my calories recently i can't stop eating i wake up try have a breakfast then just stay hungry and not satisfied all day and at night i eat till it hurts i don't restrict or skip breakfast the next day and yet i'm never satisfied and it's effecting my social life more than restricting did ; i exercise i make sure to get protein and healthy fats and carbs in but still it's like i need more i'm scared i've developed bed not anything else

another lament on the ed to gymfit trope. this has been in my brain these past weeks and i just need to get it out to look at it from the outside and to reaffirm how silly it is. so yes i am as influenced as the next person by these i used to have an ed and be skinny now i go to the gym and i m fit tropes. i know in a lot of cases these people are not recovered or have simply traded one obsession for the next. when i was in my og ed phase i used to work out so much and since then and now in this relapse i only work out once or twice a week only as i find it often makes me tired afterwards and hinters my productivity in other areas like work and college. my life is just different than it was back then plus add 4 years and the side effects of malnutrition. i want to accept this even if i constantly feel like i m being lazy and yearn for my old disordered gym obsession. while in a realistic world i want to be medium fit, i m just not a sporty person. so now when i m considering recovery again and slowly trying to build up the courage to take the leap, i keep thinking ok then i ll have more energy when i eat more and then i should work out more like those people on fucking instagram. but i also know i probably won t do that despite having the energy, my life is still busy and i won t have the time to. and it s hard to accept that i won t be a ed to gym fit success story. the weird thing is that of all my friends i am almost the only one who does formal excercise. one friend goes jogging on occasion, another rides her bike to work more often. but i keep thinking oh everyone goes to the gym when in real life i am the only person i know who has a membership even. my friends aren t doing weighted squats and pull ups so why am i beating myself up if i don t do that either? one reality check to go please

how to keep recovering when you have a lack of appetite from covid?. i tested positive for covid and of course the harshest symptom i got was a complete lack of appetite. i genuinely forgot to eat for two days straight because i had zero hunger pangs or any sort of acknowledgment from my body that it needed food. the idea of eating was so nauseating that i couldn t even eat an entire saltine cracker; it took me a good 2 minutes to eat one of those tiny bowls of mashed potatoes from kfc. i ended up settling for nutritional drinks despite having to take those slow, too but i don t really love them and could use any suggestions on foods that are somewhat enjoyable and easy on the stomach. i know nutrition is a key part of covid recovery but it s really fucking hard when my brain doesn t want food and my body doesn t want to keep food down especially considering i ve consequently lost weight. this has been a huge mess for both myself and my mental health, any help is v much appreciated :,

exercise is driving me insane. i feel like i'm still not fully in recovery partially because of the fact that i'm still forcing myself to exercise, but i don't know how to stop. it's not about losing or even maintaining weight at this point, it's just about doing 'enough' to the point where it's kind of obsessive. i tried not exercising at the beginning of recovery for a while around 2 weeks but it made me miserable and i quickly started again. i do sometimes exercise purely out of joy but most of the time it's feeling like i have to, and i always force myself to do at least one activity a day. i know this isn't healthy because i always feel too tired, i get upset over it and it stops me from enjoying things i otherwise might rollerblading, dancing etc. i just don't know what to do. i feel like i can't get out of this mindset because it's 'to meet the minimum i need each day'. i'm just really worried i won't want to do any kind of movement if i don't force myself amd i'm scared it'll damage my health if i don't enough. does anyone have any advice? thank you

sugar and recovery. hi i m almost 8 months into recovery and i ve just now started eating more sugar. my body wants a lot of it but now i m getting so many headaches and stomach aches and i feel like shit. it s kind of the only thing that really satisfies me. what do i do?

this really is never ending isn't it. i've been struggling with anorexia since i was 14, coming now to my tenth anniversary on and off with the last three years spent recovering. despite only beginning my recovery process out of need i had to take care of my family and i couldn't do it if i nearly fainted every time i stood up over time i started putting effort and energy into my recovery, instead of just pushing my ed away and slipping into other addictions. a week ago i looked at myself in the mirror for the first time since i was a child and actually thought that i looked okay, that my body was not only acceptable but beautiful, i am eating whatever i want with only paying mind to when i'm full actually hungry. i thought it meant that i was done, but now i'm fixating more and more with the way i look, with what and how much i eat, looking with envy at the people that surround me. my closest friend is also in ed recovery although she's still way deeper into it than i want to be and we both just met someone who was hospitalized for an ed, so seeing the way this person looks behaves is kind of triggering. i find myself consciously and knowingly wishing that i could go back to just let my ed take control. i feel stupid and frustrated and at this point am really starting to worry that i'll have to deal with this forever. i can't talk about this to anyone without triggering them or being treated like a crazy person, so this only festers inside my head.

im on my path of recovery but im in so much anxiety. hi all i've found this subreddit to be very helpful the past few days. it's a lot to read but i appreciate you a lot if you do. i'm 2 . i have been struggling with anorexia binge purge type for almost 6 years. in october 2 2 , i was referred to a program at my hospital to get checkups on my eating disorder. i was i'm major denial about being sick or needing help. none of my symptoms stopped. in early 2 21 there was some progress in my weight but symptoms were still there. this is possibly due to the fact that i had no therapist or full outpatient team because " i was too busy" like i said. i was constantly told i'd have to go to the hospital if i didn't stop and was recommend to go to php. i kept saying i was busy. and i still just didn't want help. when august 2 21 came around, i got worse. i felt my energy decreaing quicker, work performance was bad, i didn't return to college. i got into a relationship in which i let my insecurities get in. my boyfriend wasn't fully aware of my situation or what even an eating disorder was, so a lot of things were said that i took to heart badly. in october i started calling php programs and also residential programs for help, but was turned away because insurance. so i gave up. i quit my job in december, and decided to try and look for help again, but no luck. i thought i'd use the time off work to focus on recovery but i just kept getting sucked into the eating disorder more. frequent doctor visits and seeing that i was declining in weight more, i grew happy. i found a therapist but i didn't seem to care. until april 2 22. i almost passed out in a public place. an ambulance came and my blood pressure was low. i spent 4 days in the er. i realized something needed to change. that i didn't want to die but i also don't want to gain weight. i stopped binging and purging slowly but i still felt sick due to not eating at all. in may, i was at my lowest and decided to go into the hospital for refeeding as recommend by my doctor. i had called a residential place that had a admission date for me, but in the end didnt work because insurance. i ended up doing php from june 23rd up until a week ago, because i was told i needed a higher level of care, even though i know i've been eating my meals and not binging or purging. turns out i'm still loosing weight even if i'm eating. i'm not sure what to do. i want to get better and i don't want my weight to continue to fall. i just want to be healthy. i've seen my doctor but he said to go to residential possibility, and hell see me in 2 weeks. i am eating. i am doing my best. i know i need help and i'm looking for a new therapist and now a nutrionist. but i'm scared my weight won't go up for weight restoration. i'm scared the refeeding sydrome is still going on and now i have a hyper metabolism. i don't know if anyone can tell me if this is possible to fix at home. what should i do?

thought i was fully recovered until i stepped on the scale at the dr s office and realized my weight overshoot was going down.. in recovery, my bmi shot up into the slightly overweight zone. this was a big struggle for me, because my entire life having a bmi of 25 was my worst fear. at first i kept telling myself the overshoot would go down and i wouldn t have to worry about dealing with those thoughts anymore, but after a year of overshoot i kinda just accepted it and moved on. today, i got weighed for the first time in quite a while, and learned the overshoot is finally going down. the feeling of relief and satisfaction i felt upon learning i was no longer overweight feels like a big step back because prior to this i thought i was fully recovered or very nearly so . i almost felt proud , even though logically i know that having a lower weight isn t a merit to be earned. any tips on confronting this lingering disordered thinking?

dae get really angry after eating?. it s not every time i eat but if i eat a huge meal, i just get so fucking angry afterwards. it s not even necessary about the food, or anything in particular, i just want to scream and smash shit up. i have no idea if this is normal, or how to deal with it for my whole life i have either taken it out on my self or walked it out.

stress and periods. heey i ve been in a recovery for a few months and so far i ve gained some weight back. i m still not weight restored and i don t have my periods yet. i know that i might need to gain some more weight and it also takes time to get your periods back, but i was just wondering how much stress effects it. if you have experience with periods being affected by stress more than how much body fat do you have, please would you share some tips what helped you to regulate the stress and how to relax and so on. thanks

amenorrhea and birth control pills. i'm using birth control for a long time. however, i'm really concerned about my bones health and possibilities of developing amenorrhea. i know some doctors prescribe birth control to people struggling with amenorrhea which i think it's the reason that i still have my period even though i'm malnourished. but i don't know if it's a good thing or it only masks the symptoms specially osteoporosis . i'd like to know if some of you had a similar situation and how you deal with it

hot. sometimes id wake up in the middle of the night full on sweating and feeling like a furnace even though here is winter. can this have something to do with my ed or be related to another possible health issue?

just got ice cream for the first time in years without guilt . i just got home from going to get some ice cream with my family at a wonderful local ice cream place. i got the peanut butter smores flavor and it was delicious i don't regret it or feel bad about eating it and i'm so happy recovery is worth it

is this a complication of having an ed. hi i am in recovery from an eating disorder, i have noticed that ever since i have recovered i have developed this thing where if i don't eat i get sick and i shake and i feel dizzy its like when i get extremely hungry. i was wondering if this is a common thing is a result of like restricting for so long?

i want my hair back. hi i am currently in recovery for anorexia, but i've noticed how thin my hair got... i miss my hair more than anything, seeing as it was one of the few things that made me feel beautiful. has this happened to anyone else? does anyone have advice, guidance, or support?

hypoglycemia after 6 yrs with a restrictive ed. i've been in recovery for since early may, with a few slip ups that didn't really last long. i started recovery for multiple reasons, but one of the big ones being that i was suffering from pretty consistent hypoglycemia. if i didn't eat enough every few hours, my blood sugar would be too low and i'd get very very sick. it's gotten much better in recovery, but it hasn't gone away completely, and it's been a bit more difficult lately as my appetite has kind of decreased and i honestly forget to eat or just... don't focus on it bc i'm distracted thanks adhd, hyperfixations are just awesome s does anyone have any tips on managing it? and does this ever go away or is it a permanent thing? i notice it gets better, but then when i mess up and don't eat because i'm busy and want to keep doing what i'm doing, it feels so much worse than it was before. i dont know if that's actually true or if i just feel that way because my symptoms were being managed before and i just forgot how awful it feels when your blood sugar drops. i've been thinking of getting glucose tablets for when i'm not wanting to get up and eat, though i need to work on taking breaks from tasks n such bc my hyperfixations are unhealthy for sure but i'm not sure. would it be worth it to invest in a glucose monitor or talk to my doctor about doing some additional testing? i did my a1c levels and estimated blood glucose ? levels almost a year ago in august of 2 21.
i wish everyone around me ate more. it would make me so calm

after eating i feel like a truck hit me and i have intense exhaustion as if i could sleep for days. in recovery from a restrictive ed and after i eat i feel like my body has been hit with a truck. the most intense exhaustion you can imagine washes over me and i fall asleep for what feels like a really intense sleep. i don t know how to describe the sensation. it s like a battery that needs to be charged but it s broken still and no matter how much i eat and sleep, i could have more. it feels very intense. this is just a vent because i think only you will understand. i probably look depressed or lazy to an outside perspective. but i really just feel like i need to rest. i don t know how long this feeling will last.

extreme hunger. hello i'm new here sorry if i make mistakes, i speak french and i'm not that good with english . it has been one week of recovery, and i'm going all in with extreme hunger. i'm trying to listen and honour my craving and hunger, but i've been eating 1 calories and more almost everyday. i was wondering if anyone experienced that too? i'm feeling a bit lonely and i'm scared that it's not normal.

worried about possibly unjustified extreme hunger. i m a college student who s very worried about the intense hunger i ve experienced since end of april . for context, i began going on a diet starting november of last year. i set a limit on calorie intake of around 17 calories. at first, i could manage the diet with willpower, but things soon went downhill. i started to have binging episodes once a week. there s a vending machine at my university dorm, and around 2 3am i would go there and buy candy and chips. feeling guilty, i tried to eat very little the next day. during winter break, i ate almost the same food items for breakfast 165 18 and then almost nothing else for the rest of the day. when school resumed, i tried maintaining my calorie restriction, but matters became worse. the foods i ate increasingly consisted of sweet, processed foods with clear calorie labels on them. towards the end of march, i decided to end my terrible dieting practices. i began eating as much as i wanted. but i soon noticed that i almost never felt full. no matter how much i ate for every meal and snack, i wanted to eat more. my constant hunger intensified in may, and ever since i would eat as much as two or three meals worth of food for each meal. i m writing because i m concerned about my health; i eat so much that i continue to rapidly gain weight, and i m worried this will eventually lead to obesity. i am nearing being overweight in the bmi range . i feel like i didn t restrict to an extreme degree while i was dieting. consequently, i don t understand why i m experiencing such intense hunger for such a long time. my lab results also don t indicate any underlying medical condition. tldr: i didn t heavily restrict while dieting, so my unending extreme hunger feels unjustified. i m afraid of what will happen to me if this continues.

extreme hunger even when my stomach is uncomfortably full. i've been trying self recovery for about a month, and i think i've been doing pretty well. my extreme hunger was pretty intense the first week or two, but it's started mellowing out, now it just comes and goes. there's only like a 33 chance it'll be an extreme hunger day now, rather than a 99 chance like it was in the beginning. amp; x2 b; before i started recovery, i would only get hungry a few times a day, be able to eat maybe at most half a portion of something, and still be uncomfortable after every bit of food. since starting recovery, i've been hungry much more frequently, i've been able to up my portions noticeably i can eat almost a full portion now, and i make up for what i can't eat in snacks and drinks , and discomfort is more like a coin flip rather than a given. amp; x2 b; i'm proud of my progress, and my partner's noticed and has said they're proud of me as well. even though it's not really showing in my appearance yet, and i haven't weighted myself, i feel healthier. by that i mean, i no longer feel like i'm going to have a heart attack or faint all day every day while living basically sedentary. amp; x2 b; still though, i have days where my physical discomfort levels with eating feel the same as they did before recovery, and i have to force myself to eat through the discomfort. as well, the smell of food will make me nauseous. it feels like my stomach and my throat shrink, squeeze in and tense up. especially on days like today, where extreme hunger is present, this is the absolute worst. like my whole body is screaming at me to eat and eat and eat, but my stomach can barely handle a few bites of food. i want to eat, but the discomfort makes it hard. amp; x2 b; does anyone know how to cope with this? should i listen to my stomach discomfort even though it will result in a low calorie day? or should i honour the extreme hunger even though it'll make me feel physically uncomfortable and miserable? i want to do well in recovery, especially after a really bad health scare. the mentality is there, but some days the physical hardships make it feel like i'm going backwards. amp; x2 b; also, please do not mention anything about refeeding syndrome or the like i have severe hypochondria, and it's already hard pushing through recovery with the constant fear of refeeding syndrome and recovery symptoms complications.

thigh gap life gap. this even feels corny typing out but i m trying to do some reframing. with my body changing thanks to recovery, i m noticing my thigh gap slowly disappearing. when i was actively disordered i took a lot of pride in the achievement of a thigh gap, especially because i d convinced myself that it would be physically impossible for me to achieve. i believed i d beaten my own biology by getting one and i honestly didn t realize how much sick pride i got from it until it began to go away. so i m trying to reframe its presence as something negative. when i had a thigh gap, especially a very noticeable one, my life was as empty as the space between my legs. having a thigh gap was a representation of the cavern my ed left in my life. it meant gaps in memory, gaps in energy, gaps in relationships with others. the distance between my legs was a direct indication of my distance from my goals, my values, my family and my friends. filling that space has meant filling my life with joy, positive memories, new love and old love rekindled. so seriously, which would i rather have? an empty space and an empty life, or a full life with legs that happen to touch eachother? seems a little silly to even think that s a competition.

i think i might be ready for recovery where can i start?. i have been struggling with anorexia and arfid since i was 11 12 ish. i ll be 24 in less than a month. i m a transgender man, on testosterone for two and a half years now. i have a significant history of family trauma and past abuse from a past relationship, i don t really have any friends or people supporting me other than a therapist and dietician, both of whom i see virtually and have taken a harm reduction approach. i like them both and want to continue working with them. unfortunately, there is not a residential, php, or iop program that will accept me at this level of physical complications, and i m unable to access a higher level of care. i m about to move to a new state in a week, and honestly, i am so sick of this eating disorder. i m 23, and i have hypoglycemia, osteoporosis, bradycardia, fainting spells, insomnia, gastroparesis, and numerous other medical complications. i m logically aware that i m extremely underweight, but struggle massively with body image and body checking rituals. i have ocd, ptsd, panic disorder, and emetophobia, as well as a severe exercise addiction upwards of ten miles of walking per day . failed out of formalized treatment multiple times; disowned by all but one member of my family like i said, i m trans . i know that at this point, my only option is to recover alone and this is what i m set on, please don t try to talk me out of it . lately my physical symptoms have been getting scary; i m fainting a lot, hardly sleeping, and unable to let myself sit down, stop exercising, or eat above a few hundred calories a day. medically, i feel like something bad is gonna happen soon unless i actually start eating. it s hard to remain steady on my feet, i feel like i m going to pass out most of the time. not looking for medical advice or the recommendation to see a doctor, but i guess my question is, where do i start, given the lack of social support and intensity of physical symptoms. i think the biggest issue is exercise. i don t believe i m at risk for refeeding syndrome, because while my intake is very low, it is consistent, i eat the same foods and the same amount each day, and have never struggled with binging, purging, or laxative abuse i am actually terrified of laxatives and have a phobia of vomiting . i do endless research looking for resources, huge fan of tabitha farrar and i have so many self help resources, i'm just insure how to get myself physically more stable given that i don't currently have access to medical care. how can i start to eat more, given that i don't cook at all causes panic attacks and want to increase my intake? i know relying on prepackaged protein bars, cereal, and crackers isn't the healthiest, but my main priority is to save my own life right now, and i know that means i have to muster all my strength and give this one last try. i don't want to die. my own parents told me to k ll myself, and i will prove them wrong. i want recovery, not death. but its getting hard to physically stay conscious throughout the day, and i know i'm running out of time. i don't have social or medical support, but i have motivation and the drive to live. how can i start to physically get myself eating something, anything, and reduce the extremity of my exercise compulsion? i want to live. from age 7 onward, i experienced some pretty extreme parental abuse. i developed an eating disorder. i have no recollection of a before or what a peaceful, happy life could be, but after all that, i still believe i can create one. the professionals i have seen over the years have described my situation as chronic, severe and enduring, but i still believe there is hope. where do i start? thank you so much for reading this lengthy post i hope it s alright to reach out on here.

so hard to face the outside world when i'm at a healthy weight. this is just a vent tbh, basically i hadn't left the house since i was still uw march bc of a depressive episode i'm now weight restored and i got a job and i have to go to work and face ppl everyday and i feel so uncomfortable in my own skin. i don't miss the ed but i miss not being so self conscious about my body all the time. ik no one notices my body as much as i do but for some reason i cant stop these obsessive thoughts. i used to be confident and now i can barely hold a conversation bc of how insecure i feel all the time. will this ever get better..

my dreams are changing . i m on month 3 of all in, through most of that my dreams have revolved around relapsing, restricting, or being unhappy about my recovery body. last night for the first time in my dream i said something like whatever happens i m sticking with recovery and i woke up like hell yes subconscious begrudgingly getting on board, hopefully they continue this way

tw exercise got my period back when i ve been over exercising more than ever. i finished my lifting workout today, went to the bathroom and had gotten my period for the first time in 7 months. gt; i lift weights at home for around an hour and a half 4x a week, i take 4 min 1 hour long walks, 5x a week, hike usually once a week, do 18 jumping jacks 4 times a day, and 6 minutes of calisthenics everyday. lt; i told my therapist some of these habits she tells me to stop exercising and only keep my walks but it s so hard to stop. i probably eat around gt; 19 lt; calories a day and i just feel so awful right now like everything s so pointless now. why d i get it back when this is the most activity i ve done my whole life?

tw: vent my teacher unintentionally triggered me. we were in the middle of a biology class and she started talking about, why not, nutrition. of course, it's okay for a teacher to do her job, but she literally said "do you want to live longer? eat less " and it affected me more than it should have. i'm trying to recover and planned to eat whatever i wanted today and now i feel the urge to restrict solely because of that sentence she said.

complicated relationship with cooking?. i don t know if i m alone in feeling this, but cooking is a deeply stressful activity. when i cook for myself, i find it really hard to stray from the same safe foods . i want to expand what im eating, but every time i go to cook, i feel paralyzed with fear and end up sticking with the same things. im getting so tired of eating the same foods, and i feel like i need to progress through fear foods by expanding what i cook. i find it way easier to cook new recipes if i m cooking for myself and other people. but i don t want eating with other people to be my permission slip to deviate from safe foods. does anyone else relate? if so, how did you overcome this hurdle?

we are lucky in a way. i was thinking today about the fact that consciously recovering gives us the opportunity to actively and intentionally rewire our thought processes and behaviors around food, so that with effort and a true desire to do so, we can become clean of food issues. this is really an opportunity that many people don t have. people without ed s are often still weird about food, and i would say nearly everyone is at best quirky when it comes to eating, weight control, whatever. it is ingrained in our culture to make food almost a hobby how and what we eat is in many ways an identity even for non disordered people. we have this chance, because we re forced to, really, to get away from all of that and become free of food issues. or even if not entirely free, at least aware and conscious about behaviors around food, identity construction etc. it s almost like having had an ed and then coming out the other side is a chance to be more healthy and sane around food than the general population. and definitely more educated anyway

how do you talk to yourself to soothe your shame?. when i give myself unconditional permission to eat i have certain mantras or affirmations i repeat to myself that sometimes help me mitigate the shame and fear that follows. they usually sound like i am not at war with my body, my body is safe, my body is good, hunger is my body communicating with me and my task is to listen and answer with love, things like that. sometimes though those things don t really resonate at all, they kind of just seem like meaningless sounds while the shame is so much louder. how do you talk to yourself when you re wrestling with your fear? what sort of things do you tell yourself that give you peace?

tw weight, pounds gained how much is normal to gain in ed recovery?. i'm pretty much doing recovery by myself, as i no longer have access to my therapist that i started recovery with. i really no longer have restrictive eating patterns, but i still struggle with like the mental physical effects of recovery. tw for weight mention, weight gain i have gained gt; 9 lt; lbs during recovery, and i feel like that's so much? i really don't know what's "normal" though, as i have not been in any recovery environment that teaches what to expect.

how to not skip lunch. i m working over the summer and only have a 3 minute lunch break. my colleagues all eat at different times so no one ever notices if i don t have lunch a particular day, and that means it s so easy to just skip it. i usually buy my lunch on my way to work, but often get so overwhelmed with all the options that i just end up not getting anything at all. how do i make myself have lunch?? i know intellectually that i need to gain weight and eat to have energy for work but i just can t do it. it doesn t help that i don t have any time to have my morning and afternoon snacks either

option for hloc or staying at a lower level wondering if anyone else has experienced this?. hi all for background, i am in my early twenties and currently in iop following an an relapse. i ve been at my current program for about six weeks and have made some really good progress, but i ve also somewhat plateaued and am still engaging in a range of ed behaviors. my treatment team is recommending i spend a couple weeks at a hloc as sort of a tune up jump start as they feel discharging me with my current frequency using certain behaviors could be very risky. i am a student, and they re concerned that without extra intervention i ll backslide at the start of the school year. me and my outpatient team were all somewhat surprised by this suggestion as i have generally been eating adequate amounts each day even with some restriction compulsive exercise for example, might restrict at a meal but overall intake for the day is good, or might make ed driven food choices but they still minimally meet my meal plan, or do some compulsive exercise but at low frequency intensity . my outpatient team basically said this would be a somewhat unusual step up in treatment bc it wouldn t be the result of me doing super badly in iop but instead a sort of safeguard method to get me doing even better and get out of this stuck zone. iop team confirmed that i m very compliant and engaged and that a some things are going well, they just see areas i m still struggling and that they think would be good to improve. my op team definitely hasn t discouraged me from trying a hloc but agreed with me that it might not be necessary and that this is ultimately my choice based on what i think will help me and whether i m willing to engage with the process. i m not opposed to trying a hloc for a short period because i really truly want to recover, but i m also concerned being at a hloc will surround me with people who are much sicker in a way that will be really distressing or something. i also feel a bit resentful towards my iop team that what im doing now isn t good enough and don t like the idea of putting myself in a position with less autonomy. has anyone been in this position before? if so, how did you respond? or if not, suggestions after reading through my ramble? i also want to acknowledge that, as someone with an ed, i am by definition not an objective judge of my behavior bc i m biased towards minimizing and my ed fights very hard to maintain it s control. i think a lot of my confusion indecision now is because my op team agrees this isn t absolutely necessary, which has left me uncertain how to proceed.

crazy. this is crazy to me. according to tdee websites, my current weight should be maintained at 17 calories, but i m literally maintaining this weight at 25 calories i m just a few kg over weight i m still recovering and got past extreme hunger but damn. how are they so off???

waking up to eat every night. hi everyone. so i ve been in a weird quasi recovery about 6 months, but the last two weeks after being threatened with residential and losing my op team i decided to really commit. i ve increased my intake each week, which the monitoring of my dietitian. however, i wake up every single night hungry. if i don t eat, i can t fall asleep. i m getting worried i m training my body to wake up to eat. i ve increased me caloric intake during the day and i eat a snack right before bed. has anyone else dealt with this?? it s very distressing

reminder that "its only okay to eat if i eat slow" is also a food rule.. i see a lot people in recovery and the intuitive eating sub, haha seeking advise on "how to eat slower" or "how to eat without distraction". when i was in beginning of my ed recovery i didn't even relise that this is indeed a food rule. i wanted to eat slow so badly so i could enjoy my food really i just hoped i would eat less if i ate slower sure, its nice to sit down once in a while to eat slow, but if everytime you eat "too fast" makes you spiral or angry at yourself, then its a food rule that has to be challenged. its okay to eat while distracted. its okay to eat super fast. you dont have to put your fork down between every bite. you are hungry. eat however you want. lt;333

could really use some support : . currently going through extreme hunger amp; i am trying to honor it as best as i can. ive been eating a lot. like a lot a lot. like a jar of peanut butter in one sitting a lot. the physical symptoms of this are terrible but my mental state is even worse, i constantly feel guilty especially because i am now weight restored. will i ever stop eating?? am i just going to gain and gain?

struggling bride to be. for the past year or two i ve been working really hard at not hating my body and not restricting myself. when i got engaged i knew that the lead up to my wedding was going to be a tough time because of all of the shedding for the wedding bs and pressure that s put on brides to look their best on the big day but up until now i had mostly been able to tune that out and stay positive. i m getting married in 6 weeks and out of nowhere today it hit me like a ton of bricks that i m going to be the heaviest i ve been in years on my wedding day. i literally haven t been able to think about anything else and am feeling so shitty about the fact that tens of thousands of dollars are being spent to make this day special and all i care about is how i m going to look. these are photos i m going to look at for the rest of myself and i don t want to only remember how bad i felt about myself that day. if anyone can relate or give some advice or encouragement i could really use it.

can you recover without going to a treatment center?. hello all, very nervous to be posting this, but i would really love some advice on this. i ve had an eating disorder for fourish years now, and have been in php twice and tried and failed to go to residential once. none of this helped me recover at all, and i always ended up worse than i started. i have the opportunity to go to a residential in a few days, if i say yes. problem is, im terrified to my fucking core. i tried to go to residential before, and as stated, didn t last two hours. i had a full breakdown and begged and cried for my mom to pick me up, and she did. this wasn t because i didn t want to recover, and not because i didn t appreciate the help, but because i genuinely couldn t handle anything about the way res is set up. i had severe separation anxiety as a kid and have autism, so these two things could be factors, although anxiety is generalized anxiety and not separation anxiety now. i want to recover, i really do. but i ve had no luck with an outpatient team for the past year and im doing worse and worse. if i didn t go, what do i do? how do i escape this hellish disorder? i really don t think that i can ever mentally handle res, or even php anymore for that matter. i ve never felt the kind of panic i do at even the mere mention of treatment. i lose all feeling in my body and hyperventilate for hours. i literally sobbed for 6 hours straight at php before i dropped out, with absolutely no breaks. any advice would be so so so appreciated

god bless carbs for breakfast . pancakes are perfection waffles are wonderful bagels and biscuits are beautiful toast tastes terrific muffins are marvelous ignore the cupcake emoji donuts are delicious pastries are precious edit: and cereal, french toast, and other beautiful breakfast carbs are included as well

can hunger "stack up" even in small amounts of restriction?. maybe a dumb question but it is suuuper frustrating. basically even though i have mostly been honoring my hunger, i still do small restrictions for example not getting seconds, only having one two full meal s during the day and eating something "lighter" for dinner even though i am trying my best i still feel like there is only a certain amount i can eat during the day and i cannot exceed that, and limiting the number amount of something i eat like the number of cookies, plates of food and etc. and every day instead of getting better my hunger has been getting worse, i have important exams and stuff and all i can think about is food. i am sitting in the kitchen munching on a bag of peanuts rn. i am scared to fully take the control because i have no external support. is it because i have not been honoring it fully or is that a small amount that would not affect it?

when is it okay to start applying gentle nutrition just make healthier options?. i m doing really well food wise, i pretty much just eat whatever the hell i want and have fear foods, but at what point will it be okay for me to start applying gentle nutrition or opting for healthy options etc. because honestly i feel like shit. my mom and dads side of the family both have issues with blood sugar and a high sugar consumption has big effects on my mood, energy, etc. my mom and i also retain water very easily, if i have too much sodium and not enough water or potassium, i wake up the next day and my face looks like a circle . i want to make decisions in my diet that will make me feel good internally, externally, not make me feel bloated 24 7 not fun and just overall make me more happy and energetic, but at the same time i don t want to fall into orthorexic tendencies. if anyone further into their recovery has any advice or experience i would greatly appreciate it

me and my dumbassery. me: nothing satiates me im a black hole i can t stop eating i will eat until i die also me: only eating safe and low cal foods and convincing myself that this is what i want i ate what i actually wanted today which was a shit ton of bread from a local taiwanese bakery, peanut butter, fried eggs and chicken, and other stuff i don t remember and for the first time in a very very long time, i feel satiated i rlly spent multiple weeks puzzled over why i was binging at night on diet food while never feeling satisfied when the answer was as clear as literally just eating what i actually wanted. like what a foreign concept wowwwww

weight gain in recovery and how stupid the fitness industry is.. so over the last two years i f have focused a lot of energy on tackling my ed which i have had since 2 16. it took a very long time for me to adjust my appetite and relationship to food and exercise i used to exercise a crazy amount and passed out in a lot of dangerous situations because i wasn't eating enough before exercising . i had to quit the gym outdoor workouts and focused only on yin yoga and meditation, which was a great idea and helped me clear up a lot of old injuries. once i was able to stabilize myself i turned to focusing on eating more and consuming nutrient dense high calorie meals and snacks. my body mass increased by 15 and most of it was fat because i was not doing muscle building or cardiovascular workouts. omg the differences are insane changing my body on purpose in the opposite direction people usually go also opened my eyes to how dumb the average person myself included is when it comes to health and fitness. 1 people are shocked when they found out i intentionally gained weight and stopped exercising. at the risk of sharing my personal information or sounding bitter i usually steer the conversation in another direction, but it's ridiculous how judgemental a lot of people can be. they act like choosing to focus on gaining weight and resting are a moral failure. it's extra hilarious when they are condescending to me about fitness because i used to be a triathlete and a personal trainer. i can still do one handed pushups. usually this attitude comes from men amp; not women. it takes literally everything in me not to just drop down into a set of 1 handed pushups or contortion when these people try to lecture me about the importance of strengthening or whatever. 2 coming out of the fog of fitness culture and doing what was right for me to get my health back on track so i wouldn't suddenly go into cardiac arrest from a brisk walk showed me how many fitness people are liars i used to be focused on my own workouts so never really cared or paid attention to the kinds of crap people said they did every week to stay fit i also did some pretty extreme stuff so it didn't faze me if someone said they did something extremely unhealthy . so many times i would join a workout group amp; people would tell me about how they never came later than 5 am to train, but when i showed up at 5 am no one would be there or when a guy told me he played basketball for 3 hours every morning but couldn't even do basic body weight exercises that anyone who works out for that long should be able to do. i don't mean to body shame or diminish someone's athletic ability but if you are blatantly lying about something you should be able to prove easily, that is laughable. it's also extremely dangerous to tell others that you can and regularly do such unhealthy things when you don't, because that normalizes extreme behavior i feel terrible for people who have no education on fitness hearing from these jokers in the gym or on the court about their unrealistic regimens when the only extreme thing they really do is take steroids and spend 2 per month on supplements. 3 in terms of my happiness, having extra chub is way healthier than being underweight. i got back into the gym recently and i'm able to keep up with a lot of my old exercise routines from when i was actively anorexic. i have more energy now than ever and can do intense workouts for longer than i could when i was skinny. i'm actually afraid of losing too much weight now because having extra fat storage makes me feel so much more comfortable and my heart is definitely thanking me during cardio workouts 4 people take my ideas more seriously now that i am not extremely thin and waifish. i don't know what that is, if it's my confidence or my appearance or both. i have a bachelor's degree in finance and am working on a graduate degree in statistics. i'm pretty smart, but before i took my health seriously the real way, not the compulsive and constant shaming way i had no confidence, which wasn't helped by my brain fog from poor diet i used to be shy about myself and afraid of everyone. even when i tried to project confidence, i was extremely nervous and insecure. i also got hit on a lot by really gross guys. i always felt like they weren't attracted to me or even my appearance so much as the idea of having a skinny blonde reciprocate their advances or maybe even go out with them. i sometimes wonder where all the compliments went but really i'm glad to be rid of guys that would harass an insecure and malnourished young woman constantly. 5 the amount of shame that gets thrown at people for whatever their body looks like. i just googled the words "skinny fat vs toned" and it's fucking hilarious. the pictures they show are of normal people who probably have a reasonable exercise regimen but the accompanying articles are shaming them for not being fit as if everyone on planet earth has 4 hours per day to work out and looks exactly the same at every point of their life. most of the pictures even appear to be the same person, just taken before and after an intense run or at a different angle. it's so sad that this kind of trash writing is readily available to people who are probably trying to research reasonable ways to improve their health. it reminds me of when i was anorexic and people said that i "looked great" even though i was extremely unhealthy. luckily in my detox from being deep in the fitness industry i've found some body positive health and fitness writers like the body coach who simply promote eating and exercising in a way that makes you feel healthy and confident in your athletic ability. it really makes me so upset to see the amount of misinformation out there about health and fitness, and i think these lies contribute to lack of athletic confidence in the general adult population. it's such a shame that these fitness rags and shitty food blogs encourage people towards yo yo dieting and body shame so that they can make money off of weird diets and home gym equipment that doesn't work.

it s not natural to count calories. please remove this if this goes against sub rules as humans, it s not natural to count and restrict our calories as humans, naturally, we eat what our body needs. all bodies come in different sizes and have different metabolic requirements. the whole reason we started dieting is because of stupid trends that become norms and expectations of certain people, and in order to look like that, some people have to change their lifestyle to something that is unnatural to their self, their body. unfortunately due to this disordered behaviour, our brain becomes confused because we re not giving it what it knows it needs i m saying this as a sort of wake up call for myself and anyone who might benefit from this. there s a lot to say about overweightness and underweightness but those factors are purely due to internal issues that stem from these stupid cosmetic trends and unrealistic beliefs and they manifest into their own problems. sorry if this was really unstructured, i m rambling and needed to get it out edit: an honourable mention to research is the vagus nerve. this nerve connects the brain directly to the stomach and is responsible for hunger cues. i think it s a very interesting and worthwhile topic to read about. it s the reason we feel endless hunger after a period of starvation, why we lose our hunger signals and why we have to listen to our body and not what we re trying to force our brain to believe we need.

gaining but not getting period and still losing hair. ugh this j feels so unfair because i only restricted for like a few months and it was high restriction and on and off but i pretty much immediately lost my period and started losing massive amounts of hair. now that i m in recovery, i m bloated everyday, gaining everyday and at least i don t bruise randomly anymore and i have the energy to get up, but i still don t have my period and my hair is still falling out. i j feel like i m eating sooo much and i didn t even restrict that hard for that long, so why is my body still not cooperating????? god i wish i never started this god awful diet in the first place i hate it here

signs you are not weigh restored even tho your dr may say you are . 1. you are still experiencing extreme hunger 2. you are still thinking about food, your weight, exercise, groceries, other people's energy balances etc and it takes up a lot of your brain space 3. you are still gaining weight despite hitting the "healthy weight" or "pre ed weight" markers hint: healthy weight is different for everyone during different stages of our lives 4. you're obsessed with your food being perfect in appearance, taste, temperature, etc while you may no longer ascribe moral value to food, every meal and snack still feels very consequential and you feel the pressure to enjoy it 11

i would consider myself recovered now 12 months in however, i feel like extreme hunger is back is this a thing? . title says it all really, i m healthy, so less good obsessed and would consider myself recovered. but extreme hunger is back. is this real? if so, any ideas on causes?

anyone else never eat vegetables?. since entering recovery 14 months ago, i haven't eaten a single vegetable that wasn't tomato sauce in pizza spaghetti or a potato. literally none lol. i simply never want vegetables and never crave them and apart from bananas and very rarely a tangerine or a nectarine i don't eat fruit either deep in my ed, all i ate was huge salads every day and fruit, but only berries nothing with scary scary carbs and i was so malnourished, weak, always hungry and had constant brain fog. nowadays i eat ice cream, pasta, chocolate, pb, bread and cheese every single day and i've never felt better my coworkers sometimes judge me because i'm obese by bmi now how about you try some of this salad i brought in? i could not care less lol anyone in the same situation?

your average 'recovered and leaving sub' post. hello all, haven't talked much on here in quite a while as i've pretty much recovered and getting on with my life as a graduate. thought it was time for me to leave the sub. i'm only making a post to say that because some of my posts from when i was struggling were very popular, so if you remember me, i want to show that proper, full recovery from an earing disorfer is possible. i probably won't be able to give any novel advice let alone anything more advanced than common sense , but my personal recommendations are: 1. you need to eat way much more than you think you do. eds change your way of thinking and you need to break through any 'maximum limits' you have in your head. those 'limits' only exist to keep your ed happy, not you and your body. 2. don't try to set a 'target weight' for recovery. obviously this doesn't often work if you have had medical intervention, but if you're recovering on your own. i tried to stop gaining weight 5kg below my set point. it blew up in my face. 3. eat the food you actually want. do not try to 'fill up' your desire for biscuits or pizza or ice cream with vegetables or rice cakes. instant binge trigger. 4. your body dysmorphia is lying to you. for months i was convinced i'd gained 'so much weight'. but then i got weighed recently for a medical thing and i'm the same as my set weight from a year ago. 5. if you binge in recovery do not compensate for it. it kept me stuck in the cycle for months. that's all i can think of. i wish everyone well, i hope you all recover and have lovely lives

heart health anxiety: . one of my main motivations for recovery is not dying of heart faliure but that is also getting away of my other motivations??? socialising, being healthy enough to gain some muscle to pass better etc. im becoming scared of even non food related activities with my friends because they raise my heart rate and that sends me into a panic raising my heart rate more and on and on and on . im scared to drink coffee i want to be able to participate in things im getting so frustrated that i wont be able to physically recover in like. 4 days how long does the arrhythmia and other heart problems take to get better? is there anything more i can do to speed it up? im sick of being scared of dying in my sleep im sick of being scared to go out with friends: related side note but in a fee days my friends invited me to come do edibles w them and im not even scared of the food aspect :d but the heart rate thing . is it safe to do heart rate increasing substances?? gahhhh im missing out on so much fuck eds man im. frustrated

back at it again.. body hate rant ahead... hate it. hate it. hate it. i hate seeing myself in the mirror. i hate going out. i hate that everyone's inviting me out while i look like this. not like anything's going to change if i push it back five months more, because they cycle always repeats. i hate the feeling of needing to throw up everything i eat and it's been two years since that feeling, but it's starting again every single time i see myself in the mirror. and i tell my parents and partner about this, but it's all bullshit. everyone says i look fine, my mom says i could just "exercise more", my girlfriend says i am beautiful. bullshit. once classes start and i look like this, i know i'm going to be ignored, trampled over, and treated like a doormat both because of how i look and because of how i act around people due to low self esteem. i don't want to be beautiful. i just don't want to be disregarded.
anorexia symptoms?. the one i'm experiencing rn is cold all the time but what are others that might go undercover or are not talked about as much?

extreme hunger at night. it s the same story over and over again each night. i get so hungry i literally cannot think of anything else and i eat everything in sight. i just had two giant cereal bowls, lots of buttered noodles, two yogurts, sixteen oreos, and two giant pastries on top of everything else i ate today. that was around 39 calories and my total is like 67 today. it s been like this everyday for the last 5 days: each day is no less than 65 . actually most days i average over 8 , but whatever. so thing is, no matter how much i eat during the day, at night i end up eating no less than 35 calories in one sitting. like seriously, in the span of an hour or so. and sometimes much more. i m just so fed up with myself and i rlly don t get why i get hit with these intense hunger waves at night. my ed brain always tells me that it s a nightly binge urge and that it s a habit that you ve formed and now you can t get rid of it, ever . ugh. i m tired dealing with the mental and physical discomfort. not sleeping at night. eating throughout it. dealing with the stomach pain and nausea afterwards. don t get me started on the horrible acid reflux. and waking up bloated, much bigger and with intense urges to restrict. i just don t wanna deal with this, especially at night. how do i stop being so hungry in the nighttime? i eat plenty throughout the day.

ate fear foods. i just chose to eat a dish containing 2 fear foods because it was all i had access to instead of skipping dinner because there wasn t anything i was comfortable with, which is what i normally would do. my anxiety is so bad i have a tremor and my heart is racing but my only other option was to not eat dinner and i needed the food. it had dairy and i haven t had dairy in a long time for no reason outside of ed so i chose to eat it vs starve. i am so scared i just want reassurance that i did the right thing? i m proud but i m so scared i hate this.

extreme hunger only at night?. why does it happen that during the day i struggle to eat and find myself feeling uncomfortably full after meals but extreme hunger tends to hit at night and results in me eating heaps of biscuits sweets, or even sandwiches and such which would make me full during the day, yet i don't necessarily feel hungry or full like i normally would and end up stopping when i either run out, get bored, or make myself feel physically ill? i'd love to be able to just enjoy my day especially on holiday but this is just making it extremely hard

aiming for quasi recovery? is there even a point?. so basically i've had an ed for a long time, like 7 years. but it got really bad 2 years ago when i got severely uw before i'd always fluctuated the same few kg and now i'm at a low point where my health is in shambles, strangers say i look like i'm dying and my life is severely impeded by my b p addiction i'm handsfree and purge many times every single day i've had periods of recovery in the past but always relapse. i'm very low and constantly think about death at this point, but i don't want recovery... i love my ed and i just want to get back in a space where i can b p without feeling as bad due to being too low in weight, where i can spend whole days without bping again, and be able to engage in low effort hobbies. basically harm reduction is this pointless? for me the choice is either quasi recovery or continuing down this path and letting this kill me... i truly don't want "freedom." but are my goals at all achievable or should i give up?

celeb eating disorders. i m honestly shocked i bought into the whole some women are just naturally skinny bull for so long. lili reinhardt is a celebrity advocating against ed s and it s so refreshing to see that. i grew up in the 9 s and early 2 s and so many of those women were so stick thin for their age and still are. i just read an article on victoria justice from 2 15 saying she had hashimoto s and making excuses on how she gave up dairy, sugar, etc. she said she was overweight at 115 pounds. this is someone who was 22 at the time and over 5 5. can we stop saying that s healthy? it disgusts me how ignorant celebs are and it s just perpetuating ed s. good lord. i would rather be healthy than feel sick and i m so glad i realized that and hope anyone struggling can too.

in a lot of physical pain from satisfying my mental hunger. hello just reaching out for some support, i'm sure others have been in this position before when honouring our extreme hunger so please share your experiences and what has helped you feel better in the past so today i woke up especially ravenous the very first thing on my mind was food, which is normal to me at this point but after 14 months of eh it had started to fade to being the 2nd or even 3rd thing i think of with an extreme extreme day once a week and i immediately knew it was going to be an especially hungry day. just fine by me, my body knows what it needs lol so i went downstairs, made myself a very creamy coffee and drank it as i toasted some waffles, i had 6 waffles with lots of butter, nutella, maple syrup and 2 bananas. i then waited half an hour and got started on some work and had to stop due to intense hunger pains, i felt completely empty, again normal to me... so i had 2 big bowls of cereal, cucumber and cheese and mayo sandwiches, a family bag of doritos and then some cubes of cheese on their own. feeling good again so i did some more work for 2 hours being able to think about work and not just food. 2 hours pass and man i'm hungry... i snack on raisins and trail mix and m amp;ms as i make pesto pasta with chicken and have it with lots and lots of slices of garlic bread. then i have some tablespoons of peanut butter slowly out of the jar as i finish up my work. i decide to do some of my hobbies but all i can think of is food mental hunger so i have a big hot chocolate with whole milk, marshmallows and whipped cream, and then once i have some more room in my stomach i have a tub of b amp;js, a tangerine for some reason, some waffle fries, i make a bacon sandwich with a fried egg and have that, a few cheese strings since i had really bad cheese cravings today, and then a few more bowls of cereal and some olives out of the jar. then i also had a bag of haribos and some rhubarb crumble with custard anyway... now i'm laying here and it feels very very painful for me to move and i can't stand up without feeling like i'm going to involuntarily throw up. i'm laying in the discomfort during recovery a bunch of times but this is probably the most full i've physically felt in a long time.

restriction makes you feel so much worse than recovery. so, as i m sure all non brits are sick of hearing about by now, we had a heatwave monday and tuesday. i literally could barely eat, it wasn t deliberate restriction i was just so sick and hot. i did my best but it was well under recovery minimums. but my god, i feel awful today, it s so much worse than all the physical side effects of recovery. this is definitely enough motivation for me not to lean into restriction when physical symptoms of recovery make me feel terrible, i know now exactly how misguided that urge is. i know of course that consistency is important in recovery and restriction needs avoided, intentional or not, but i honestly feel so much more secure in my recovery progress now having remembered just how bad restriction is. i m eating as best as i can today now it s cooler, and i m already feeling better, who d have guessed food gives you energy, groundbreaking huh

what s the difference between mental and emotional hunger cravings?. i get regular physical hunger cues, and i m not super underweight early in recovery. i eat the recommended calories for someone of my sex, height, weight, and activity level to maintain. however, i also am constantly thinking about food. i am chronically stressed with work, so i m scared that i really just want to stress eat. but i can t focus on anything besides food, and it s awful. i have to constantly be eating drinking something to focus, so i end up drinking exorbitant amounts of diet soda and eating a bunch of little snacks instead of proper meals because i just want to be consuming something all the time. i m disgusted with myself. my dietician says it s mental hunger, but i think it s just me being stressed, needing sensory input from chewing, and enjoying the taste of food too much. i m so busy that food is the only pleasure comfort i have time for because i can eat while i work. i just don t know what to do.

i made breakfast without measuring it out today. this sounds really simple i know but small steps are as important as big ones, right? i used to obsessively count calories and then i moved to macros and didn t realize all i had done was move to one disorder to another so today i just made some microwave oatmeal, grabbed a handful of fruit at random and made myself some hello kitty tea which i hadn t been drinking because of the carbs, even though it s such a small amount and it feels weirdly freeing i also want lucky charms after this. i ve had some left over for too long now and i really want lucky charms

i m doing pretty good in recovery, but today i weighed myself and i m struggling.. so i ve been recovering for a while now, and i m doing really good. i eat every meal, i have snacks, i very rarely still struggle with fear foods , etc. despite all this, my weight and numbers are still something i struggle with. i noticed that i m visibly gaining a bit, which i know is healthy and a good thing, but i decided to weigh myself to see just how much i gained. as the number was bigger than last time i saw it, i wasn t very happy. i m doing everything i can to not fall back into bad habits currently eating lunch, took the batteries out of the scale not mine so i can t throw it out . my mind is screaming at me to work out or change what i ve been eating and it s hard to ignore it. i know weighing myself was my choice, and a bad choice, but it s done now and i m not sure how to cope with it :

my boyfriend bought me fries and i feel so loved. i ve been struggling lately after i gained a few lbs and i m trying hard not to relapse i ve had some restriction days in the last few weeks and i haven t this regularly in years, but i ve managed to stay strong more days than not . anyway i ve been open with my bf about my mental health through all of this and today was a hard food day and he ordered food when he got home and didn t ask if i wanted anything and i assumed it was because he was so hungry he just wanted to order quickly he has adhd it happens but he ordered me my usual order when things are good, fries and a diet coke. he has never once in our relationship ordered me food i didn t specifically request because he knows that stresses me out generally but today it just hit so right. he knows me so well. he loves me so much. just had to share with people who i knew would get it
