haven t gained any weight but my clothes won t fit??. just genuinely wondering how??

hypothalamic amenorrhea period loss when to see a doctor?. so i know amenorrhea can really affect your bone density and possibly lead to osteopenia. a little less than a year ago i went to the doctor about ha, and she basically told me that if my period was gone for more than 8 months then my bones may be at risk, but until then i shouldn t worry. i began recovery around november of last year, and my period returned in january. by that point my period had been gone since july, so about 6 months total. my period was relatively stable until a recent relapse, and now i haven t had it since april, so roughly 3 months. if it s relevant i ve also always had really normal periods pre ed i ve been tracking them for years and it was extremely rare that they were ever even a day late in the past. anyway, at this point i m just wondering if this is something worth going to the doctor over? osteopenia is one of the only medical complications that i m genuinely worried about since it s not reversible. i never lost my period for 8 consecutive months so i m not sure if i m at risk, but at the same time i know my gp and most gps in general wasn t exactly well versed in eating disorders. if anyone has any experience seeing a doctor for hypothalamic amenorrhea or getting a bone dexa scan, what was your experience like? at what point does it make sense to get one?

a year in recovery how tf do i get back into exercising?. hey guys about a year ago i finished an intensive outpatient recovery program. i had non purging bulimia, so my way of compensation was always exercising. it s been a year, and i m heavier but feel so much better mentally and feel normal while eating however, i am so out of shape. i used to be able to sprint to catch busses, climb a ton of stairs, run for miles, etc. now, i sorta just dislike my body because it only causes me issues, and because i m not using it to do things, i get depressed about it. but the only reason i ve ever wanted to be healthy in the past was for weight loss back when i was disordered, an active fit body was a perk of the main thing. and it s totally been worth it rooting it out of my life, but i really want my heart and body to be healthy again. i understand that exercising requires routine, but every time i exercise i get so sad about the fact that i m out of shape, and exercising turns into a hugely emotional thing for me. and like, i genuinely don t like moving or exercising. there s nothing in it for me, except long term health. i m far more entertained with my mind and projects than i am with like.. running. but i want to run and be active. and usually i would simply focus on the weight loss benefits of it and that would motivate me to action, but i don t have that anymore. tldr: i need to find a way to want to exercise, but i ve only ever wanted to exercise because of my body. does anyone have any advice

i have been blessed by the bagel gads... praise be.. like i said up there, i have been blessed by the bagel gads. bagels have been a fear food for some time, but i got off work the other morning really wanting one. so i doordashed a couple read: 2 for my partner and i. yes i live lavishly sometimes, usually pay for it later. well it took a bit to get the order, but i wasn t complaining more just hoping it would get here before my partner had to leave for work. amp; amp; it did, and when i opened the door to grab it, behold a large, and rather robust, nearly bursting bag of a freshly baked varietal of bagels, 3 tubs of shmear whipped cream cheese like easily a dozen, but i did not count, cause it was past my bedtime. part of me feels like my gma sent these bagels, cause she was always trying to stuff us full with sweets goodies when alive, as any good gma should. note: she was wonderful . i m not religious, but i mighta prayed to the divine bagel maker that morning, wherever he, she, or they may be. i ve honestly eaten bagels for my last 3 meals, and guess what? i don t even feel the slightest bit guilty. tis a miracle indeed.

help answering. this post may or may not make sense since it s kinda hard to explain but i have this sorta thing where i don t let myself start a new day of eating until i have slept for at least 7 hours. what i mean by this is that i restrict myself to eat a certain amount of calories in one day and start a new day of eating until i ve slept at least 6 hours because for me that s when my body has refreshed its calories for that day. this wouldn t be a problem if i wasn t gonna be traveling all day airport so i won t be able to sleep at all and i m gonna probably restrict myself from eating all day until i ve slept 7 full hours. it sounds stupid but yea. if anyone can help like debunk this or something it would probably stop me from restricting.

can't stop thinking about recovery?. i find that i can't stop thinking about recovery. my thoughts are stuck on repeat about my next snacks, meals, groceries list, the physical discomfort and fullness i feel, fear that i'm doing things wrong, and all of the things i'm waiting to talk about during my next session with my dietician. is this normal? did i just replace my disorder with another obsession? should i give in to these thoughts and immerse myself with recovery content or try to do something else with my life?

day 3 all in and .. i m only 3 days all in but i m struggling to fully commit to all in i feel like i m still holding back a bit; anyone have any advice? i can tell i ve restricted today and still have not yet fully honored my hunger queues. also, i ve stopped exercising and lifting for 6 weeks now but how do i mentally manage to handle the weight gain especially with not working out?

depression has made it a lot harder to recover. tl;dr i m much less active because of my depression and i can t it s hard to keep the structure continuing with recovery : at first i could justify recovery by needing the energy to exercise and do things that i enjoy, but lately my day has been lounging around the house or going on short walks, which means there s nothing i m burning off. my appetite has also been nonexistent, so i ve just been mechanical eating. i m not enjoying anything as much, so my brain thinks i m restricting food and keeps thinking up a bunch of yummy, high calorie snacks. i ve often used food as a coping mechanism, one extreme of overeating ro undereating and i can t find balance right now i m struggling because i skipped breakfast, had a fear food for lunch, and then i made a safe food for a snack and my body is freaking out that i m going to restrict again. i want to eat more for dinner and tell my body it s going to be okay, but that shitty snack is going to satisfy me for hours . i m really hoping to feel hungry tonight, but by then i ll only have room for one meal instead of a meal snack to keep me on track. i m freaking out, i don t want to fall into restriction again.

compulsive eating in recovery??. hi, i d like some advice on this, please. i decided to basically just say fuck it and recover but i m having an issue with compulsive eating i think?? my dads girlfriend keeps buying me these massive gt; 1k calories lt;chocolate bars. they re really nice and when i want them i like them, but i feel an intense pressure to eat it even when i don t want them. for example i only wanted half the bar and started feeling sick but i felt like i needed to eat the whole bar just to get it out my head. just so i could stop thinking about it s existence and it being there. i wasn t hungry for it i just wanted it to be gone and finished and now i find myself feeling very very sick. do i continue to keep eating them or is there any way to distinguish between being compulsive or being hungry?? i don t know, i m just confused sorry.

could use some encouragement to help me be a little kinder to myself tomorrow morning.. i ve been experiencing a lot of physical health and mobility issues which i m guessing is down to my ed, current behaviours, and weight. normally i force myself to get up early on my days off to walk sometimes outside, sometime i just pace around my house . i m so tired, and all i really want tomorrow to to let myself sleep later than normal. even an hour, even if i just spend an extra hour awake but lying in bed. it sounds like bliss. tomorrow is my last day off for 6 days so i really want to use it to rest. although the thought of not getting my steps in, waking up early to be productive , and rest in general fills me with dread. i really could use some encouragement and support to get myself through tomorrow and hopefully be able to go through with being a little kinder to my mind and my body tomorrow.

the adhd subreddit is annoying sometimes. to treat adhd, many doctors prescribe stimulants, which can block your hunger cues. maybe i shouldn t have clicked on it, but i just read a thread where the op posted about going down a size and used the flair celebration . the comments were all saying how thankful they were that their stimulants prevented them from eating junk food, and a couple talked about how they wished this was the case for them. i m so annoyed y all i have adhd and am taking meds for it. i am in recovery too. doing both feels impossible and frustrating sometimes, especially today. i just needed to scream so now i am here lol thank you for listening
i just got my period. yessssssssssss bitch yesssssskdkfkcmcmmc

no appetite poss tw. i ve been in recovery for about a year and a half now. i put recovery in quotes because i m still struggling with restriction, but i ve been able to not binge and purge as much. recently, i haven t had any appetite. i ve kinda been forcing myself to eat which i feel isn t beneficial. has anyone else experienced this?

family doesn t get the eh and now i m suffering with high fiber foods in my stomach. they don t understand that i need to eat calorie dense foods.they say i m gonna become this obese man if i keep it up and they say i m emotionally eating and this will not stop.and to listen to my body when it s full, we ll guess what grandma,i m still hungry after eating a whole bag of trail mix,coconut chips and chocolate banana bites.how much do i need to eat to prove that eh is a thing.also,how long does this last?ive been anorexic for 1 2 months and im almost a week in with 1 set back day of restricting.i want to eat normally like how i did 2 months ago where i was a healthy boy who just got obsessed with keeping his unintentional abs and nice body.will this ever happen?

how does one handle the physical symptoms in recovery?. i was well aware of the mental issues that came in recovery but the god damn physical symptoms i was not prepared for. there is reflux from everything,diverticulitis,indigestion, constipation,cramps and nausea, eating a bite and im full. im tired of being so darn uncomfortable, like yesterday i pushed down a slize of toast and i was in horrible pain for 6 hours. i know my body is getting used to food, its going to take time to go from a very low amount of food to what my body needs but with all this jazz im still stuck in a "ima not eat because pain". any tips?

trying recovery for my loved ones but not sure if i actually need it. my family, best friend and even her mother and my mom's friend are telling me to go to a cemter speciized in eds with therapy groups and stuff but i'm so afraid to do it i don't think i'm that ill or if i even have an ed, everyone says i do and seems so concerned and i don't want them to feel like that but i'm afraid being around ppl who are worse than me will make me more compwtitive or something idk and i'm also very afraid about gaining weight, my mom and her friend who is a doctor begged me to not go to the gym for a time and eat all my meals even if it's a little, and i don't want to upset them but with every bite i feel like i'm getting fatter and i'm already so bloated... i just finished a whole apple and i hate myself for it, specially bcs i binged hard on saturday and i wanted to fast for a day or two to recover from that but now i can't. i don't want to cause more problems or get forced in the hospital but i'm so so anxious about all of this...
ed dream. dreamt that a guy i know told me i had gained weight in a serious tone, saying i am noticably fatter than when we first met. felt too real.

treatment centers monte nido chicago and rogers edc. has anyone been to either of these places recently? would you recommend? possibly seeking a higher level of care but have had negative experiences in the past and want to try and avoid that to the extent i can.

sudden trust in my body. i ll let it do its thing and let it decide where it wants to be. i m gonna honor my extreme hunger for as long as it persists, i m gonna get my period and finally start properly developing. after all, i m 15 and still growing and i don t wanna stunt my growth more than i already did tbh. maybe it s still not too late. i m already overweight but if i m still that hungry, it means i need to gain more weight. and you know what, suddenly i don t even rlly care about my appearance that much. i m still a teenager and i don t wanna try and forcefully change my body now i understand how stupid that was of me before it even had a chance to develop. i was literally mistaken for an 11 year old today at the store lmao that was a humbling experience. anyways, we eating until i get my period and finally start growing. i m so excited now actually, wish me luck lt;3

psychedelics and recovery. just wondering if anyone partakes in microdosing of shrooms or something of the psychedelic nature and if they ve noticed if recovery road to recovery has been easier? just something i ve been thinking about maybe trying ?

satisfying the urge to log calories by logging other habits. i ve tried to quit tracking calories many times over the years. but i could never shake that horrible i m forgetting something vitally important inkling after eating without logging it. it s like the same sixth sense of leaving the oven on. you can t go on with your day until you fix it. i started using an app to track my daily mood and habits meds, skincare, etc. and i didn t mean for it to do this, but the routine of logging something into my phone makes that feeling go away. it reminds me that i m not slipping behind by eating, and gives me concrete evidence of the productivity and healthy habits that i m encouraging by recovering. i don t track anything food related in my app because that is a little too familiar, but the motions of routinely clicking on a little icon and seeing my week in numbers ex: this week i read 4 days, took meds twice daily for 7 days finally made that you re forgetting something voice go away. i think some people might be critical of this because it can sound like i m trading one obsession for another, but tracking medication has very different outcomes than tracking calories imo. have other people have gotten over calorie apps using similar methods? if not, what worked for you?

how to deal with extreme hunger in residential?. i m going to residential today and i just realized something. i am not going to be able to just eat when i m hungry, but at the set meal and snack times. which is going to be impossible, because i m currently eating getting hungry every 3 minutes to an hour. and i have to eat at least 4,5 calories to be satiated and be able to fall asleep. my meal plan is around 3, calories. if i undereat just a little, i get migraines, extreme nausea, feel very weak, and cannot fall asleep stay asleep. i m definitely going to talk to my treatment team about this, but logically, i cannot be asking for food every hour since ill be in group, and they obviously cannot afford to feed only me a huge amount of food every day. im scared ill be restricting in residential and my extreme hunger will get worse be prolonged.

vent post. i ve been living with this shit for almost half my life now and every year it just entrances me further. every period of self recovery is more disordered than the last and i m starting to think i never really recovered. i binged myself up to a healthy weight but started restricting the second the extreme hunger went away back in 2 2 , that s the most stable i ve been. i was able to maintain with some slower weight loss back when i had a job that warranted the energy but i d still be fasting and restricting at work. i m a fucking junkie for this shit. i was at a decent place recently too until my girlfriend and i took molly and she called me out for being anorexic during the trip. it feels like so much of my identity is that of a sick person that i ll let people down if i make any steps towards recovery. it doesn t help that i ve abused my body so much that i don t even have extreme hunger anymore. my bodies just given in. i was gonna try and at least gain to a less severely underweight bmi but two days into that and i had already completely relapsed. i m literally disgusted by how thin my face is and how gaunt and masculine my body looks at this weight but i can t bring myself to eat the admittedly massive amount that i d need to gain with my tdee. i m starting to think the dissociative state i ve been in for the past three years is just the result of my being underweight. like if my body can barely keep fat around my ear canal i can t imagine what years of this is doing to my brain. i ll look at pictures of myself when i was weight restored and it just disgusts me how far i let myself go. i don t want to play this game anymore, i m an adult and i can t miss out on more of my life. but i d be lying if i said the simplicity of life with an ed is a high nothing can compare to. my brains fried rn so i apologize if none of this makes sense i just needed to get this off my chest. i m going to a therapist in the next few days and maybe i can get some actual treatment for my ed, at least maybe some relapse prevention guidance for the next time i claw my way out of this mess. i m gonna go body a few shots of vodka and a dab or two so with a nauseous stomach and shaky hands i wish y all a good night

how often do you finish a jar of spread??. just thought i'd make a post about this as it's something i never would have dreamed about when deep into my disorder i go through a big 45 g jar of nutella 2x a week and a 1kg tub of peanut butter every 2 weeks. i also finish a bottle of oil every 2 weeks ed me would never omg and i finish 2 things of butter not light reduced fat bullshit, proper buttery goodness every week as well what are some things past you would have never dreamed of doing that you eat a lot of now? this post is inspired by my friend from ip who was recently telling me her recovery win which is finishing a loaf of bread by herself every week when she used to be obsessed with keto :

advice on sticking to recovery on vacation. i m going on holiday next week to a different country so the food will all be different although admittedly much tastier than i m used to. also not everyone i m going with knows about my ed so i feel pressure to not show my anxiety around food which of course increases my anxiety around food, and i d be grateful for advice on how to handle this additionally we will be doing some hikes, which is more exercise than i m used to. i m happy about because for one, the scenery will be immense, but also i do need to begin some light cardio again. i ve been trying to avoid exercise as much as possible so far in recovery but i do need to begin some now, i ve become deconditioned and that s causing a problem with a non ed related condition. but i m aware that increasing activity will increase hunger, and in general i m unsure what to expect about beginning exercise again and i d really love to hear people s experiences :

olanzapine. got a prescription from my doc for olanzapine which is an anti psychotic, just wondering if anyone has tried it before for anorexia? i m meant to take in 3 times a day before my main meals to calm me down but i looked up the side effects and it s kinda freaking me out

mirtazapine remeron overeating support. anyone take it? i am fully recovered and taking it but not sure if it is doing anything, i also want to ask if anyone has reached goal weight and cannot stop eating? what do i do? i fear i'll become obese now........almost like i'm sad i cannot gain more weight.

i actually felt full??. this is really random but i was eating breakfast this morning and still felt hungry after i finished my bowl of oatmeal. i immediately starting freaking out because i was convinced i was going to like binge on the entire kitchen or something, especially because i ve sort of been starting to slip back into restricting lately. but i kind of got a hold of myself and got more food, and then i actually felt full in the middle of eating it and just stopped???? idk i was just so surprised?? yet also soooo happy like it actually worked i actually calmly ate food and felt full and then stopped and now i m not uncomfortably full or super hungry, i m just like satisfied and ready to do something without thinking about food i never thought i would ever be someone who could do that

moment of clarity. why tf have i been trying to talk myself into doing more steps and my 2hr hiit session in an uncooled home in the middle of one of the worst heatwaves in the uk? maybe i'm not good at having an ed b c i'm gonna go sit my bloated ass on the sofa for the rest of the day.

boba and health?. hey all i just wanted to ask you all a question because a lot of healthcare providers are way too invested in weight as a marker of health, and i ve had a lot of wonderful feedback from this subreddit basically, i recovered about a year and a half ago by going all in. eventually my weight settled, my hunger cues settled, etc, everything s great recovery wise. im 19 years old, would consider myself fully recovered w no risk of relapse just a couple things: first of all, i rarely exercise anymore and i want to start for mental health reasons but i don t enjoy anything except team sports. i m worried abt my heart health bc i m deeply unfit, but i m scared going to the gym running will trigger bad memories second of all, i drink boba every single day now it s summer and i am genuinely a little concerned for my health and wondering whether i should stop reduce it. i don t like to restrict anything but i remember watching a video by a guy who drank boba every day for a month and it rlly messed with his health. i ve def been drinking for longer than a month is it a good idea to reduce my boba intake? it s great for me bc it gets me full when nothing else sounds good shout out heatwave but i genuinely worry abt my health heart health, things like diabetes etc . i wanna live a long time. most of the anti boba advice i find online is about empty calories which i don t care about

skin in recovery. tw; skin issues in recovery, self esteem issues my skin used to be so clear but ever since starting recovery it s absolutely horrible, i have cystic acne and closed comedones all over my chin, neck, chest, back, and other places i ve never had it before. i feel awful about it all, my self esteem is nonexistent, and i don t know how to make it better :

a poem something i wrote for when it feels pointless :. sometimes, you feel invincible. you feel so capable, so hopeful. but it doesn t always feel that way sometimes it feels extremely unbearable and intangible the thought of getting better. the thought of facing and experiencing all the fears and building myself up. it s not always glamorous and that s okay. but the times you feel happy when you eat a blueberry muffin and forget your allergic to blueberries and just laugh it off when it feels free free to make dumb mistakes and to laugh at yourself and welcome yourself, not in a belittling but in a very accepting manner. when there s excitement again and you feel so full of love and warmth that you wanna give so genuinely when you can accept that not everyone is always around, with empathy for yourself and for others when you re more grounded and present this is worth facing the fears you are worth it all wholeheartedly worth it

consistent high bp in recovery?. i m not sure if this a cause for concern or normal but my blood pressure has been consistently a little high every time i ve gone to the doctors in recovery. before that it was always normal though it would rise up periodically when i would be weight lifting regularly. now even without lifting, it s high. i don t have any other noticeable symptoms that come with hypertension so i try not to be worried but the every appointment bit is scary.

do dieticians help for ed recovery?. i ve been doing well in recovery but i still have slight anxiety over food and things of that nature. do dieticians actually help in recovery or am i wasting my time money?

had a nice weekend. enjoyed my weekend eating without restriction some of the things i had this weekend were: pizza, tacos, burrito bowl, chips, mcdonald s smoothie and sundae and cocktails feels good and feels like to truly be present and not thinking about food or exercise. haven t felt this way in so long. like i was bowling with my partner and i could truly enjoy it. same with when i went shopping with my mom.

cannot stop once i start to eat. i found my myself delaying eating my first meal of the day from regular morning hours to noon and now to after 3pm because i can t stop eating once i start it s not physical hunger it never is. i doubt i m capable of having them anymore. it s just mental hunger that keeps telling me to eat and eat till i force myself to go to bed before 9 pm. magically tho i ve never felt any physical discomfort from eating non stop for hours. i mean yes my stomach would stick out a lot but i ve never been physically uncomfortable. guess i must be a truly bottomless pit.

never lost the lose weight mentality. tw: bodyhate and kind of fatphobia hello, i am 15 and grew up quite chubby, because of this i've always had the mentality of "i need to lose weight i'm eating too much i need to eat healthier" and then i lost it and gained it back with recovery and now i'm here. i've always had the "i need to lose it" or "i need to gain it" and now that i don't really have extreme hunger just mental hunger you can check my last post for that i feel lost? i've had these thoughts for so long that whenever i think about nothing i think about my ed it's exhausting and i just honestly want my head to be empty again, i feel like i overthink everything constantly "will this make me fat if i eat it" "nobody eats x meals so you're going to be fat" etc etc i just don't know what to do i thought it would get easier but it didn't

i just realized how much of an addiction this is for me. i ve been in recovery for close to sixth months now and have made good progress. i have been able to stop weighing myself and have been able to start eating more than i ever thought i could manage. i actually was able to stop thinking about my weight and calories for a while but the other day i went to target and walked by a weight scale and i suddenly wanted to buy it and weigh myself out of curiosity and i ve just been spiraling down into a relapse ever since i saw it. i just realized how much of an addiction this is for me because even after so much time, it was so easy for me to fall back into it and let it consume me again. i was doing so well and going so strong and it just took one accidental opportunity for it to all fall apart. i fucking hate this.

im sad about recovering sometimes. i ve been sad a lot, as i have revisited a lot of feeling with the day hospital im enrolled in. i have gained weight, and everyones telling me i look more full of life but i still hate myself. i miss how i used to look. i wish i could be healthy snd still be that small. i feel so much hate towards myself and it s hard.

advice for hair loss from anorexia and in recovery with extreme hunger?. hi all, so i just started a formal recovery from anorexia nervosa. one day i got home from exercise and a 2x2 inch square of hair had exited my scalp and i can t lie, it was at that moment that i grabbed the biggest bowl of reese s puff cereal with an enriched protein shake as the milk and like 6 protein bars and just went to town because i d had enough. i need my hair. so of course after a massive energy restriction, limitation of most food groups, and over exercise my body is really not having it and i am experiencing extreme hunger over the last month and doing my best to honor it it s really all carb, sweet, and fat cravings . the gain of mass on my body is really, really upsetting but i want to undo all the trauma i ve done to my body and be free more than anything. however, my hair keeps falling out. like a lot. my already weak ponytail is now looking more like the tip of a tapered paint brush for thin line work art. it s bad. my question is why is my hair still falling out so much? could honoring extreme hunger be a shock to my body that is making it worse? is this normal in recovery? will it stop soon? it s been over a month into physical recovery. honestly, i had mentally compensated with over exercise to feel better about honoring extreme hunger so perhaps that may have something to do with it from the stress of that? but i just herniated both my calfs so i can t even walk now so exercise, movement, and sport are off the table for a long time anyways. : maybe good tho for my hair.. : does anyone have any advice to keep my remaining hairs in my head? and to stop it from thinning and receding so much? or any key items or products to consume or use to get my hair healthier. shampoos, topicals, etc. my previously long, thick hair is a key part of what makes me feel beautiful and kept together and i don t know how to cope with the damage i ve done. edit: it also breaks off like nobody s business. i imagine from restriction that my existing hair will be weak especially at the top from malnourishment but dear god i just want it to at least stop falling out in clumps and thinning everywhere. fuck eating disorders lol.

my experience with fatphobia as a previously straight sized woman . talk of numbers tw ok so this might be a bit of a rant but i think it's really important to talk about how societal fatphobia impacts ed recovery and how it can hinder true freedom from our disorders in the worst ways. this is my experience but please share your own below it's important to realise we aren't alone in our struggles so basically i had an active ed with no remission for 5 years between the ages of 19 24. it was basically ednos, but i started in a midsized body and at the turning point when i decided to recover, i was a few pounds underweight but very very physically unwell from lax abuse, overexercising and years of binge restrict cycles. my body was suffering but all i got at the time was praise for how beautiful and model like i look... i was fainting, my bloodwork was terrible and i shat myself a few times tmi but all society cared about is that my mildly uw body fit beauty standards. and i was asked what my secret was and how i did it multiple separate times i began recovery, all in approach, and experienced extremely extreme hunger. i'm over a year in now and still experiencing extreme hunger, and in that time i've ""overshot"" and ended up in an """obese bmi""" body. my bmi is now 32 and there is no sign of my extreme hunger stopping anytime soon... every day, i am still eating between 5 8 kcal in the first 6 months it was a lot more and i am genuinely ravenous for this amount honouring my hunger and accepting my body has been so freeing. i don't love my body now, but i don't hate it either. i think of it neutrally, and i'm grateful every day that i no longer pass out or feel weak and my bloodwork is perfect. i'm happy to gain even more if my body feels it is necessary the issue has been... society. my weight gain has been treated like it makes me a failure. when i've been open about my past ed, i've gotten comments about how i've "swung the other way" and how "being overweight is unhealthy too, you know." i've even had people say to me, the nerve, that i looked better before and what happened? in the first 6 months of recovery i had both friends and strangers ask me if i was pregnant me healing my relationship with my body has been seen in a very negative light, because i was society's ideal and decided that the pain it put my body through wasn't worth it. as someone who was previously straight sized, i realise how many issues plus sized women face in today's society... strangers will comment on what and how much i eat, i catch thinner women staring at my stomach and then glancing away, embarrassed, when i catch them doing it. me wearing a bikini is now "brave" when before it was not worth mentioning. all of these new findings have made me realise how fatphobic society is and how so many people would honour their hunger more if they weren't afraid of this reaction what are your experiences? thoughts and feelings? : gt;

denying your body genetics. studying something related to science has made me reflect on my genetics. i am at a point of recovery where i realize that by wanting to get a slim body, i was denying my roots. i come from a family that has lived all its life in a very cold climate, and by genetics, we tend to have more body fat, have thicker skin, etc. how the hell did i want to look like a model who lives in hawaii? i never reached extreme low bmi, and my body already felt terrible. i hope this helps someone, especially my people who live on different continents

how to cope with hunger cues?. i have almost no hunger cues. besides the growling stomach but even it doesn't enough to make understand that i need to eat. like it's a creepy feeling but my mind doesn't corelate with hunger. so i eat mechanically. however, today i felt it for i think the second or third time in my recovery journey and i just don't know how to cope with. it's so strange. i have ocd which impacts on the quantity of meals i eat per day. all my meals are choose before hand. but today i know what i had wasn't enough at morning, usually i make it through other meals, but today i just ate a unplanned small piece of cake bc i felt like i needed to eat. it was awful but i tried to don't think too much about it. then, it happened again. one hour after lunch i felt "hungry". i know it was a common hunger bc i wasn't craving for something specific, i just wanted to eat something. i ate bc i have a giant fear of overeating. so i though it was enough, the hunger was over. but i was wrong, a couple of hours after i was hungry again. the break of my meal plan plus the sudden increase of my intake. i'm feeling like a shit now i think it has more to do with my ocd and how my hunger messed my meal plan than the ed itself. everyone says how hunger cues are a blessing but i'm hating so much it. maybe because i still undereating that i felt those feeling for having more snacks. i just want my life back. my patterns, i need them. i know i should start eating more so i'd not need to have those extra snacks but i physically and mentally can't. i don't know how to cope. i'm feeling like a failure in both ocd and ed recovery.

why am i still craving and hungry. i ve been recovering fully from an for half a year. i went through my ed for two years, and quasi recovery then relapsed previously. i m no longer underweight and healthy. i m an active person competitive dancer, acting, modeling, and roller skater i don t juggle all those things at once and i have a good amount of down time, so i work out 2 3 times a week. i still get my cycle 19, f recently i ve been having extreme hunger, specifically craving sweets carbs fats, especially at night. however i don t restrict and i get enough of each food group and allow sweets during the day. i m not sure and kind of scared as why i get the urge to eat so much. it feels like a binge but whenever i would binge i would eat in private and fast. now i eat all the food in the evening without shame around family and slowly, but it s still kind of scary. any advice?

inpatient. entering inpatient soon, not by choice but after assessment from the program i m in. does anyone have experience with this? any advice to share? i m really nervous that they won t let me move my body i usually walk an hour a day for the endorphins, it helps with my emotions a lot. i am also very afraid of the cal minimums very high because my body bloats to high heaven after even one bite these days. just looking for any thoughts from someone who may have done this journey too.

feeling shitty for not exercising as much. i ve ran 1 miles a day for 7 years but with residency now i can t keep up with it. i need to eat to keep my brain going but wow do i feel bad about it. the scale said i hadn t gained weight when i checked a few days ago but fuck, i can feel my fucking body softening and gaining. why is this still so hard?

birthday feels undeserved. it s my birthday today, but i don t deserve any celebration. i m 22, straight white male with anorexia. i ve had to forego my senior season of college soccer this upcoming year, transfer schools and live at home. at my lowest weight by 12lbs. so close to going all in but for some reason just can t, so so close idk wtf is wrong with me. i m 22, my life is nothing and boring, watching it fade away. my mom doesn t even know my true weight she thinks i m more than i am. i feel i don t deserve any bday cards, celebrations or anything; i m just failing. i want this to end, to be able to just eat. i m so broken

mothers so happy to break the cycle . i am sure i am not the only one with a mother who contributed to my eating problems. my mother has an ed although she would of course never admit that because you can only have an ed if you are underweight in her mind . i grew up with her not eating lunch with the family still doesn t , only eating veggies for months though it was just a diet in that point in life , witnessed her having breakdowns over eating an apple, the weight yo yoing constantly, her low self esteem, irritability because of not eating, comments on how other people eat and looks, avoiding pictures and more things that don t come to my mind now. no wonder i developed issues myself, it s what i grew up with. and i am pretty sure her own mother was the same. but thank god i am 26 and breaking the cycle now anyone had a similar upbringing?

why do i get inflamed and swollen when i restrict . has anyone else noticed this when they eat too little or over exercise. it s like my body is super sensitive to eating disorder behaviors. i can feel everything shift when i eat more and i seriously look better

honoring extreme hunger and going all in. in recovery for anorexia. i ve gained a little weight and am close to healthy weight. i hate it. my fear of weight gain is still very present and i want to lose weight. i would totally relapse if i could, tbh. but extreme hunger has kicked in full force, i m unable to restrict and eat above maintenance every day. since i can t seem to stop eating i think i should just go all in and get it over with, eat until my extreme hunger settles and i can eat like a normal person and maybe then i can lose some of the weight i ll gain from going all in. the thing holding me back is the fact that if i do that go all in and let go of all restricting and keep eating and gaining, i will want to isolate throughout the entire process. everything in my life will have to be put on hold from the second i decide to honor my hunger, i will not step foot outside the house unless it s for grocery shopping or going to therapy, until i lose some of the weight again after the extreme hunger settles. i will completely isolate. i dont want to do that. i want to be social, i want to date, i want to do all the things a healthy person does. all the things i did when i was skinnier and able to restrict. i honestly just want the extreme hunger to go away. this is dumb, i realize that. it doesn t work that way. but it just sucks. i m barely comfortable letting my parents see me, after the weight i ve already gained. how is this going to go if i gain even more? i will hate myself so much more every time i gain weight i ll want to lose the weight even more. i just can t see that working. is there any way around the extreme hunger? i really just want to live.

when did you stop beign in denial?. like many people with eating disorders i spent many years in denial about my condition. it was really triggering for me to hear people talking about eds and i even convinced myself that what i was doing was perfectly normal. when i relapsed really badly last year i had no choice but to admit it and try to seek treatment

motivational comment from family. i often have my doubts and think that i eat too much, and ed thoughts of restriction always pop up and i "feel" worse than when i was actively restricting. today, however, i noticed i feel happier? i always really look forward to everything i eat now, even if it is chocolate, ice cream, salmon, potato, oatmeal, carrots, bananas, pasta, whatever it is and apparently, despite my ed "feeling" stronger than ever, i noticed i'm more energetic and more "optimistic" despite still obsessing about all things food. admittedly there's the compulsive exercise, but at least now i have more energy and feel less fatigued when exercising. even though my recovery isn't all in, and i honestly fail to meet the minimum guidelines for minnie maud, i still eat a lot. and the one thing that cements my commitment to never going into full restriction again, is that my mom commented that i "look and act happier, less grumpy, and that it's nicer to be around me". how others perceive me, i didn't even think about. i didn't think that my starved self was any less fun to be around, but lo and behold, eating good food makes you a better person to everyone struggling with eds; if you fail to find motivation to recover some days, try to think that other people will probably enjoy your company a lot more if you aren't starved, because you'll most likely be a happier person, regardless of how the ed makes you feel

how to recover alone. hi everyone i decided to recover from ana about 4 months ago i can say i'm weight restored rn but now my thoughts are so strong plus my family don't know bout my ed i mean they do but they don't believe i had ed now i feel i should start restricting and whenever i feel like grabbing a snack my mom is like i'm so proud of u and it's so dismotivating and whenever i feel like ordering takeout my mom is like u can hv that only one day in a week and u hv that used that there is noone to say that i'm proud of u for increasing ur weight and now i'm only 2kgs away from weight i started i don't want my family to bully me that i'm fat now

i ve realised what s stopping my from recovering . just had a huge epiphany and i m looking for some advice. the main thing holding me back is my weigh ins that are mandatory by my care team see them even when not actively in recovery for some reason i want them to see the number get lower and lower, not even for myself? i honestly think i d benefit from going all in on my own, i know no one on here can advise me to do that since there are medical complications like refeeding. if i didn t have to be weighed in 2 days, right now i would be eating a huge fucking sandwich, but my brain is telling me no because i need to lose weight since my last weigh in :

i got my period . as the title states i will keep fuelling my body esp now that it's happening, and bc i know you need three consecutive proper cycles to be fully recovered from ha. please don't compare your journey to mine if you're also on the journey to getting your period back as i still had mine when i was not at a healthy weight, it just took very drastic and terrible extremes for this to happen. i wanna thank all of you who have been helping me for the past month or more bc you guys have absolutely saved me from more bullshit. i'm just so happy i haven't caused irreversible damage to myself and continuing to fight my inner thoughts to restrict. just abt a month ago i was crying bc i was trying to hit my minimums and i felt like it was no progress, and i relapsed for a while but now i know if i keep going i will get my life back.

struggling with recovery. so recently i decided to do an all in recovery from my ed. i've gain a bit of weight and i actually don't feel like crap 24 7. the weight gain and extreme hunger isn't the problem, it's my friend and my mum. since my mum found out about my ed, she's been taking me to the doctors and therapist she wants me to get better . but recently she's been counting calories and trying to lose weight, and every time she doesn't know the calories in something she'll ask me. i've told her that counting calories can become disordered and unhealthy. one of my friends is also doing the same too they also have a disordered relationship with food . this has happened after everything about my ed came out and it's making me not wanting to recover. i don't know what to do, i'm feel like my ed has cause this for both of them. i'm scared that my mum who already has an unhealthy relationship with her body and food will develop an ed from this, and i know at her age eds are deadly. i'm conflicted in my own recent decision to recover and this is making it worse.

extremely rapid weight gain in early recovery, no idea what to do. not edema. tw: cal and weight numbers . i'm in what i guess you'd consider the very early part of recovery from years of restriction. for the first time ever, i have actually managed to increase my intake for more than a day at a time. that was all well and good and happy, but literally after less than 2 full weeks, my weight has skyrocketed insanely. and before you ask: no, it is not edema. i had major issues with edema due to an unrelated medical disorder that literally landed me in the hospital, and i am on nuclear grade prescription diuretics and have been for years. i am very, very familiar with all the permutations and symptoms of edema. i do not have it now. also tmi but i know many people have constipation in recovery, i am having the opposite. also, i am 4 and have an autoimmune disorder and really 1 do not need to be eating 3, cal. in less than 2 weeks of eating incredibly hard as it is for me to admit this number that feels crazy to me around 17 19 cal a day, my weight has gone up 7 lb. my bmi is in the 13 range so that is a huge, huge percentage. so i literally don't know what to do. the dietician i saw a few times said i should be eating 14 a day during recovery, but embarrassing as this is, i just couldn't stick to that...it was either all out restricting or the amount i'm eating now, which clearly isn't correct. any advice other than "nah bro just eat 1 , calories anyway " or thoughts from anyone else who's been in this boat would be unbelievably appreciated.

acupuncture for ed. hello friends my mum wants me to try acupuncture for my ed because she said it helped her with her burn out years ago. i am hesitant because 1 needles and 2 it s quite expensive and i m not totally against alternative medicine but also not super convinced. has anyone here had any experiences with this? thanks in advance

another dumbass post about clothes. i haven t bought clothes since month two in recovery except for these jeans that i had to buy as a part of my work uniform less than a month ago. they re already tighter than usual and i m also growing out of the largest shorts i had before that never fit me even pre ed. i m gonna fucking scream. and i saw a tiktok about how going cold turkey on exercise made someone lose weight and ??? idk why that made me mad since the entire point of recovery and going cold turkey was to gain weight. but now i m crying not bc i m fat i literally do not care about that bs but bc idk how to dress for my body anymore. i hate my boobs and i miss being flat chested and fitting into all the clothes my boobs never let me. i want to cut them off, it was literally the only good thing my ed gave me. all i wear is oversized t shirts that went down to my butt before but are way higher now and i see all these girls everywhere wear cute shit and i can t do that because i grow out of everything in less than a fucking month. and i can t afford shit. and i feel like i m blowing up like a balloon why don t clothes that fit me 2 3 weeks ago fit anymore??

please help me how do i give myself extreme hunger??. i'm really really struggling so any advice would be really appreciated i've been in recovery for the last 2 years. at beginning of my recovery, i was given a week left to live and was at the lowest point in my life. after months of ip, i was discharged at a still uw bmi but not severely so and given therapy to gain the rest in op. my therapist gave me a minimum meal plan for weight gain but also said to "follow your extreme hunger" and eat anything else i want on top of it. the minimum meal plan was 35 kcal. the thing is, i felt absolutely stuffed on the minimum meal plan and i had to force myself to eat it all. i think being in the state i was fucked up my hunger cues because i don't seem to have the capacity to feel hunger anymore... i'm not bragging, this makes me feel deeply sad because i just want to be normal and leave this ed behind. but i had to set alarms to remind myself to eat my planned snack or meal because i didn't think about food at all or feel hungry. i started doing this when a few days in a row i realised it was 6pm and i hadn't eaten anything yet and then had to eat all the calories in a very short period of time, which made me feel so so ill. idk if this is related but i have autism, and will get very fixated on my hobbies and only think about those for hours. even at my worst ed wise i rarely thought about food, i just wouldn't eat because my ed was about unaliving myself due to my c ptsd, it wasn't about being a certain weight. now that i've dealt with how to manage my trauma better i want to live a full life but despite a year and a half of therapy and op i am struggling to maintain a minimally healthy weight due to lacking hunger cues. i feel like i constantly have to micromanage myself to make sure i'm not accidentally undereating and it's exhausting. how do i give myself extreme hunger? i'd love to just gain until i'm solidly in the mid or upper healthy bmi or higher than that here are things i've already tried: having my really wonderful girlfriend help prep me 1 k calories worth of food snacks every day for 2 weeks and forcing myself to finish as much as physically possible in an attempt to reawaken my hunger cues the theory was i simply wasn't eating enough to be hungry but at no point during this experiment did i feel hungry for any of the food or even look forward to it... i just felt ambivalent switching antidepressants to one's which are linked with increased appetite

14 months of extreme hunger... when will it end?. tw calorie amounts so i had an for 4 years and 14 months ago i decided to do all in recovery. i wasn't very underweight when i started, only by a few pounds, however i was very ill and my bloods were funky, i couldn't concentrate on my school work and i would pass out a few times a week. i was also cold all the time and had extreme insomnia. all of these things made me decide to pursue recovery and the all in approach seemed like the healthiest way. anyway, once i started eating enough... surprise surprise i was ravenous and all my hunger cues came back. at first i was ecstatic. it felt so freeing to be able to eat whenever i thought about food and know it was going towards healing my body, i didn't even care about thr weight gain because looking back at my pre ed body with a non ed mindset i actually looked great and healthy. the sort of body that doesn't pass out and can carry heavy stuff ya know anyway for the first 3 months i ate over 1 k calories a day, every day. after that, i eat 5 8 , some days 1 k still like maybe once a week. and now 1 months on i'm still ravenous... all my physical side effects which i had due to my ed have gone away thank god but my hunger still hasn't stabilised. i've overshot my pre ed weight by 5 lbs and now i'm "obese." i don't care about bmi but it's getting really expensive to afford all this food, especially with recent price hikes, and i can't afford to keep getting a whole new wardrobe every few months but i don't want to squeeze myself into uncomfortable clothes either because i need to accept this is the weight my body will be at. my hunger shows no sign of stopping. does anyone have an idea of when it will start subsiding? tysm in advance

wanting to eat past fullness. hey i m currently in recovery and something that s been bugging me is that i keep thinking about food. it usually happens at night after my dinner. i just keep thinking about food and want to eat even past fullness. and when i don t eat i just look at recipes on pinterest and other stuff food related. my ed is telling me that i m binging. is this normal ?

feel like saying fuck my ed today. hope i can do it for more days. ate a couple snacky fear foods i'd been avoiding for a while, to the joy of my boyfriend, and i'm not beating myself up over them. i kinda wish i could totally let go of my ed and go back to my normal eating habits and just enjoy my life. like, i'm healthy. i'm okay. i love my nutritious foods and i love my junky ones. i can have either or both if i want to. i can self regulate. it would be so possible for me to turn this ship around, if i wanted to. i'm really fortunate to more or less have a basis of good eating habits to return to thanks mom . i'm not in too deep. i could get worse or better. though when i turn around to try and treat myself kinder, i feel ashamed that i didn't 'get bad'. not bad enough, visibly. i've never gotten bad enough. i admit get scared. scared to eat again. i could try to get better again. i really want to. for now, i had a packet of crisps, 3 biscuits and a mug of tea with milk. and they were very nice. it's a start.
fun times. just broke up with my boyfriend and i have an eating disorder lol fun. out of curiosity, how supportive considerate was your bf? and how did he show it?
ed recovery sucks so bad especially at work.... the stomach aches and bloating oh my god, i hate working on my feet all day

mental hunger. one of my recovery goals was to not have my life revolve around food, yet the exact opposite happened. i think of food all of the time. i dream of food. all my thoughts are about food. what i m going to eat, when i m going to eat, what i m gonna eat for dessert, my next meal or snack, etc. it s annoying bc i became more food obsessed than ever. aside from eating, how do i make it stop? : i can t just eat all the time.

does anyone else have the "urge" to eat a lot?. because i kind of do. i plan out what i eat usually, and for some reason i plan for large quantities despite obviously not necessarily being physically hungry. i understand this is probably a mixture between mental hunger and extreme hunger, but it is still weird to me. one thing is being hungry and wanting more food, but i feel like it's different to "pre plan" to eat a lot of food, if that makes sense? is this a normal thing? edit: i also just want to eat a lot of food, just large quantities. it's so weird to simply want "as much as possible", instead of just a sufficient amount.

seeking reassurance advice for all in.. so i ve been all in for two months and i ve been eating so much in this time period, that i m now over my pre ed highest weight however my extreme mental hunger is still very prevalent. usually i m a very logical person even when it comes to my ed, and i ve always believed that all in is the best way for me to truly recover after being in quasi for 2 years. but now i m having doubts, due to my eating habits. i m worried that it s turning into binge eating rather than just honoring extreme hunger. here are a few of the reasons why i think it may not be extreme hunger anymore: 1. i almost always eat more in private, after having eaten a already large meal with my family. for example, i ll eat dinner with my family and eat till satiety, but as soon as i m in my room i ll start eating the snacks i have in my room. 2. i find it very hard to enjoy food atm and even when i m listening to my mental hunger, it s as if i m not enjoying the foods i m eating and i get no real satisfaction from eating the things i crave . 3. every evening i have what i until recently called eating feasts , but i now think that they may be binges. i m not restricting during the day and after dinner i ve already eaten thousands of calories, so there is no reason for my body to crave almost sometimes more than a full days worth of food. like i mentioned i m usually a very logical person, and i acknowledge that i sometimes have a tendency to mentally restrict compulsive and uncontrollable calorie counting, fearing high fat foods, all or nothing mindset etc. , but i m just finding it so hard to trust the process right now. i know i ve only been all in for 2 months, but it just feels so wrong at the moment and i can t seem to convince myself that i should keep going. i know this is a bit of a brain dump and may not make sense, but i would just really like to hear others experiences with this or get any advice on how to navigate these emotions. i hope this makes sense, and i apologize if this isn t fitting appropriate in this subreddit.

ed mentality is so insane. i literally got hit by a car today, like i actually not joking was hit by a car and went to the er, and my disorder is still making me feel bad about not getting enough steps in. like in what world would that ever be what my im mind should prioritize in this situation.

why can t i just do it . i turn 22 tmro. i m so sick of letting this ed control my life. when i say i am so close to just going all in and saying f this ed it s like i m on a diving board and i m hanging onto the edge of it with 3 fingers i don t know why i can t just let go

sick of volume. but i'm allergic to a bunch of food sources that would make upping my calories w lower volume easier more fun probably avocado, nuts, coconut . i wish lembas https: lotr.fandom.com wiki lembas was real. i wish someone would invent a go gurt with gt; 1 lt; calories in it

how much should i be eating in recovery? tw: numbers. for context i went inpatient for 6 months and got out about 5 months ago. when i got out i relapsed straight away and was eating about 8 calories a day for around a month. since then i have been maintaining around a bmi of 16.5, sometimes eating 2 calories where my weight went up a bit and sometimes around 1,2 and my weight going down a bit. now i want to recover but i m not sure if 25 calories is too much for me. i m 5 foot and don t think i m really that malnourished as i was a healthy weight and had my period less than 6 months ago. i m scared as it feels like so much and i m eating more than everyone in my house. i m not sure if i should just eat 2 as i would still gain weight on that.

another mental hunger post. i've been trying to recovery, properly and most mentally recently i weight restored a long time ago but never really mentally healed but i've been having insane mental hunger it's so annoying every single second there is empty space in my thoughts it gets filled with negative self talk or wanting to eat so much so that i can tell when i'm goin to wake up at night to eat my mental hunger is so strong that i can tell when i'm going to wake up in the middle of the night to eat not to long ago i had calmer mental hunger days and it was so mentally clearing i had no thoughts still woke up at night but only for a tiny snack as opposed to a whole meal it was so nice any help is appreciated

i have been slaying the game recently. just two months ago i sat in front of my therapist and told her with a straight face that anorexia makes me happier and i had no interest in recovering. cut to now, i had a delicious chipotle quesadilla and waffles for breakfast and pasta for dinner and snacks in between and i am so much happier than i was for like all of last year when my days were consumed by calorie counting and self checking etc etc. my eating disorder can go die on a hill. anyways, just wanted to share. even if it feels like your ed is insurmountable right now, you will have days where you are ok :

how do you stop the addiction of bingeing?. tw: mention of calorie counts, purging and weight so some background info im 15 will turn 16 in like 6 days lol and had have a diagnosed eating disorder. it had started last year with me trying to be healthy and lose weight, but of course i ended up with an ed. and so ive been in recovery for like 2 3 ? months. now the real problem is that im not actually recovering. im trading one ed for another. i went from being scared to eat one fucking biscuit to eat 2 packets at once and god its frustrating. i didnt gain weight earlier but now that ive started gaining its getting scary. i did have quite a good few weeks tho where i ate normally, but now theyre like.... gone. i am eating everything around me. and the weird thing? i still fucking feel hungry for the next meal. its like 2:5 pm rn and ive eaten approx 2,5 calories already and i feel like a fucking failure. i only have three choices in my mind rn, to go into the bathroom and throw up which im admittedly crap at, or take a little bit of laxative or to just lay here and keep thinking about how i should just die. i just dont get it, i didnt even get that sick. 17 cals sounds pretty good but i really dont understand why i lost so much weight with it. and i ate 12 cals or less for like a month or two which really isnt that bad. and i didnt even get underweight??? my lowest bmi was a 19 which makes me feel like im just making all this up. ive tried really hard to stop bodychecking or to stop counting but i suspect theyre what triggers this. i also always try to "eat perfect" basically 3 exact meals, two exact snacks and one small dessert . if i dont do this i feel very out of control just like now. i feel fully lost ugh i really don't know what to do. i feel disgusting everyday whenever i eat something extra and then lose all control and feel even more pathetic. also about extreme hunger, im pretty sure it should have gone considering my ed was barely even there? so idk what im supposed to do. please somebody help me. i dont wanna be like this forever. i wanna enjoy my life. i have so much left to do and i don't wanna to lose it over this. im tired and i cant do this anymore....

not scared of gaining weight. i think this is my huge progress in my recovery. my teacher asked me if i gained weight. she saw me once at the worst of my ed. and she hasn't seen me since then, and asked if i gained weight. normally, i would've just hesitant and beaten myself over and over for gaining weight. but now, i said yes to her, i told her that i put on some weight in holidays. she just shifted the topic to how i was studying now. normally i would've thought that she was intentionally being malicious or mocking me for gaining weight. but now, i have no worry about other people think of me. yes i've gained weight. that's it. and i'm going to accept it and embrace it, cause i'm healthy now.

stopped myself from downloading a calorie counting app . i am having a bad mental health week and this evening fell down a bit of a rabbit hole i m still feeling a little iffy but i did manage to stop myself from downloading a dieting app very happy with myself right now a small, but big feeling success

coping with weight gain. how do you cope with gaining more than you anticipated? how do you continue to cope knowing you could gain even more? i feel so unattractive. i feel like everyone else s body looks normal except mine.

i feel alone and ironically so small. half of me wants nothing more than to not care what other people think. i understand that people on the street don't actually care and aren't judging me and that i genuinely shouldn't care about the ones who do because if they're judging someone else in the fifteen seconds they see them than their opinion doesn't really matter. i know logically that although i am certainly overweight, i'm not obese nor am i a danger to myself. in fact, my self perception of myself is probably exaggerated. i have a multitude of external factors that feed into my comfort eating. my therapist supports me, doesn't believe i'm endangering myself, and in fact wants me to understand that my worries are groundless. the other half of me tells me that actually, logically, i am fat and lazy and all my reasoning is me making excuses for myself. it wants me to go to horrible forums and pro ana twitter or tumblr accounts to show me that i'm stupid and wrong and that i'm not even good enough to have the 'good' eating disorder. and then the first half says i'm being cruel to sufferers and survivors of restrictive eating disorders and that actually i do have a restrictive eating disorder as well even if i don't look it. and then the other half says i'm being narcissistic and fat and lazy. i wish society had more leniency towards people with eating disorders who look like me, but then my wonderful brain has to bash me over the head and tell me i'm making excuses for myself. i'm just exhausted.

little daily reminders. i came up with a list of daily reminders to keep me going and i thought i'd shared them in case they can inspire someone else out there. i'm doing this because i would have thrown my life away if i hadn't decided to get better. i'm doing this because i'm investing in my future and doing what's best for me. i'm doing this because a free and energetic life is worth living. i'm doing this because it's the right thing. i'm doing this because not making an effort every day will only set me back and send me back to that terrible mental space. i'm doing this because the right time is now. i'm doing this because for every day that i'm strong and fight back, the disordered voice gets weaker and further away. i'm doing this because i deserve better. and i'm doing this because i don't want to have to go through this twice.

grazing but too scared to sit down for meals. to start, im actively trying to pull myself out of a relapse, and its actually going okay so that's pretty good i guess haha. however, ive noticed over the past few months that its really hard for me to make an actual meal and sit down and eat it. like, i'll go into my kitchen grab a handful of pretzels or other stuff here and there, and im fine with that. but the second i go to make dinner or something, i just kind of freak out? this has been a slight issue since i know by just kind of snacking im not getting nearly enough food in. ive tried the concept of making a charcuterie board or something but having everything in front of me all at once is what scares me i think. has anyone else experience something similar or have tips to get past it or just get enough in with it?

step parent with previous ed is really triggering. not sure how to deal with the relationship we have ?. i m so done, had a 3 week family vacation, parents put me in so many bad situations. started off enjoying the food this holiday, now i m crying after every meal. i know in 4 days time when im home it s all gonna start again. i just don t want to be at another restaurant. i don t want to be with my new pushy family members that love food. eat this try this eat more, don t you like my food guilt tripping me constantly, my parents do it to. they will ask me over and over and over. try this common you will regret it never listen when i say no. i don t want to but they won t stop till i give in. my parents do this constantly. then they say, oh see you did want it making me seem like i wanted it. the guilt i get from this is to much. i ve told them but they don t stop. it makes me feel so bad that im eating a normal amount of food each day let alone being pushed to eat more . i ve done so well i ve done everything right, gained weight eat the right amount of food stop counting calories. not weighing myself. i ve done everything right. just let me be but the constant pressure to eat things that make me uncomfortable is to much. i m breaking, i hate this now im scared of it again now the constant thoughts are here. im back like i never left this place in my head. my step mom has dealed with ed for a long time 1 years ago, she has been recovered for years now but the things she says can be so triggering and upsetting. both my parents know what i ve been dealing with the past two years. my dad actually knows his boundaries and does not trigger me that much. but to have a parent that claims to have battled this for over a decade when she was younger to constantly put me in triggering situations and say triggering things . it s so upsetting. i tell her but she just does not get it. like i ve mentioned it so many times . it just sucks that i think i m gonna relapse , every thing is back in my head again. a stupid part of me wants this just to prove a point. i wanna get very sick worst than last time. just a big fuck your to the world . but it won t solve anything. just so maybe next time they don t force me to eat all there chocolates and cheese .

screeeeew you ed : . so, i live in norway, about a 2 hour drive away from sweden. a family tradition is to take a day trip with my family to sweden to buy cheap food, clothes, electronics and most importantly, candy due to covid and ed i haven't been there for 3 years. i always used to buy 1 kg of assorted candy, and that was always a highlight of my summers. fast forward till today, i went to sweden again with my dad, but also my ed. we did some shopping, and ate a delicious pizza for lunch, and i ate the whole thing. then, i went to the candy store: literally being a kid in the candy shop there are hundreds of different candies, chocolates, caramels, fudge etc. and i went absolutely insane i picked all the candies i wanted literally so much chocolate and fudge , and filled my bag with 2,3kg of candy not only that, i bought 2 large toblerones, 36 g each, so in total over 3kg of candy : so now for the next weeks i'm going to thoroughly enjoy my 3kg of chocolates. and also, dinner today is going to be pizza even though i ate pizza for lunch. screw you ed, i'm the winner now, and i'm still going to eat all my normal meals on top of the candy

buying clothes to gain into. little recovery success i was never the type to buy clothes for my gw to lose weight for back my super disordered days, but i certainly didn t want to buy anything to encourage weight gain. i ll admit that the idea of gaining still makes me antsy but it s an uneasiness i ve made peace with. anyways, with a number of big clothing sales happening right now i ve noticed a shift in my shopping approach. when i try clothing items on, i actively look for things that are on the looser side to allow myself room to grow into them i ve also decided to phrase it as clothes to grow into because that s what the process of weight gain is in recovery: it s growth something positive, to be celebrated the same way you d celebrate a child growing. it feels good to have this change in approach and to actively choose a situation that my ed considers encouragement of the negative.

crazy and specific sugar cravings?. hi y all in an all in recovery rn and i m having these insanely intense and specific cravings of sugar. i m not even talking carbs like bread and desserts, but more like candy chocolate raisins just simply sugar. i m even craving cookie icing has anyone else experienced this kind of specific sugar cravings during recovery? i ate a huge amount of these sugary food and now i m afraid of diabetes and of course rapid weight gain thanks

extreme hunger and letting go of restriction experiences in recovery. hey guys i m in recovery ish from anorexia and it s been a bumpy road so far. i ve kind of been relapsing lately and since trying to recover a lot of conflicting voices are more present now, more than ever. firstly, there s the ana voice telling me to restrict. secondly, there s the recovery voice telling me i deserve food and should eat more despite being terrified of weight gain. third, there s now this feeling of unstoppable desire to eat anything and everything and a lot of it. i ve read about others who ve experienced the same; extreme hunger. i feel like there hasn t been a lot of official research on extreme hunger so i have conflicting thoughts on what the right thing to do is. tabitha farrar wrote a blog post https: tabithafarrar.com 2 17 2 anorexia recovery eating on the topic, encouraging recovering anorexics to let go of all forms of restricting, to let your body have as much food as you want in recovery. she writes about honoring you body and mind when it tells you to eat entire cakes or jars of peanut butter, for as long as your body wants it. she explains that, at least for her, the extreme desire for food settles after a while. i m curious if any of you guys have any experience with this? what i m terrified of, besides weight gain , is it turning into bed or bulimia the latter is kind of the case for me now, after i ve gained some weight in my semi recovery . if you have time, check out the post she wrote i linked it further up and comment your thoughts

is it normal to get extreme hunger 1 year into recovery. i only had a full blown ed for 5 months and quasi for about another 5 and now i have been in full recovery for about 6 7 months and i still get crazy extreme hunger but i am not sure if it s a binge because i used to have binge eating disorder and i am now over weight restored. help
dear body,. i m sorry for destroying you. please. please don t give up. i m not ready to go just yet.
