how long until the fatigue ends?. i ve been in recovery for 6 months and i m exhausted all the time. i posted about this before and i know it ends and that my body s using up a shit ton of energy to repair itself, but i just want hope that it ll end soon.. and by soon i mean in a year at the most. during my ed i had so much energy because i was always running on adrenaline and had terrible anxiety but now all i can do is lay down and work max 3 4 days a week. it s fine for the summer but i also lowkey feel inferior to my friends who are doing shit, since it s the summer between junior and senior year and everyone s doing the most and traveling and all i can do is a lowkey job and very lowkey internship and chill with my dogs. sometimes when i m relaxing i swear i can feel my bones ache, maybe they re remineralizing or something. and i ve also heard that feeling slight zaps in your limbs is a sign of your nervous system repairing itself and i felt that around months 2 3. might be just me imagining shit but it makes me feel better that shit is working. for the past three years i ve had plans to travel the world with all the money i saved up and i m afraid i won t have the energy. will i have more energy by next summer if i keep this up?

despite all the struggles i have a win to share. sometimes i post things here that make it seem like i am close to relapsing lol maybe at those moments i am, but when i come back to my senses i weigh out the pros and cons and ed never wins the pros. of course it is not as easy as just thinking about whether it is good or bad so i spend a lot of time thinking about it, and it is not always pretty. but i am proud to say that i haven't body checked or looked at calorie labels for around a week now the only counting i do is subconscious and i cannot stop that so i try my best to ignore it. today we ordered a chicken wrap with my friends while in university, i had an exam and a long day ahead of me and i knew i needed to eat well. i just said my order and ate it without even second thinking, it was soo delicious and i don't feel an ounce of guilt i'm also really dehydrated lately due to intense heat, so i've been eating lots and lots of watermelon lately without thinking about the calories or sugar. come on, it is watermelon if i cannot enjoy it this summer, what other joy is left? i will try my best to get as good as i can before going to south korea for my studies because i wanna enjoy the food there without feeling like shit, it will be the first time in my life trying authentic korean food. of course it is not my only main motivation for recovery but i sure as hell don't wanna miss that amazing chance

success stories regarding dental work during recovery? need some encouragement.... saw another user in this sub make a post about having to get restorative dentistry done during recovery. i myself am in desperate need of dental work because of my years of bulimia but am terrified of the surgical procedures i will need and the ridicule of showing someone the obvious result of my mental illness. does anyone have a reassuring experience to share? what can be done to make this process less traumatizing amp; scary? i would really love to hear stories where it wasn t as bad as people thought. the thought of embarking on this is terrifying but i know i really need to tackle this before it becomes a more significant problem.

eds an enamel decay. mainly a cautionary tale as i m mostly recovered at this point but i went for the dentist for the first time since recovering and i was told that, essentially, my teeth are so badly damaged from acid reflux and bone decay that i ll probably be looking at dentures by my 3 s. i wish i could do it all over again and never start falling down this rabbit hole of a disease. if you re considering recovery, start now and stop putting it off like i did

sudden loss of appetite. i'm not sure why but recently i just... have lost my appetite. nothing really sounds appetizing, and, in a non disordered way, i just don't want to eat because of it. even if i'm physically hungry, i mentally don't want food because i don't think any of it tastes particularly good. which is kind of a stupid reason, but it's been a barrier for me. i've been trying to keep track of satisfying my physical hunger and such, but it's definitely a bit of a struggle when you've already got issues. it's just honestly so easy to restrict all of a sudden, and paired with my adhd, without the mental hunger, i don't remember to eat much. probably because i'm still used to the feeling of hunger. hell, without mental hunger it's hard to eat enough ... right now i'm in bed and my stomach is growling, i can tell i'm physically hungry, but the thought of eating makes me feel kinda sick like nauseous. depending on what i eat, i feel that way with the smell or looking at it too. and honestly i don't even know if it's really a complete lack of appetite. it could just be that i don't have extreme hunger anymore, and this is the normal level of "desire" for certain food, coupled with general eating disorder struggle that was easier to ignore with extreme hunger and a big appetite.

all in update, menstrual cycles amp; a qn : . hello this coming saturday the 16th , marks 3 weeks since i started all in, not counting, eating as much as i think my body requires even if that means blowing up and shrinking like a balloon everyday, 25 5 55 cals... so far i've has some results such as last week when i had more discharge down there, and now i've gotten to the phase where my boobs are sore i literally haven't had this symptom in almost 3 months when my cycle started fking up so, obviously my period is not here yet. i am eating, and eating, and just hoping for my period to come. my only question is, when does extreme hunger usually taper off and does it depend on how long you restricted? my restriction was 3 months long but i was in the extremes of bmi. is it possible that this could take a year? i've also reduced exercise a lot, letting myself rest. what else do i do? continue with all in til i feel my hunger tapering off?

ed trigger safe work outs. i m worried i m in a sort of pre eating disorder state, i ve been overweight my whole life and i want to work out but so much workout content online triggers my food anxiety and can lead to me obsessing over the scale and hurting myself over using the treadmill. i ve tried to look up inclusive workout regiment s but i end up getting advertised weight loss plans and diet pills that just make me feel worse. i m struggling with finding a way to work out for pleasure and not to appease the cruel voice in my head. does anyone have tips for exercise channels online that don t focus on weight loss but instead focus on prioritizing personal health and enjoyment? i wanna have fun being active again without the fear of slipping i to something harmful.

food guilt. i'm ftm transgender and 16 and have had anorexia for 4 ish years now, this didn't exclude purging via laxatives and self induced vomiting and binging. i've been attempting to recover since my last 2 month long hospital visit where i felt close to death due to what they called "mild" refeeding syndrome, it did not feel mild in any way, my symptoms made me unable to get out of bed for therapeutic activities and needing a nurse with me every time i stood. i had been hospitalized 8 times over the years and this latest was the worst making me want to try my best not to fall back into bad habits after discharge. i will still skip meals sometimes and still feel a lot of guilt around meals and i'm not very sure how to cope with these feelings. i would really like to know how my fellow people in recovery deal with food guilt because everywhere i look tells me to color or meditate :

my reasons to recover bulimia alcohol . to recover 1. teeth 2. friends want me to feel better 3. i want a partner and kids someday 4. being able to enjoy food 5. stop chasing the high from purging getting drunk high 6. self harm and intoxicants is wrong in my religion 7. i can focuse more on my religion this is not recovery 1. switching binge eating for alcohol 2. making good meals and enjoy them but still purge 4. eating well at parents to make them happy but b p alone in my apartment

feeling like recovery is too easy, or like i was never 'sick enough'?. so, to establish some background for myself. first things first: i'm eighteen and a cis guy, and i've been dealing with anorexia for, if my snapchat memories are to be believed, about a year now. i don't know how it started, in all honesty. i don't know if i made the conscious decision to begin starving myself one day, but that seems to be the case. when i was at my worst, i went days on end without eating anything not naming how long that was for obvious reasons , and when i'd deemed myself fit, i'd have a small bite to eat. again, i will not be saying how many calories for obvious reasons. i remember going to the gp at my lowest and them telling me if i continued on i'd be diagnosed with anorexia nervosa in hindsight, i cannot fathom why i wasn't diagnosed there and then, my weight, eating habits, and over exercising should've been more than enough for a formal diagnosis . i never made the mental decision to recover, i didn't go through the motions i am now, i just sorta started eating more, and i don't know if i even had an issue with it. i went back a few times; on all subsequent visits i had gained weight but can't remember what was said regarding the mental portion of the ed, if anything at all. months later and i was still doing this. i remember ordering lunch from caffe nero on a delivery app but ordering nonetheless without issue, ordering and eating a whole pizza without guilt nor an afterthought, grabbing each flavour of starbuck's christmas lattes over the holidays and talking with a friend about our favourites. during this i had started going to the gym, but was not counting calories or anything, though i was still restricting; eating less to compensate, adding up all the calories burned at the end of my cardio, like those habits were clawing their way back. then the same thing happened again, and i fell into the habit of eating less, this time with a larger focus on eating 'clean', a slight interest in calorie calculating, and exercising even more. i'd wake up at 5am, eat overnight oats and a banana, go to the gym and run until i had shin splints, then i'd get home and have homemade jam on toast with fruit. i think i still ate dinner as well i wasn't starving myself as badly, but i was eating well below my bmr, if i had to guess. and recently i started really being inane with my calorie counting. i haven't gone to the gym in a month or so but still haven't been eating enough, i haven't weighed myself in ages either, i sorta stopped after gaining some weight back again. now i'm at the point where i've been researching recovery, i've been trying to eat more the past few days while still counting calories though still eating less than i should and i've been challenging some fears of mine. but i feel like this is too... easy? for me? don't get me wrong; i am unabashedly fucking afraid of gaining weight and to go through this journey, there are so many foods and things that scare me and that i haven't eaten in so long, and there is so much i know i'm going to have to deal with in terms of recovering and my body adapting, i'm already feeling some of them and i don't think i'm even eating close to enough. if it's this... i don't even know. if i'm this ambivalent towards recovering was i ever even sick enough or am i blowing all of this out of proportion?

how to stop comparing my intake to others. i can t help but feel shame and guilt after eating more than others, esp if they re taller or more active than me : i feel as if i m greedy. as if i can t be actually hungry if they re full after that. as if i m just binging bored. my extreme hunger is also mostly mental as well which just reinforces my doubts. now i know that it s technically normal to eat more than others in recovery but idk rlly. i ate more than everyone i know even pre ed and was often shamed for that. i always ate big portions, got dessert after, and snacked a lot. and i just don t get why i want to eat so much rn, i m overweight atp and my hunger is mental. i just can t bring myself to eat more, i try to eat as much as others around me so i don t overeat and hold myself accountable. yet my mind is consumed by food. idk what to do honoring my hunger doesn t seem like a way out bc i did it for more than 4 days, too and it didn t help,, i just gained a ton and am still as mentally hungry as ever. edit : gave into my eh right after i wrote this post how ironic and i feel worse than ever mentally rn either i fully commit to recovery, either i fully relapse and there s no in between for me; and i m honestly extremely conflicted on which option is best. it doesn t seem like it gets better mentally. i tried to stay positive until a certain point, but it became unbearable after a while. i m just stuck in the extreme hunger loop, over the span of forty days i didn t have a single one without extreme hunger. and that certainly sounds more like binging. days 1 17 were a mix of mental and physical hunger, but onwards from day 17 it became mental mainly but i still have the ability to consume large amounts of food that a normal person couldn t which leads me to thinking that my brain who has eating disorder tendencies used recovery as an excuse to switch to another form of an eating disorder, bed. i have all symptoms of binge eating disorder rn, there s no denying that. the eating abnormal amounts of food, the physical discomfort occasionally yet still proceeding to eat , eating in secret because i m shamed for eating a lot , the guilt that comes afterwards, the attempts to restrict the next day, the hatred towards myself, the suicidal thoughts, everything. classic. please do not tell me that this is extreme hunger, i may have had it at first but now i clearly am not experiencing it anymore.

fullness cues lagging. i keep eating past the point of being comfortably full because my body doesn t seem to recognize that it s had more than enough until like 2 minutes after i finish eating. i don t know how to stop this because i m trying to just eat til i m full but this ends up backfiring because it seems my fullness cues are lagging. does anyone else experience this?

should i go to treatment?. title is self explanatory lol, but i'm having a hard time figuring out what to do. i recently graduated college and just moved to a new city to start a new job, right in the middle of a pretty bad relapse. i know i need more support and accountability, but i also don't feel like i can leave my job because i just started and this is an incredible opportunity that i don't want to just throw away. i could potentially do iop with work been looking into within, the virtual program , but i don't know if they'll accept me for iop or if i need to go to res first or if they'd recommend php, which would be really hard to do with work . i've also talked briefly to my parents about treatment and they don't seem to think that going back to res would be helpful my mom said "you always end up back in the same place, you need to learn how to live your life, not live it in treatment and then be thrown back out into the real world" , which makes me think that i might be making a big mistake even thinking about all of this and am going to end up screwing myself over. i've also had some pretty negative experiences in treatment, which makes me scared to trust someone in that position again. i'm planning to apply to medical school next summer to start in the fall two years from now and desperately want recovery, but am really struggling with the internal motivation to make changes myself and feel like my outpatient team hasn't really been able to hold me accountable , especially when it comes to exercise and food. any and all advice is much appreciated, and thank you all so much this probably was super all over the place and i probably left out a lot of things too, so let me know if something i said doesn't make sense and sorry that this was so long.

why is my heart getting worse again. i had a very low hr at my lowest weight and pretty soon after i started recovery it shot up to the 6 s. today i got a physical and ekg done and my heart rate was in the low 5 s, which isn t as bad as my lw, but i m confused how it dropped. even when i was lapsing in june my heart rate stayed in the 6 s. this entire week i ve had extreme hunger and been eating a lot and just got my period back a couple days ago but i also noticed the other day i was getting heart palpitations. they also said i had an enlarged valve or something and that happens when your heart is overworked so now im thinking that my extreme hunger was just fake and all in my head and i was really eating way too much and it damaged my heart. i m just confused and frustrated, the scale keeps going up but my body isn t healing. i was also eating a lot more at the beginning of recovery so why would my heart just now begin to be overworked? i will admit i never gave up exercise, but it wasn t giving me problems at the beginning of recovery so i thought it was fine as long as i ate enough? idk if i should stop exercising now to get this heart stuff under control. according to the scale i ve already overshot although i m sure some of it is water but i m pretty sure even body fat wise i m close to being weight restored. my satiety and fullness cues still haven t returned and it s driving me crazy, other than getting my period i feel like my body is not healing at all despite me honoring my hunger and gaining weight, i just really don t know what to do anymore.

cravings completely switched??. has anyone else s cravings completely switched?? i used to be a diehard savoury person. i love love chocolate and anything chocolate flavoured but never particularly liked sweets and wouldn t eat what i did like too often. i m in a sort of recovery at the moment because i ve just stopped giving a shit and am eating what i want. however, i realised i m not going for savoury food anymore. most of what im eating is sweet. like i ve been chowing down on chocolate weatabix, milkshakes, whole chocolate bars etc. i had kfc for the first time in 7 months and it was so meh. the greggs donut after was banging though. i don t know if it s because i deprived myself of these things, though i never craved them too much but i am on a sweet eating spree. if it s not sweets it s still fruit and shit which is sweet. i will say this fucking british death heatwave may be impacting me though. i haven t been able to eat proper meals because heat death. get your cereal guys, it s really fucking good.

advice needed: how to bounce back from unintentional restricting. i have been in recovery from me ed for about 7 years. i would like to say that i am close to being recovered, but unfortunately that is not the case. i'm getting there though. anyway...the reason for this post is to get some tips on how to bounce back from an unintentional restriction. here's the backstory. my self care is shit. i mean, complete shit. it's particularly bad when i get very busy or stressed. i work in human resources hr generalist and have recently acquired a hr manager my boss who, after a year and a half, still knows jack shit about how to do her job. prior to her arrival, i had no boss and had picked up a lot of the hr management tasks that i had hoped to pass back to another hr manager. however, since my current boss knows nothing after, again, a year and a half of being here, my workload has not been reduced. talks have been had with said manager, however, no progress has been seen. about 2 weeks ago, she coincidentally enough tested positive for covid on monday and would be out of the office the remainder of the week. i say "coincidentally enough" because that was the same week we were rolling out new incentive programs for our employees and meetings were being held at shift meetings which are at 7am and 7pm. well, needless to say, with her being out the task fell to myself and my co worker who is a recruiter with legit problems of her own. and before you say anything ... yes my hr department which consists of me and these 2 ladies is filled with a lot of drama that makes my life seem very boring. anyway, since my hr manager was out, this resulted in very longs days that stretched from 13 15 hours. i'm the type of person that when i get really busy, i legitimately forget to eat and then it gets too far my body is then like "nope ... we're done..prepare to feel our wrath" and then it goes downhill from there. i get exhausted, moody, emotional and any thought of food makes me sick to my stomach. i am then forced to choose the lesser of two evils ... 1 force down some sort of nourishment and risk throwing it back up unintentionally because i feel so icky or 2 continue on this path of no eating for fear of getting sick and sliding down the rabbit hole even farther and feel even more more icky. i have been trying for 2 weeks now to bounce back. i have been trying to eat regularly, even if i only finish half, that's better than none at all, but i'm still struggling. so, my dear redditors who i know have ridden or are riding this insane rollercoaster, can anyone provide me with tips? i was supposed to have a nutritional appointment today, but it got rescheduled for next week, so i'm just trying to keep my head above water until then. thank you in advance

what to do after purging?. hello. so, uh, today didn't go as planned, and i ended up vomiting. i know there are already guides all over the internet on what to do after purging to take care of yourself. but the thing is, i don't have any electrolyte drinks, or baking soda, and all that stuff here at home, sadly and its already late for me to go out : so i would like to ask does anyone have any tips or ideas on what to do after purging if i don't have the abovementioned things? thank you all

is it possible to recover extremely quickly? get ready for a bunch of questions: . this is my first comment ever on reddit so bear with me : . this site has been so informative, helpful and reassuring ever since i stumbled upon it about 6 weeks ago when i started recovery from anorexia. i am 5 6 and maintained a weight of about 1 3 1 7 for 6 years . i suffered from all the symptoms of anorexia light headedness, heart rate going from super low to super high, hair loss, lots of people commenting on my weight , obsessed with food, tired, blue fingers, always cold . anyway, i ve never been formally diagnosed but i always knew this was a huge problem problem and want to be free of it. i started eating much more normally 6 weeks ago and slowed way down on the exercise. surprisingly i feel much less anxious and shockingly unfazed about a 1 pound gain. it s like i just got sick of it all, after years and years and kind of quit, just like that. i really wish i had done this sooner. questions: is this some kind of honeymoon and i m just so relieved to be eating but i will at some point panic? my stomach is insanely loud after i eat. for hours. why? why was my heart rate so wonky? that was a huge factor in me seeking recovery. it could be 39 or 18 on any given day. will it even out as i recover? i ve been reading a lot about extreme hunger and feel weird that i don t have it at all. if anything, i m not really hungry unless i start eating. in the thick of my illness i could easily and frequently eat nothing until 5: pm along with 1 mile runs etc. i just kind of ran on this wired energy that is now gone, but it hasn t really been replaced by hunger? should i expect eh to show up? thanks so much for reading

i feel so defeated tw weight, specific lbs, weight gain . i am a little over a year into recovery and it has been hard as hell. i lost access to my therapist in december because of insurance reasons, so i ve been doing it pretty much all on my own since then. at my lowest weight i was 18 and gt; 154 lbs lt; but through my 2 s i was averaging around gt; 18 19 lbs lt; while still going through periods of restriction. tonight i made the mistake of weighing myself at a friends house. i knew that i had been gaining weight and that in itself was distressing to me, in march or april i weighted gt; 26 lt; and i was shook by how much i gained. but i weighed myself tonight and weighed gt; 282 lt; why am i still gaining weight i feel like it won t ever stop. i know i am supposed to trust my body but this much weight gain feels excessive and that i will soon have more health problems from being obese than i had when i was restricting. please, i just need some support

comparison and possible relapse. i started comparing my intake to those of others and restricting myself due to that again ex. i must be eating either the same amount of food, or less thought i was over this but i m doing this for the last few days i m not honoring my extreme hunger anymore and i m constantly mentally starving. idk if this counts as a relapse since i m still eating well enough like a normal person i guess my stomach is rumbling tho and i m constantly thinking of food. right now, i wanted to say f it to my ed and get a bowl of cereal, but just as i started opening the box i told myself that s enough, everyone already ate and they re full. you re probably bored or binging and despite trying to fight the thoughts i put the box away. i can t bring myself to do this mentally i feel better than ever, in a way? as if i ve accomplished something again, as if i m worthy again, as if i m able to fight off the binge urges and eat like a normal person. which makes me want to continue on with this. i m sorry.

does anyone feel like their body is extremely heavy, like you re carrying a full extra person on your shoulders?. i don t mean weight wise i mean that my body feels like there is a 1 lbs heavy weight on my shoulders. moving is hard, the exhaustion i feel is incredible . sometimes even walking is more than i feel able to handle . i ve gotten scared i have some sort of chronic illness that causes extreme fatigue. anytime i push myself i feel heavy and exhausted.

i might be developing bed and i am actually worried. tl;dr: i had anorexia, restricted for 1 year, quasi recovered for 2, then tried all in like actually all in 2 months ago, since then i have had night binges and i am worried for my physical health. i am not going to lie. i made quite a happy post two month back and i still want to keep up that energy. however, currently i am on a thin line between relapsing and binge eating and i want to get out. my restriction isn't even physical anymore. i fantasise about starving myself once i move out, because i hate my body at the moment. i think i allow myself to eat everything yet i constantly think about food. maybe i give up too easily, but i will try to explain why i think i am heading towards bed 1. i do not count calories, i do not excessively exercise and i do not restrict any type of food except for animal products for which an animal had to be killed ex: whey, gelatin and all meat and fish . 2. these binges are only at night, when i am bored and do not know what to do with my time 3. it is always caused by a fuck all moment or tonight by my stomach feeling like a never ending pit. 4. my body genuinely shouldn't gain any more. i wish i could be like yes yes no problem but gaining more weight would cause horrible bone and muscle pain. it would severely restrict my ability to move and i genuinely do not want this. this is caused by a separate health condition. 5. i feel guilty for eating like this and have started doing it secretly and fantasising about going out and buying everything i want and stuffing myself. which is weird because i have a stash of my favourite food at home. 6. i constantly think about food like i am restricting or something. it has been worse i admit and i am distracted more easily but i might be worse. my mum tells me i am making this up and i still restrict and i honestly do not know any more. i know of extreme hunger and i genuinely believe i had it at the start but currently it feels unnecessary. please do not tell me to just continue eating unhealthy quantities, as i have explained my quality of life will severely decrease with more weight gain. i just want food to be normal, not a mental guilt ridden battle

how to deal with going into residential at a "healthy" weight?. yes, i know "healthy" is a relative term and the weight i'm at is technically not healthy for my body but unfortunately society and sometimes professionals just don't view things these ways anyway, recently i have relapsed with anorexia. the last time i went to treatment i was considered clinically underweight and did the mandatory weight restoration there. during this process i had to be transferred to another facility and at that point my weight was very much at a clinically "healthy" weight but i was still at the weight restoration process because my dietitian at the first clinic believed in health at every size and the dietitian who took on my care at the new center decided to just go along with the previous dietitian. just because i was beyond anxious about stopping the process and trusted the first dietitian a lot even though i knew i was about to be put at a weight i was going to be very uncomfortable at. however this new place was not so kind, i also had the mentality of following my extreme hunger which my first treatment center also encouraged so i asked to eat anytime i was hungry. when i did this at the new center the staff accused me of binge eating and often refused to ask the dietitians if i could have more food or would shame me if i asked for more food saying things like "well you just ate." but then i would see girls who were uw and if they asked for food they never had any troubles. so yeah, after that experience, i am very very scared to go to residential at my current weight. and of course my ed is screaming at me telling me that i don't need it because of x y and z. does anyone have any tips to get over this anxiety? to help deal with this internalized message my ed is telling me that i have to look a certain way to go to residential? i am almost ready to just back out, so i can get worse but i know i can't do that.

anxiety spike when letting go of behaviors. hey there. more recently in the past month i've been genuinely trying to kick my eating disorders ass and have it not be apart of me. i am trying to eat whatever i want no matter the calories and effects that it will change my body. since i've started this my anxiety has seemingly sky rocketed, even causing me to quit my full time job due to the anxiety i have been feeling. i'm pretty sure this anxiety is coming from the "lack of control" feelings my brain is having now that i'm letting my body and food rules go. everyday has been me dealing with anxiety to some degree and having a lot of days where i'm pretty much paralyzed and take naps to stop the uncomfortable feelings. i cant focus often and constantly feel nervous. i moved back into my parents since i feel like i cant work and make money due to my anxiety. its making me feel sad a lot of the days or sometimes hopeless that i wont be able to function and live life. has anyone else experienced this when recovering? were you still able to be successful with recovery and taking your life back? did the anxiety stop or reduce? some context: i'm 19yos m and am in community college it's been summer these past months though i have been having a super hard time trying to find hobbies or do old hobbies. it's been extremely difficult to get myself to do anything or find anything that brings me joy. i'm not on any medication i'm trying to enlist into the airforce so it's not an option right now . i typically do therapy once a week on zoom. i've been in ed treatment for over two years. i have dealt with disordered eating from a young age since puberty essentially and the behaviors only got worse till it became a full blown eating disorder at age 15. i developed a severe binge purge type bulimia when i turned 17 and still have b p episodes maybe 2 3 times a month these days after intense treatment. i am fully committed to recovery and beating the eating disorder.

hitting recovery minimum vs. binge urge. i would like to hear your opinion, if it s better not to react to reactive binge urges, that are not initiated by hunger, despite generally being under an appropriate calorie minimum for recovery in that day? hear me out, before you say that it is mental or extreme hunger. i do have my fair struggle with those as well and i think hence the question that it s not the case this time. but eds can be sneaky, so i just hope for a second opinion. my question comes from occasions that i encountered the last days. because it is summer where i live i stayed out longer than i usually do, which in return led to having dinner way later than i am used to have. i sadly still struggle with time windows and rules around time somewhat. but i still forced myself to eat something. yay i guess. however after finishing my later meals, my ed keeps screaming at me to now screw it gotta love the fuck it mindset , because i already failed and go buy things to binge on. i was not actually hungry or did really wanting to eat anything. it would have been just for a habit i picked up during ed times. i am trying not to trigger anyone with behaviours and thoughts. so i tried practising neural rewiring and not react on the thought and fight the urge. so far so good. the only edge to the whole thing why i am not sure if i am doing the right thing is that at that point i definitely did not hit calorie minimum for the day. which i definitely would, if i allowed myself that binge. but again. in those moments it did not really feel like the times when i actually have mental hunger or hunger at all. what do you think? should i give in to the binge urge just to hit minimums or keep trying to fight the urges?

confused about extreme hunger. hello hello it's my first time writting here, and tbh i've created my reddit account just for this sub, bc i really need some advices opinions, and it feels safe here btw i'm french so sorry for the mistakes vocabulary ok so most of my life, i've been fat, when i was small i was chubby and then after eleven years old i became overweight. i discovered with my recent diagnosis for anorexia that i had binge eating disorder without knowing what that was. at the age of sixteen i was obese according to my bmi. because of lockdown, i stopped eating in between the meals and hadn't free access to food, and lost a bit of weight. but in may 2 21 i still wasn't happy with my weight and started to dieting . i lost a lot of weight way too fastly but bc i was overweight, no one was worrying, they even encouraged me to lose more, always more. by december 2 21, it was very hard mentally to have more than one meal, and i was restricting as much as i could. by january i went to a dietetician and a psychologist. it was hard at start and i kept losing weight until april 2 22, at this time i was really underweight, weak, tired, cold. i was so scared to eating normally bc even when i was having correct big meal, i still felt unsatisfied, i felt like i couldn't control myself around food, i always wanted more. and guess what... that's exactly what happened lmao, i totally lost the control the first time i allowed myself to. the first times extreme hunger kicked in it was the messiest thing ever, i was eating as much as i could, during and between the meal. i was eating chocolate, sandwiches, cakes... i gained a lot of weight. like really. after two month in, i'm at a normal weight, i even look a bit overweight which is not a problem, even if diet culture try to make us believe the opposite i couldn't say my weight bc i don't weight myself anymore, and i'm not sure if i can mention numbers here, but i've nerver seen someone talking about a weight gain as important as mine. with my clothes, i can approximatively guess my weight which seems "healthy" but... extreme hunger still here. every day. before, it was mental physical, i had a constant burning sensation in my throat, and couldn't handle the idea to stay more than 3hours without eat, even when i was physically full. but now... i just never fell full. i honestly have no clue about when to stop eating bc it feels like the food doesn't arrive in my stomach except at some point . i am not hungry for real, just never satisfied or full. always want more. my dietetician told me it was binge eating disorder, and he could be right but has also never heard about extreme hunger. he thinks i should eat more normally now, and warned me about the risk that i'll make my stomach go bigger. the thing is that i had binge eating disorder before. i have restricted for less than one year and i am back to a normal weight. i believed it was extreme hunger, but it seems a bit too much to be this for real. btw i'm eating way more than when i was having bed what do you think ? does someone have a similar story ? and can anyone tell me about the weight gain in eh ? like does it slow down ? ty for reading and for your help, sending love

i ate an entire pizza. it was only a personal sized pizza, but normally i'd stop after a few slices. i'd eaten about half of it and decided i was going to take home the last 3 slices but then i ate them i haven't done that in years, and although i feel a little bit nauseous, i'm so proud of myself.

reached a good weight for myself . but i'm not going to go back to restricting, i'm going to keep eating whatever i want whenever i'm hungry literally don't care if i gain a couple more kilos honestly the number on the scale doesn't even interest me anymore..it's just like hair length. no one cares how long your hair is. gonna keep getting peanut butter without measuring it..gonna keep cutting thicc thicc slices of bread..i love cheese even the fake american cheese and i love having digestive biscuits randomly in the evenings...if i'm hungry again i'll eat another one restricting carbs who??? tell that to the pb banana cheese toast i had this morning didn't even realize i was having 3 former fear foods at once i just thought it was yummy a few months ago i thought i would be in quasi forever, so i'm really happy to be at this stage :dd

dieting vs. disordered eating vs eating disorder help? 17f . tw. hi, i feel like i m really struggling with food, body and exercise, but i don t know if it s enough to need professional help. i know you don t need to be underweight to have an eating disorder but i m not sure if i m unwell enough to seek help or if it s just disordered eating or yo yo dieting. it feels like everyone has a shitty relationship with food, especially teenage girls so i don t know if my behaviours are somewhat commonplace. about 6 months ago i mentioned to my mum about going to the gp but she said that i was yo yo dieting and i should get off of social media. i know you guys can t diagnose but i need help to see if i should book an appointment with the gp. i ve been dieting since i was 13 and am now 17. during this time, i have been either in stretches of calorie restrictions or stretches of binge eating. in my stretches of restrictions, i have no energy, am irritable, food obsessed and don t have my period. i ve probably had about 12 actual periods in my whole life. i calorie count and have to hit my protein goal as well or i feel like a failure. i have lots of memories of hating holidays because i had no energy to take part in activities because i hadn t eaten. i get so hungry during these periods that normal portions of food don t come close to satisfying me. i have to cook for myself as i m scared people will add oils and butter. when i went camping with my family, i cooked all my own food and only ate chicken, rice and salad. however, i do feel confident in my body enough so that my family call me vein for looking in mirrors all the time. i don t eat any processed foods apart from protein powder and spend hours on nutrition subrdeddits. i spend nearly all my time thinking of food, writing shopping lists, reading bodybuilding forums, looking at recipes, watching wieiad and trying to find different macro breakdowns and methods to suppress hunger. i had to quit my part time job as i was getting light headed and weak but couldn t rest. eventually, i reach a breaking point in my restriction and i start binge eating. i don t eat highly palatable foods either just huge quantities of fruit, greek yoghurt, oats, etc but still don t feel full. about every 2 months ill make myself sick from eating so much. when i m binging, my energy levels are so much better but my obsessive food thoughts are still there. if it s a long stretch of binging, i ll regain my period. my self esteem becomes awful though and hate seeing myself in the mirror. in terms of exercise, i have minimum step count of 12k and i weight lift 3 4 times a week. a couple of years ago i used to be way worse with exercise crossfit, running 1 ks and minimum 15k step count . i went to the gp during this time as i hadn t had my period in over a year so they told me to stop running which i did. i feel so trapped by food and my body and there is little space in my head for anything else. i went to the beach yesterday with my friends and we had dirty chips but all i can think about is how guilty i feel for eating them. i would never normally allow myself to eat junk food but there was no other options and it would upset my friends if i didn t eat. i normally don t go out to eat with friends for this reason unless there are calories on the menus. i despise eating in front of other people and it makes me feel incredibly anxious. i have no idea how to eat normally and am constantly terrified of weight gain but binging is causing me to gain weight anyway. i don t see a way out of these cycles. i feel so lost. i have looked into intuitive eating but have no trust in my hunger cues. i think i d just end up binging until i hated my body enough to lose weight again. if i book a gp appointment, i won t be seen for over a month anyway and the cams waiting list is huge. i know so many people have trauma and other far more serious issues so i won t be seen for a very long time. i m worried that i m making it more serious than it actually is and that by focusing on my eating issues makes them spiral. i thought about getting a part time job again to see if i could go private but they require that i m seen by a gp before as i m under 18. any advice would be so so great. i really need somebody to help me out :

how to go on beach trip in recovered overshoot weight up 6 pant sizes body?. i legitimately feel like it won t be enjoyable. it s as if i can t i un know how good it felt to be in a body that felt fatless, and how relaxing it was to be able to wear whatever i want. to not have my thighs touch as i walked around in a bathing suit. maybe i ve never been fully present on any trip i ve been on. admittedly, i m romanticizing this sickness again. recovery is going fine, until my ego steps in and i begin to compare what i look like to what i think i should combine that with the physical sensations of being in fatter, sweatier body in the heat fuck it s all too hard. and its always been hard for me to engage socially: fat, skinny, sober or drunk. it s like the image thing really is hinged into the overall enjoyment of any experience. as if i never enjoyed things or life, i enjoyed control and getting my ego stroked. to sum this up, i don t know how to enjoy something pleasant like a vacation, that brings so much attention to my body i.e. going to the beach . looking for support, i guess.

in and out of recovery. tw: mentions of exercise, rules rituals, side effects of an ed i noticed that i tend to have a big relapse that causes me to spiral and lose appetite and overexercise, and then some weird moment happens where i kind of "wake up" and see that my eating disorder is getting me nowhere, so i say enough is enough and start recovering but only quasi really . i'm just really mad at myself and my brain for making me believe that i've been in recovery for years now and it's only led me to two relapses and recently a happy grace period that still consisted of me running my ass off and not eating past this certain time, or only eating this much of one food and not having anymore for the rest of the day, etc. i really just want to recover, to feel safe again. to feel normal and not like a freakshow walking around with my salad and carrots while everybody else is eating ice cream and having fun. it's like i know what to do, how to do it, and i have the coping mechanisms and techniques to get myself through the rough times, but i just can't seem to jump over that hump and start. i know i need to get better because after this year ends, my life will take a whole new turn hopefully for the best . i'm getting opportunities for this and next year and i want to be present for every single moment of them, and to not have my ed take another year away from me. i can see the consequences of my actions already right now; my sleep is becoming more sporadic, and antsy and feel the need to do everything all at once, and the next minute i sleep my ass off and never feel rejuvenated legit i napped for 4 hours and woke up exhausted . i'm scared of weight gain, but i know that should be the least of my worries right now. tl;dr: i want to gain weight and get healthy again, but there's just a mental block that's causing me to stay in this quasi state. i'm just so lost on how to start.

i want to feel less alone. i ve been in recovery for 9months now and i d like to say that even though i am so much happier and healthier, the thoughts still cloud my mind. it doesn t help that i haven t lost any of the overshoot and have thoughts telling me to lose weight every. single. day. even though i know i cant like stoppppp it. i hate mirrors and pictures that show myself. i just want to be done with this illness because it makes me so jealous that people get to live their days and eat foods and not worry about what they re eating. i wanna feel like a kid again and have no worries. yes i m better but i still have the thoughts. when will it stop for good because grrrrrr

long covid is triggering. i got covid in late december yaay s after being extra cautious the entire pandemic due to a shoddy immune system. it was awful, and now i have long covid. simply leaving my bed is a draining process. for the first 3 months post covid, i'd make a meal usually just grabbing lone ingredients or heating something up and i'd have to take a long nap before eating it because the act of making food was so exhausting i physically couldn't stay awake. i'm doing better now, but definitely still struggling immensely. it feels like i'm still running on 2 . i'm taking it easy, and i've been in recovery this time for a little over a year now... but i'm really struggling mentally right now. making eating food feels like such a chore, and none of my reasons for recovery are present anymore; i can't maintain interpersonal relationships right now, i don't have any free thought space, and my brain fog and fatigue are more exaggerated now than they were at my ed's worst. it really feels like planning buying making eating food is a waste of time and energy. i know it's not, but... it sure feels like it is. i'm so sick of not being able to function. there's so much i want to do, but i can't. my brain keeps feeding me ideas about how giving into my ed is the logical action as it would result in: a having more time and energy to complete daily basic tasks or maybe do something for pleasure, and or b take up my limited thought space enough so my inability to do... anything doesn't bother me as much. any ideas how to cope and not give up recovery? xx

i feel like i made a mistake... ive posted on here before about like moving away for the summer to work. i moved down here about 2 or 3 weeks ago. i really wanted things to be good, but i kind of don't really like my job, and eating isn't going too well. i won't get into specifics, but its going pretty terribly and im finding it extremely difficult to hold myself accountable to eat. ive only been really relapsing for like a week, and i know if i keep it going that ill just end up right back where i was 6 months ago. i don't know what to do. i don't want to move back home, and i don't want to go back to treatment. im not really underweight anymore, so i low key feel like i don't even really need to go back i know that isn't true but my brain is telling me it is and its so hard not to listen . but ive never felt worse. even if i wanted to, ive committed to working this summer and i can't just leave. my dietician, my doctor, my parents all think im doing better. i know i should be honest with them, but i can't me. i guess its really easy for them to think im okay since im no longer underweight.. i hate that it ended up like this. i hate that im so aware of the fact that im self sabotaging. i hate that im not better, and i hate that everyone around me thinks im doing so amazing.

men: what are your body insecurities?. i m curious, i hear men want to be big and bulky, but does that desire differ depending on age, sexuality, etc? i m writing a show about body image and the damaging effects of diet amp; influencer culture and need more of a male perspective. if you have some stories or pov you wouldn t mind me using verbatim i ll leave you anonymous that would be awesome. otherwise, just happy to read some perspectives to shape my writing.

i feel like i will never look sick enough. this is long, sorry. amp; sorry if this breaks the rules. i don t post on reddit. i m honestly only posting this bc i keep waking up from being too hungry. if it breaks the rules pls just delete it but don t ban me ? ty : my body refuses to look sick enough in the right ways for people to think i really have an eating disorder. my eyes have dark circles, my cheeks are sunken, my salivary glands are swollen, and my knuckles are scarred. but the rest of my body? nope. i turned 3 last week. my ed started when i was like 12. i kind of think that bc of that my body still holds weight like it did before puberty. when i was 15 a boy told me i had double boobs when we were making out bc i had some fat on my ribcage. when i was 2 i was working out with a friend amp; he told me i gain weight like a dude bc i mostly gain weight in my abdomen, but not in my legs. one of my friends recently tweeted ab how she hates that people tell her they re jealous of her body, but they don t know she has an eating disorder. i ve kind of always told myself she didn t, bc she knows i have one and never brought hers up, and i wanted to tell myself her body was just naturally perfect. bc if she did have an eating disorder, then mine wasn t bad enough. i m jealous of her body, even more now knowing she has an ed. another one of my friends recovered from anorexia. she was sick for around 6 years, visibly sick for around 3. im on year 18. my eating disorder could fucking vote. it could buy a gun. it could sign a lease, check itself out of a psych hold. it s an adult. it s not visibly sick though. i hit puberty and grew breasts. i got my period, and i get it sometimes. my hips got wide to carry children that i don t want because they ll make me gain weight. i have a thigh gap as long as i stay thin enough, because i still gain weight like a dude. my legs will stay small and my hips keep them far apart. the irony isn t lost on me. for years i ve been told by doctors that the only reason i haven t had a seizure is because i take lamictal an antiepileptic to manage bipolar disorder. earlier this year, for the first time i willingly tried to get inpatient treatment. i spent months trying, but it s not an option with medicaid where i live. i m way too much of a risk to authorize a single case agreement for iop or php. i ve passed out and hit my head, the er visit would get covered if i hit it hard enough for that. but not inpatient. living with an eating disorder is such a fucking joke. dying with one is the reality. the world doesn t take it seriously unless you look sick enough for concern. tldr i wish i looked sick enough, i wish i wasn t sick, i wish i hadn t wasted so much of my life on this.

i can't tell if i have an ed or not.... to start i know this isn't a healthy mindset exactly but i'm trying to puzzle out whether i should pay a therapist or someone for help, i can't really afford to unless i really need it and it's hard from online resources to figure out if this needs handling or not. i definitely had eating issues as a teen, i'm a trans man and when i was younger i was trying for "force" myself into femininity, and that included weight loss. i calorie counted and ate probably around 11 calories a day and worked out on an exercise bike almost every night. i think most of my lunches at school consisted of water and cucumber salads. i've been 5'6" since i was like 14, and i weighed around 115lbs at the height of this obsession at 17 years old. in college i sort of reversed that, snacking a ton and gaining a bunch of weight. i was around 16 for a couple years. i started calorie counting again because i "felt fat" and didn't like how i looked in pictures even though it wasn't really "fat" by conventional standards. i've tried to balance since then. i try not to eat too much at meals or overindulge in snacks, without restricting to only vegetables or anything. but recently i can tell i've gained weight and i think i'm spiraling. i keep comparing my body to my cis male partner, because though he is much taller, he does not have the same "shape" if that makes sense, i feel rounder than him and it bothers me from a weight perspective and a gender perspective of trying to pass as male without big hips or thighs. i work a fairly active job, its around 2 25 hours a week of working at a pet daycare where i am constantly walking, cleaning, handling dogs, etc, and never sitting down. i eat a little more on work days cuz, well, i'm hungry, but now i'm wondering if i'm indulging too much because "oh well i've been working all day so its fine." everything online about eds is either mostly focused on young women girls, or about specific disorders like anorexia or bulimia that i am sure i don't have. and i hate trying to get health advice about eating because it focuses so much on cisgender men or women and i can't tell what advice is helpful for me, a trans man. should i eat less because i'm afab? should it be more because i've been on testosterone for a few years and my hormones aren't the same now? i can't tell. lately i feel like i should lose the weight i've gained and my automatic idea for this is to go back to 12 calories a day like i used to do as a teen. i know thats not a good amount, but when i estimate that i've eaten much more than that in a day, i feel like i'm eating too much. anyone with objective insight who could throw their thoughts in would be appreciated.

new to recovery and lots of questions . hi, so i'm very new to recovery and it feels surreal but it seems like the only way to go about this really is to eat lots more and not compensate for it . everything feels super overwhelming and i'm having a hard time believing this but i'm really committed and have a few questions. what has been the worst part for you and when is the worst over? is there any way to get this over with faster? how do you know if you're doing the right thing? when did things start to go uphill? is this really going to fix the obsessive thoughts about food? i'm just dreaming about the day i won't be thinking about my next meal or visualizing food 24 7 and sort of get a life back. lastly, do you think it's a good idea to join a community such as this one? i'm just worried it might be triggering or that it would keep me even more obsessed with all of the strange things happening to me. sorry for all the questions, it's just so precious to hear from others who went through something similar and any comment is appreciated from the bottom of my heart. thank you and have a blessed day

my job shouldn t have to know my fucking weiggt. i m waiting for my physical appointment for my new job. i m gonna refuse, flat out, to be weighed, or to have anything about my weight build put on the outtake sheet thing. we ll see if they actually listen to me. why the fuck would my job need to know my bmi? they don t; it s just a dumbshit thing that happens at physicals. my job doesn t need to know my weight; yeah, my body sucks amp; my life would be better if i didn t look like this, but no matter what, i m gonna play bingo with elderly people the same way. what re they gonna do, bar me from doing painting group with dementia patients bc my stomach isn t completely flat? revoke my cpr certification bc i have thick fucking thighs? they d fucking better not. i don t even want to know my weight; why should other motherfuckers get to know it? that seems wrong, amp; it is wrong. amp; if they pressure me into telling them my weight, or if they guess my weight, i will have a fucking breakdown.

i do not understand. tw: calories, numbers and weight i posted yesterday that i was going to eat everything i had been craving just to calm down my eh. i had 2 massive donuts, a cinnabon, 2 pints of ice cream, a frozen pizza, mac and cheese, chocolate, a fish thing, a chocolate cake, a cookie, a mcflurry, froyo and two ham and cheese toasts. i calculated everything and it was 1 , cals. i woke up today and had lost weight. i don t understand. it makes no sense. yes i walked quite a bit yestorday to calm my anxiety around eating this much, but it still makes no sense.

i think i can finally say i ve recovered. tldr: after over 5 years of eds i ve finally gotten to a point where i can say i ve recovered. it s been so freeing and i ve regained things like hunger cues that i thought i would never gain back again. recovering is genuinely so worth it and has taken such a weight off my shoulders. if you d like to ask anything or would like advice please feel free :d ive dealt with multiple mental illnesses disorders in the past and still do but the one that affected me the most was definitely my eds. i mainly dealt with binging and restricting for around 5 years along with pretty bad body dysmorphia that i m still working through to this day. i thought i d never get better and didn t want to get better for the longest time but since i took the steps to just go all in and finally give my body everything it needed i have so much less anxiety and feel so much more free. it s been around 2 years since i started fully recovering and i m finally at a place where my body and mind feel healthy. i actually have my hunger and fullness cues again which i thought i d never get back and can open packages without feeling the need to finish it all in one go. the times where i do eat too much, i rarely feel guilty about it and i just sleep it off. not only that but i thought i d gain a bunch of weight in recovery which was true initially as i went all in but after about a year and a half in i stepped on the scale and i m pretty much back to my normal weight that i was at when i was binging and restricting except now i m not going through mental hell worrying about food and calories. some things have still stuck with me like the occasional thoughts of how it would be nice to be skinny again for certain events but since i changed my mindset from wanting to look small to wanting to look strong and healthy i find that my life has genuinely become so much less stressful. i find i m still really easily upset and sensitive to anything regarding dieting, eds or calories and have a lot of paranoia that people around me are lying and trying to hide their own eds but i m slowly working on that and have many years of self improvement to go.

finding it difficult to eat. tw? just mentions of weight amp; food my parents have people over for something work related and they re usually stay over till 8 am to 4 pm and i ve been finding it hard to find time to eat. i get uncomfortable and nervous whenever there s other people around me that i don t know. because of this i cant make food and eat. it s so difficult, i m trying to gain weight but because of this situation and my social anxiety i just can t, so i end up losing weight again. i end up not eating during the day and eating most of my cals during dinner which leaves me uncomfortably bloated at night.

new to recovery. i m about a week into ana recovery and my mum is in charge of all my meals. the dietitian told me my minimum is 3 calories a day and i agreed. i track my calories still trying to stop but struggling and despite eating 3 meals and 3 snacks a day the food my mum is giving me is only coming in at around 16 19 cals a day. i don t have a scale at home and am currently at home isolating for covid so i haven t weighed myself but i don t think i ve gained anything but i have an appointment in 3 days with the doctor for a weigh in and they are expecting me to have gained at least 1 kg since my last weigh in. i doubt that i have made that target and i actually think i might have lost some but i am eating all my meals and snacks so i don t think it s my fault but they said that if i don t reach my target than i will be punished won t be cleared for upcoming vacation, no adhd meds etc. this is a vent but does anyone have any advice because im literaly eating everything

i can't stop eating and i'm scared. i have felt especially out of control around food for almost a month now, but the last two weeks have been particularly bad. i went on a weekend trip in which my eating schedule was different from normal i.e eating in restaurants and having more sweets and i haven t seemed to be able to get back to my regular routine. i wake up every day with an idea of what i will eat and how much; however, by mid afternoon or early evening, i find myself feeling hungry almost all of the time and totally blow past what i had planned and eat much more. as an example, here is what i ate throughout the day today censored with spoilers for obvious reasons : amp; x2 b; gt; 3 tbsp of peanut butter lt; gt; 1 4 cup of blueberries lt; gt; 1 2 of a pumpkin loaf slice from starbucks lt; gt; a lot of watermelon i didn t measure it but at least four cups for sure lt; gt; 1 hard boiled egg lt; gt; almost 2 full fudge frosted brownies from the grocery store, 18 calories each lt; gt; 2 and a half cups of plain pasta lt; most of the carbohydrates came later in the day which is typical for me. i am always able to stop eating once i reach fullness but i always feel so much shame especially when i find myself eating this much by 3 pm or so and the hunger keeps coming back again and again. i don't think that it's extreme hunger because i'm over a year into an recovery. my stomach and face bloat so much that i almost look like a different person. all of this eating is beginning to reflect on the scale, too, and my exercise isn t changing anything. i am about two pounds heavier than i was at the beginning of june and the number just seems like it will continue to go up which is so upsetting to me because i am not in a place where i need or want to gain weight. on the contrary, i should probably lose a small bit of weight as i feel very uncomfortable in my body right now. my family and friends tell me that they can t tell that i m gaining weight and that i m not overeating, but 1 i can see how different i look now and 2 i really do think that i m eating too much and may even have bed now based on the sheer amounts of food i am eating every day. my therapist has stated that i do not have bed since i am eating in response to hunger rather than emotions i rarely if ever comfort eat and am aware of my fullness, but it is hard for me to believe. i know that i was very sick, but i honestly miss when i had the ability to control my hunger. right now i am in such an embarrassing rut that just keeps making me cry out of disgust and shame.

i had a tantrum over wrong food order. my brother wanted to get me some fast food and i told him what i would like to have and when he came home i found out he got me wrong items and i got so upset that i swore i wouldn t eat ever again. this kind of behaviour is new to me and i can t understand why i got so upset over food. it makes me feel like a savage who is fighting for their every meal.

weight redistribution in my stomach is seriously messing with my recovery.. i m over a year into my recovery and i ve been weight restored for almost as long. i m not interested in losing weight as far as numbers on the scale goes, but i m having so much difficulty with having a disproportionate amount of belly fat and bloat for my body. i workout, i eat well, i try and take care of myself. the rest of my body is proportionate, but my stomach is significantly larger than its ever been. i look six or seven months pregnant almost all of the time when i m bloated, it s insanely bad. it s so uncomfortable and, honestly, embarrassing. it s heartbreaking to see myself in the mirror and sometimes, it really has me second guessing my recovery. my self esteem is shot and i m too scared to date because i can t imagine trying to get naked around someone. i m scared this is just my life now. even though i exercise, it doesn t budge. i don t have unreasonable expectations about my fitness i don t expect to look like a model or have a flat stomach. i m okay with all other aspects of recovery, but i don t want to look pregnant anymore. it s already been over a year when the hell does this stop?

seeking advice guidance. hi, i think i have an eating disorder disordered eating and started seeing a dietitian just last week. i wanted to reach out to this community and hopefully to people who had a similar experience or overcame their disordered eating, i would really appreciate any guidance : my dietitian recommended eating every few hours, and what ended up happening is that every time i start eating i get into this "mode" where i never feel satisfied. i've had this really strong mental urge to eat really, really large amounts of food over the past week especially at night even though i feel very full physically. and so i ended up eating all of this food and responding to my cravings because i felt so tired and sad of denying myself food and i thought i would try things differently for once. but i feel very afraid, i didn't want to give in to the anxiety and post about it but i would really want to know if this is normal and if i messed up and set myself back. i stopped counting calories because i think it would just make me even more anxious, but i would say it must have been around 3 calories or so a day, more or less. what makes me feel the most worried is that i don't feel well physically, i am tired and full and haven't been sleeping well. it's like i'm very hungover even though i didn't drink and like i've been doing something very wrong. should i stop responding to the cravings and urge to eat so much and be more reasonable even though it feels very difficult in the moment ? or is this normal and should i listen to what my brain is saying? would you have any advice? i really, really want to get better and would love to hear from you guys. i've felt alone for so long going through this and am opening up about it for the first time recently, and i really hope to pass it forward and help others out in the future as well once i am able to do so. thank you for even just reading this and i wish you all the best, whoever you may be.

coping with weight gain. the fact that i am even making this post makes me sad. i get so proud of people on here when i read their posts because i know the end result and having a great relationship with food is amazing and so freeing. but this post is bittersweet because i am not a few weeks into recovery, i would say im over a year into recovery and truly i haven t thought about how much i m eating or what i m eating for a long while. i noticed my face and body changed but never thought much of it because i thought i was over all that. it became a non factor in my life. but recently i decided to get rid of my sick clothes, they have grown too tight on me and i ve decided now is the best time to donate everything. i did, however, weigh myself for the first time in 2 years and was ultimately shocked. it s made me upset when i know it shouldn t and i really don t want to relapse or restrict. i was wondering if anyone had advice on coping with this, ways to appreciate my body and all it does for me, any things that might help me continue to eat and gain weight and not only be okay with it, but be happy with it. i feel like that is the only thing i have yet to figure out. any help will do.

is it possible to get recovery symptoms with a small relapse? tw . i had a pretty severe ed with restriction from the ages of 17 22 and was very low weight and unwell at the time. i recovered and experienced extreme hunger, gastrointestinal upset, fatigue etc. and was pretty much good until the age of 25 when i relapsed in november 2 2 tw numbers so since relapsing about a year and a half ago, i really have been only like 5 1 lbs underweight, but noticeably so to other in my life and had people point out i looked unhealthy. i also experienced mood and hormonal problems. now that i ve been dedicating myself to weight gain again the last two months, i ve gained about 5lbs and eat very consistently, i ve been so incredibly exhausted and think about food constantly. i think what i m asking is a small relapse like this able to produce the effects and symptoms i m now experiencing? the brain fog and fatigue makes me wonder if another health issue is happening or if this is related to my restriction over the last 1.5 years? any personal experiences would help me, i have a therapist and psych but they don t seem to offer much insight on what to physically expect. thank you so much

i need some guidance. i m not sure if i m allowed to post this here but i need some advice from people who also struggle in similar ways. i don t do this usually so please correct me if i ve wrote anything wrong, thank you : i ve had difficulties with eating my whole life, i ve always been very fussy with my food and the food that i do eat is very limited, and i have a bad relationship with food in general. my mom always tells me how i need to expand the food i eat because i m storing health problems for myself in the future, which i am concerned about but i have a fear of trying new foods. even though i know nothing will happen if i try new foods, for some reason i m terrified when it comes to it, and just avoid it completely. so that s a problem, but in recent years maybe since 2 2 ? i ve started restricting myself too, and i ve got to a point where it s become difficult to stop. food completely consumes my mind, i m always worried about how much i m eating, and calculating what i can eat in a day, and setting a cut off time for when i m not allowed anymore food. i ve briefly spoke to doctors, but in all honesty, when they ve asked questions i haven t been truthful with my answers because it s an upsetting topic for me, so now i m not really sure if i need help or not because it s likely that i m not that severe. the thing is it feels severe in my mind, because it s constantly on my mind and living the rest of my life like this is a miserable thought, but i can t see myself getting any help from doctors because my life isn t in danger. i m not underweight but my weight has decreased and i m worried about it. it just seems as though doctors will only provide adequate help if i am underweight. so yeah, in retrospect i m asking if anybody knows how i can begin to combat this? i feel isolated and unsure as to what to do when it comes to this, and i want to sort myself out, i just don t know how. if anyone does reply, thank you and i really appreciate it.

translucent teeth. this is really hard for me to post, as it is by far my biggest insecurity. i 21f have struggled with bulimia for roughly 6 years now. it s gotten better over time, but i still find myself struggling a lot. because of frequent purging, the tips of my teeth have become translucent. it is my biggest insecurity. i hate my smile. has anyone else here struggled with this?

struggling to stay committed. i m on my 8th week of recovery. things were going well. i was able to honor my mental hunger, even when it scared me and resulted in me consuming far more food every day than i ever have. i was feeling more and more at peace about resting not exercising. i was able to move further away from my safe foods and try more and more fear foods different foods. and i was able to gain weight. i don t know how much because we threw out the scale. it s not been enough weight to need new clothes yet, but my clothes definitely do fit differently and a lot tighter now. i have noticed my resolve and my hunger changing though, and i am worried about it. i like the way i look now, and i think my ed is sneaking back in because i m becoming fearful again of gaining more weight. it was easier to not fear weight gain as much when i knew i looked a bit sickly. but now that i look less sickly, people have commented on how pretty and healthy i look. and i m scared to continue pushing myself as hard as i have been in recovery out of fear of gaining more weight. i m scared of what other people will say if i continue past this current weight if they will think i ve gone too far put on too much weight should have kept my weight as it is now. and i m scared of what i will think of myself too if i will regret not just staying at this weight. but i know i m not free of my ed yet. i haven t changed and or challenged all my ed behaviors and fear foods. i know i m not done with recovery. i m only 5 days in, there s just no way. but i do worry, because i m barely having mental or physical hunger anymore. even though i know i m fearing further weight gain now, i know i would respond to my hunger if i was experiencing it, just like i have been the last 7 weeks but it s not really there. and i don t know if that s due to my body or due to my ed fear. food is kinda boring to me now and i often just don t want to eat sometimes out of fear, but often just because i don t want to eat. it s like some switch flipped in my brain and my mind is saying, that was fun. you re all better now. again, i know that can t be true i know i m not recovered yet. but i m not ignoring my hunger or cravings i just don t really have them right now. and that scares me because i don t know if that s my ed returning and my resolve breaking or if it s my body being in a happy place. but i know the fear of weight gain is re emerging in a big way now that my weight appearance may go beyond what i m comfortable with. and i know that s highly disordered. recovery is just so fucking hard. i know i can t let my guard down now in this phase of recovery. all of this may just be my ed fighting its hardest to stay alive. i have to stay committed and keep fighting for freedom in the areas i know i still need to challenge. if that leads to more weight gain, i ll have to learn to be ok with that. because full freedom is ultimately what i want.

help please question about refeeding disorder hypermetabolic syndrome. i am recovering from significant weight loss and am about 3 months into the process of upping calories. i was wondering how you can tell if you re at risk for refeeding syndrome still versus just hypermetabolism. i don t know how long the risk of refeeding syndrome is present for. i know i m in hypermetabolic because i m going through over 1 grams of potassium a day and my magnesium needs are high..they always were though and i was deficient for awhile. i m experiencing spasms and some glucose drops but not consistent. i thought i was at the point where i can increase calories a little more liberally now and i m not gaining weight still at 25 calories. i m just afraid of inducing refeeding syndrome. i ve also been restricting carbohydrates to 3 grams a day because i heard to keep them restricted. i don t know if this applies anymore at this stage. i also am eating low fat because gallstones were found but they are tiny so i was told they wouldn t block the duct if they pass through..but i imagine if enough passed through at once..who knows. i can t find consistent information about how to eat when you have small gallstones. any advice about any of this would be greatly appreciated. i m not sure what i should be doing at this stage and resources seem slim. no doctor in my area seems to know much about any of this and all they ve told me is that if serum phosphorus checks out, that s the only thing that matters..that does not seem accurate.

i can t believe what i just did. i can t believe i did what i did. i just 1 rested. i ate hours and hours earlier than usual. i didn t go out and walk for hours heck, i didn t even do anything productive. i just browsed my phone and ate a ton of food. i can t believe it. i ate everything i usually would plus gnocchi soup, a homemade brownie i made, and apple and peanut butter, and now i m eating a huge bowl of oatmeal that i drenched in maple syrup and peanut butter and topped with granola. i feel really scared but also really proud and even relieved? maybe i can do this again. the amount of anxiety is so much less when i m not pushing my body to its absolute max.
